וּמֵאַחַר דְּנָפְקָא לֵיהּ מֵ״אַחַת לְאַחַת לִמְצֹא חֶשְׁבּוֹן״, ״כִּי כׇל סְאוֹן סֹאֵן בְּרַעַשׁ״ לְמָה לִי? לְכַמִּדָּה.
וּמֵאַחַר דְּנָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״כִּי כׇל סְאוֹן סֹאֵן בְּרַעַשׁ״, ״בְּסַאסְּאָה בְּשַׁלְּחָהּ תְּרִיבֶנָּה״ לְמָה לִי?
לְכִדְרַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא. דְּאָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא: אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נִפְרָע מִן הָאוּמָּה עַד שְׁעַת שִׁילּוּחָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּסַאסְּאָה בְּשַׁלְּחָהּ וְגוֹ׳״.

אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: שָׁלֹשׁ(ה) כּוֹסוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בְּמִצְרַיִם, לָמָּה? אַחַת שֶׁשָּׁתָת בִּימֵי מֹשֶׁה, וְאַחַת שֶׁשָּׁתָת בִּימֵי פַּרְעֹה נְכֹה, וְאַחַת שֶׁעֲתִידָה לִשְׁתּוֹת עִם חַבְרוֹתֶיהָ!

וְכִי תֵּימָא הָנָךְ אֲזַדוּ וְהָנֵי אַחֲרִינֵי נִינְהוּ — וְהָתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מִנְיָמִין גֵּר הַמִּצְרִי הָיָה לִי חָבֵר מִתַּלְמִידֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אָמַר מִנְיָמִין גֵּר הַמִּצְרִי: אֲנִי מִצְרִי רִאשׁוֹן, וְנָשָׂאתִי מִצְרִית רִאשׁוֹנָה, אַשִּׂיא לִבְנֵי מִצְרִית שְׁנִיָּה כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא בֶּן בְּנִי מוּתָּר לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל!

אֶלָּא אִי אִיתְּמַר הָכִי אִיתְּמַר: אָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא: אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נִפְרָע מִן הַמֶּלֶךְ עַד שְׁעַת שִׁילּוּחוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּסַאסְּאָה בְּשַׁלְּחָהּ תְּרִיבֶנָּה וְגוֹ׳״.

אַמֵּימָר מַתְנֵי לְהָא דְּרַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא אַהָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי אֲנִי ה׳ לֹא שָׁנִיתִי וְאַתֶּם בְּנֵי יַעֲקֹב לֹא כְלִיתֶם״? ״אֲנִי ה׳ לֹא שָׁנִיתִי״ — לֹא הִכֵּיתִי לְאוּמָּהּ וְשָׁנִיתִי לָהּ. ״וְאַתֶּם בְּנֵי יַעֲקֹב לֹא כְלִיתֶם״ — הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״חִצַּי אֲכַלֶּה בָּם״. חִצַּי כָּלִין, וְהֵן אֵינָן כָּלִין.
אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נִפְרָע מִן הָאָדָם עַד שֶׁתִּתְמַלֵּא סְאָתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בִּמְלֹאות שִׂפְקוֹ יֵצֶר לוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.

דָּרֵשׁ רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״רַנְּנוּ צַדִּיקִים בַּה׳ לַיְשָׁרִים נָאוָה תְהִלָּה״? אַל תִּקְרֵי ״נָאוָה תְהִלָּה״, אֶלָּא ״נָוֶה תְהִלָּה״, זֶה מֹשֶׁה וְדָוִד, שֶׁלֹּא שָׁלְטוּ שׂוֹנְאֵיהֶם בְּמַעֲשֵׂיהֶם.

דָּוִד — דִּכְתִיב: ״טָבְעוּ בָאָרֶץ שְׁעָרֶיהָ״. מֹשֶׁה — דְּאָמַר מָר: מִשֶּׁנִּבְנָה מִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן נִגְנַז אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד, קְרָשָׁיו קְרָסָיו וּבְרִיחָיו וְעַמּוּדָיו וַאֲדָנָיו. הֵיכָא? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר אֲבִימִי: תַּחַת מְחִילּוֹת שֶׁל הֵיכָל.

תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: סוֹטָה נָתְנָה עֵינֶיהָ בְּמִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לָהּ, מַה שֶּׁבִּיקְּשָׁה — לֹא נִיתַּן לָהּ, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדָהּ — נְטָלוּהוּ מִמֶּנָּה. שֶׁכׇּל הַנּוֹתֵן עֵינָיו בְּמַה שֶּׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ — מַה שֶּׁמְבַקֵּשׁ אֵין נוֹתְנִין לוֹ, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדוֹ — נוֹטְלִין הֵימֶנּוּ.

וְכֵן מָצִינוּ בְּנָחָשׁ הַקַּדְמוֹנִי, שֶׁנָּתַן עֵינָיו בְּמַה שֶּׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לוֹ — מַה שֶּׁבִּיקֵּשׁ לֹא נָתְנוּ לוֹ, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדוֹ נְטָלוּהוּ מִמֶּנּוּ. אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי יְהֵא מֶלֶךְ עַל כׇּל בְּהֵמָה וְחַיָּה, וְעַכְשָׁיו ״אָרוּר הוּא מִכׇּל הַבְּהֵמָה וּמִכֹּל חַיַּת הַשָּׂדֶה״.

אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי יְהַלֵּךְ בְּקוֹמָה זְקוּפָה, עַכְשָׁיו — ״עַל גְּחוֹנוֹ יֵלֵךְ״. אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי יְהֵא מַאֲכָלוֹ מַאֲכַל אָדָם, עַכְשָׁיו — ״עָפָר יֹאכַל״. הוּא אָמַר אֶהֱרוֹג אֶת אָדָם וְאֶשָּׂא אֶת חַוָּה, עַכְשָׁיו — ״אֵיבָה אָשִׁית בֵּינְךָ וּבֵין הָאִשָּׁה וּבֵין זַרְעֲךָ וּבֵין זַרְעָהּ״.

וְכֵן מָצִינוּ בְּקַיִן וְקֹרַח וּבִלְעָם וְדוֹאֵג וַאֲחִיתוֹפֶל וְגֵחֲזִי וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם וַאֲדוֹנִיָּהוּ וְעוּזִּיָּהוּ וְהָמָן — שֶׁנָּתְנוּ עֵינֵיהֶם בְּמַה שֶּׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לָהֶם. מַה שֶּׁבִּיקְּשׁוּ — לֹא נִיתַּן לָהֶם, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדָם — נְטָלוּהוּ מֵהֶם.

בַּיָּרֵךְ הִתְחִילָּה בַּעֲבֵירָה וְכוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּתֵת ה׳ אֶת יְרֵכֵךְ נוֹפֶלֶת וְאֶת בִּטְנֵךְ צָבָה״ — וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְצָבְתָה בִטְנָהּ וְנָפְלָה יְרֵכָהּ״?

אֲמַר אַבָּיֵי: כִּי לָיֵיט — לָיֵיט תְּחִילָּה יָרֵךְ, וַהֲדַר בֶּטֶן לָיֵיט, וּמַיָּא כִּי בָּדְקִי — כִּי אוֹרְחַיְיהוּ בָּדְקִי, בֶּטֶן בְּרֵישָׁא וַהֲדַר יָרֵךְ. בִּקְלָלָה נָמֵי כְּתִיב: ״לַצְבּוֹת בֶּטֶן וְלַנְפִּל יָרֵךְ״! הָהוּא דְּמוֹדַע לַהּ כֹּהֵן דְּבֶטֶן בְּרֵישָׁא וַהֲדַר יָרֵךְ, שֶׁלֹּא לְהוֹצִיא לַעַז עַל מַיִם הַמָּרִים.
מַתְנִי׳ שִׁמְשׁוֹן הָלַךְ אַחַר עֵינָיו — לְפִיכָךְ נִקְּרוּ פְּלִשְׁתִּים אֶת עֵינָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאחֲזוּהוּ פְלִשְׁתִּים וַיְנַקְּרוּ אֶת עֵינָיו״.

אַבְשָׁלוֹם נִתְגָּאָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְלָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ. וּלְפִי שֶׁבָּא עַל עֶשֶׂר פִּלַגְשֵׁי אָבִיו — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְּנוּ בּוֹ עֶשֶׂר לוֹנְבִיּוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיָּסֹבּוּ עֲשָׂרָה אֲנָשִׁים נוֹשְׂאֵי כְּלֵי יוֹאָב״. וּלְפִי שֶׁגָּנַב שָׁלֹשׁ גְּנֵבוֹת: לֵב אָבִיו, וְלֵב בֵּית דִּין, וְלֵב יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְגַנֵּב אַבְשָׁלוֹם אֶת לֵב אַנְשֵׁי יִשְׂרָאֵל״ — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְקְעוּ בּוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁבָטִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקַּח שְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁבָטִים בְּכַפּוֹ וַיִּתְקָעֵם בְּלֵב אַבְשָׁלוֹם״.

וְכֵן לְעִנְיַן הַטּוֹבָה: מִרְיָם הִמְתִּינָה לְמֹשֶׁה שָׁעָה אַחַת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתֵּתַצַּב אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵרָחוֹק״ — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְעַכְּבוּ לָהּ יִשְׂרָאֵל שִׁבְעָה יָמִים בַּמִּדְבָּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָעָם לֹא נָסַע עַד הֵאָסֵף מִרְיָם״.

יוֹסֵף זָכָה לִקְבּוֹר אֶת אָבִיו, וְאֵין בְּאֶחָיו גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּעַל יוֹסֵף לִקְבֹּר אֶת אָבִיו וַיַּעֲלוּ עִמּוֹ גַּם רֶכֶב גַּם פָּרָשִׁים״. מִי לָנוּ גָּדוֹל מִיּוֹסֵף, שֶׁלֹּא נִתְעַסֵּק בּוֹ אֶלָּא מֹשֶׁה.

מֹשֶׁה זָכָה בְּעַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף, וְאֵין בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקַּח מֹשֶׁה אֶת עַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף עִמּוֹ״ — מִי גָּדוֹל מִמֹּשֶׁה שֶׁלֹּא נִתְעַסֵּק בּוֹ אֶלָּא הַמָּקוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקְבֹּר אוֹתוֹ בַּגַּי״. לֹא עַל מֹשֶׁה בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא עַל כׇּל הַצַּדִּיקִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָלַךְ לְפָנֶיךָ צִדְקֶךָ כְּבוֹד ה׳ יַאַסְפֶךָ״.

גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שִׁמְשׁוֹן בְּעֵינָיו מָרַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר שִׁמְשׁוֹן אֶל אָבִיו אוֹתָהּ קַח לִי כִּי הִיא יָשְׁרָה בְעֵינָי״ — לְפִיכָךְ נִקְּרוּ פְּלִשְׁתִּים אֶת עֵינָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאחֲזוּהוּ פְלִשְׁתִּים וַיְנַקְּרוּ אֶת עֵינָיו״.
אִינִי? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְאָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ לֹא יָדְעוּ כִּי מֵה׳ הִיא״. כִּי אֲזַל מִיהָא — בָּתַר יַשְׁרוּתֵיהּ אֲזַל.

תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: תְּחִילַּת קִלְקוּלוֹ בְּעַזָּה, לְפִיכָךְ לָקָה בְּעַזָּה. תְּחִילַּת קִלְקוּלוֹ בְּעַזָּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּלֶךְ שִׁמְשׁוֹן עַזָּתָה וַיַּרְא שָׁם אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה וְגוֹ׳״, לְפִיכָךְ לָקָה בְּעַזָּה דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיּוֹרִידוּ אוֹתוֹ עַזָּתָהּ״.
וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּרֶד שִׁמְשׁוֹן תִּמְנָתָה״? תְּחִלַּת קִלְקוּלוֹ מִיהָא בְּעַזָּה הֲוָה.

״וַיְהִי אַחֲרֵי כֵן וַיֶּאֱהַב אִשָּׁה בְּנַחַל שֹׂרֵק וּשְׁמָהּ דְּלִילָה״. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אִילְמָלֵא לֹא נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ ״דְּלִילָה״ — רְאוּיָה הָיְתָה שֶׁתִּקָּרֵא דְּלִילָה: דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת כֹּחוֹ, דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת לִבּוֹ, דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת מַעֲשָׂיו.

דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת כֹּחוֹ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּסַר כֹּחוֹ מֵעָלָיו״. דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת לִבּוֹ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתֵּרֶא דְּלִילָה כִּי הִגִּיד לָהּ אֶת כׇּל לִבּוֹ״. דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת מַעֲשָׂיו — דְּאִיסְתַּלַּק שְׁכִינָה מִינֵּיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהוּא לֹא יָדַע כִּי ה׳ סָר מֵעָלָיו״.

״וַתֵּרֶא דְּלִילָה כִּי הִגִּיד לָהּ אֶת כׇּל לִבּוֹ״. מְנָא יָדְעָה? אָמַר רַבִּי חָנִין אָמַר רַב: נִיכָּרִין דִּבְרֵי אֱמֶת. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: יָדְעָה בּוֹ בְּאוֹתוֹ צַדִּיק דְּלָא מַפֵּיק שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם לְבַטָּלָה. כֵּיוָן דַּאֲמַר ״נְזִיר אֱלֹהִים אֲנִי״, אֲמַרָה: הַשְׁתָּא וַדַּאי קוּשְׁטָא קָאָמַר.
״וַיְהִי כִּי הֵצִיקָה לּוֹ בִדְבָרֶיהָ כׇּל הַיָּמִים וַתְּאַלְצֵהוּ״. מַאי ״וַתְּאַלְצֵהוּ״? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: בִּשְׁעַת גְּמַר בִּיאָה נִשְׁמְטָה מִתַּחְתָּיו.

״וְעַתָּה הִשָּׁמְרִי נָא וְאַל תִּשְׁתִּי יַיִן וְשֵׁכָר וְאַל תֹּאכְלִי כׇּל טָמֵא״. מַאי ״כׇּל טָמֵא״? וְתוּ: עַד הַשְׁתָּא דְּבָרִים טְמֵאִים קָאָכְלָה?! אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: דְּבָרִים הָאֲסוּרִים בְּנָזִיר.
״וַיִּבְקַע אֱלֹהִים אֶת הַמַּכְתֵּשׁ אֲשֶׁר בַּלֶּחִי״. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: הוּא אִיוָּה לְדָבָר טָמֵא — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְלוּ חַיָּיו בְּדָבָר טָמֵא.
״וַתָּחֵל רוּחַ ה׳ וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: חָלְתָה נְבוּאָתוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״יְהִי דָן נָחָשׁ עֲלֵי דֶרֶךְ״.

״לְפַעֲמוֹ בְּמַחֲנֵה דָן״, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיְתָה שְׁכִינָה מְקַשְׁקֶשֶׁת לְפָנָיו כְּזוֹג. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״לְפַעֲמוֹ בְּמַחֲנֵה דָן״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״פַּעֲמֹן וְרִמֹּן״.
״בֵּין צׇרְעָה וּבֵין אֶשְׁתָּאוֹל״, אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: צׇרְעָה וְאֶשְׁתָּאוֹל שְׁנֵי הָרִים גְּדוֹלִים הָיוּ, וַעֲקָרָן שִׁמְשׁוֹן וּטְחָנָן זֶה בָּזֶה.
״וְהוּא יָחֵל לְהוֹשִׁיעַ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל״, אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא:
llm_translation: Her eyes are bewitching. She has a blemish before Him - therefore her eyes are bulging. She has torn at Him with her hair - therefore a priest tears at his hair. She has shown Him by sign language - therefore her fingers are nimble. She has girded herself to Him with her tresses - therefore a priest brings the Egyptian cord and binds it to her above her measure. She has spread out before Him her lap - therefore her lap is falling.

She accepted upon herself — therefore her soul is troubled. She fed the desires of the world — therefore her offering is consumed by beasts. She poured out wine from a vessel, a vessel of the wicked — therefore a priest pours out water from the well of the bitter waters in the measure of the mute.

She did it in secret — "He sits in secret, the upper one" she placed a face upon her, as it is said: "And a bird hast thou prepared for me, and a stone thou hast set before me, saying 'Turn aside from me, I will not look at thee'".

דָּבָר אַחֵר: הִיא עָשְׂתָה בַּסֵּתֶר — הַמָּקוֹם פִּירְסְמָה בַּגָּלוּי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תִּכַּסֶּה שִׂנְאָה בְּמַשָּׁאוֹן תִּגָּלֶה רָעָתוֹ בְקָהָל (וְגוֹ׳)״. English translation: Another matter: She did it in secret — the place is hidden away from the public, as it is said: "She covers her face with a veil, she will reveal her wickedness in the assembly (and so on)."
And after he had departed from him, one by one to find his reckoning, "all is vanity" as it says in the Torah, "all is vanity, a chasing after wind" (Qohelet 1:14), for what? To learn.
And after he had departed from him, saying "For all is vanity in the pursuit of wind", "In a tempestuous storm He will rebuke her" (Job 38:1), why to me?

To Rav Chinnana bar Pappai. Rav Chinnana bar Pappai said: There is no Holy One, blessed be He, who rends Himself from the people until the time of His redemption, as it is written: "In His long-suffering to us, He did not forsake us" (Isaiah 26:8).

I am not sure? And Rava says: Three cups of the said words are spoken in Egypt, why? One that was drunk during the days of Moses, and one that was drunk during the days of Pharaoh Neco, and one that is destined to be drunk with her friends!

And if you say that the other one is correct, and this one is not - and the Tanna teaches: Rabbi Yehudah said: Minyamin Ger HaMitzri was a fellow student of mine from the students of Rabbi Akiva. Minyamin Ger HaMitzri said: I am the first Egyptian, and I lifted up the first Egyptian woman, and I will build for the children of Egypt in the second generation so that my son may be worthy to come into the congregation!

To him, if it was said that he said: Said Rav Chinnana bar Pappai: There is no Holy One, blessed be He, who rends Himself from the King until His time of redemption, as it is said: "In His wrath He will not strive nor will He regard any one in His anger" (Psalm 30:5).

Amora of Rav Chinnana bar Pappai said: What does it write? "For I am the Lord, I have not spoken, and you, sons of Jacob, have not come to an end"? "I am the Lord, I have not spoken"? - I did not establish for her the people and spoke to her. "And you, sons of Jacob, have not come to an end"? - Behold it writes: "My flesh shall be food for them". My flesh is finished, and then they are finished.
Said Rav Huna: There is no Holy One, blessed be He, who rends himself from man until his vessel is filled, as it says: "When His word goes forth, He causes the earth to yield its produce."

Rav Chihna bar Pappah asks, What does it write? "Rejoice, righteous ones, in God to the upright is pleasant praise"? Do not say "pleasant praise", but rather "praiseworthy praise", this is Moses and David, for their enemies did not prevail over their deeds.

David — it is written: "You have made the boundary of the earth, its furrows." Moses — he said to Mar: "From when the first sanctuary was built, the tent of meeting was taken down, its curtains, its sockets, and its pillars, and its stakes. Where? Said Rav Hisda said Abimi: Underneath the measurements of the heavenly palace."

Talmudic text: Our Rabbis taught: A fornicator gives her eyes to whoever is not worthy of her, what she seeks - it is not given to her, and what is in her possession - it is taken from her. For one who gives his eyes to something that does not belong to him - what he seeks is not given to him, and what is in his possession is taken from him. (

And thus we found in the ancient serpent, that he gave his eyes to what is not seen by him - that which he sought was not given to him, and that which was in his hand was taken away from him. The Holy One, blessed be He, said: "I have said, 'Let there be a king over all the beasts of the forest, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.' And now it is written, 'Blessed are you, O Israel, who are not like these nations; but you shall behold the Lord your God from the place which He will choose to cause His name to dwell there - from before the sun, even toward the going down of the same.'"

I said, "He shall walk in a high place," now — "Upon his height he shall walk." I said, "Let him eat the food of man," now — "Dust he shall eat." He said, "I will kill the man and raise up Eve," now — "Hate I will set between you and the woman and between your seed and her seed."

And thus we found in Cain and Korah, and Balaam and Doeg and Achitophel and Gechazi and Abishalom and Adoniahu and Uzziel and Haman — that their eyes were fixed on what was not visible to them. What they sought — was not given to them, and what was in their possession — we took away from them. (

In the city of Yerach, it began with a transgression and so on. What is the meaning of these words? Perhaps because it is written: "When God gives you your back, you stumble and your belly is exposed" - and it is also written: "And your belly will be exposed and your back will stumble"? (

Amar Abaye: Ki la-yet — la-yet tachila yarek, va-hadar beten la-yet, umai ki badki — ki oirhayihu badki, beten berisha va-hadar yarek. Biklalah namay ki k'tiv: "La-tzuvot ben ve-lanpil yarek"! Hahu d'mo'da la hu kohein d'beten berisha va-hadar yarek, shelo lehotzi la-az al mayim hama-rim.
Mishnah: Shimon haLevi went after his eyes - therefore, the Philistines were called those who pierced his eyes, as it is said: "And the Philistines took him and pierced their eyes."

Abshalom was exalted in his eyes - therefore he was exalted in his eyes. And because he came upon ten concubines of his father's - therefore they were given to him ten wives, as it says: "And they took ten men, mighty men of valor, out of Joseph's servants" (Genesis 47:2). And because he stole three thievests: the heart of his father, and the heart of the court, and the heart of Israel, as it says: "And Abshalom stole the heart of Israel" (1 Samuel 27:12) - therefore three tribes were torn apart in him, as it says: "And he took three tribes and rent them in the midst of Israel" (Numbers 25:17).

And thus for a good reason: Miriam waited seven days for Moses, as it is said: "His sister stood at a distance" - therefore Israel tarried in the wilderness seven days on account of her, as it is said: "And the people did not journey until Miriam was gathered".

Yossef is worthy to bury his father, and there is none greater among his brothers, as it is said: "And Yossef took to bury his father, and they also brought up with him chariots and horsemen." Who is great for us except Yossef, that we do not busy ourselves with anyone except Moses.

Moses was vindicated in the bones of Joseph, and there is no great one in Israel greater than him, as it is said: "And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him" — Who is great besides Moses that he not be concerned about his place, as it is said: "And He buried him in his grave"? It was not only Moses who said this, but all the righteous ones, as it is said: "Walk in your ways and follow after Me, that I may give you rest"

Gemara: It was taught by our Rabbis: Shimon saw with his own eyes that he rebelled, as it is said: "And Shimon said to his father, 'Take her for me, for she is beautiful in my eyes.'" Genesis 34:3 Therefore, the Philistines were called to gaze at his eyes, as it is said: "And the Philistines took him and gouged out his eyes."
I am not? And it is written: "And his father and mother knew not that it was from Me." Because he went out from there - after the merits of his mother, he went out.

Talmudic text: A story, Rabbi says: The beginning of his trouble was in Azza, therefore he was troubled in Azza. The beginning of his trouble was in Azza, as it is written: "And Shimshon went down to Gaza and saw there a woman harlot, and so on", therefore he was troubled in Azza as it is written: "And they brought him down to Gaza". English translation: A story, Rabbi says: The beginning of his trouble was in Azza, therefore he was troubled in Azza. The beginning of his trouble was in Azza, for it is written: "And Shimshon went down to Gaza and saw there a woman harlot, and so on", therefore he was troubled in Azza as it is written: "And they brought him down to Gaza".
And it is written: "And Shimshon came down to Timnathah"? The beginning of his discussion was in Azza, how so? (

And it happened after this, and he loved a woman in the field of Sorek, and her name was Dillah. Talmudic tradition, Rabbi says: If not for the fact that her name is called "Dillah" — behold, she was worthy to be called Dillah: She weakened her strength, she weakened her heart, she weakened her deeds. (

He weakened his strength — as it is written: "And he weakened his strength from him." He weakened his heart — as it is written: "And behold, the weak one saw that God had revealed to her all his heart." He weakened his deeds — and shame departed from him, as it is written: "And he did not know that God had turned away from him."

"And behold, Lilah, for he revealed to her all his heart." Is it known? Said Rabbi Chanin said Rav: We are made aware of true words. Abaye said: She knew him in that very righteous one who does not take the name of Heaven in vain. When he says "I am a Nazirite unto God", she said: Now, indeed, he is saying.

And it happened when she poured out her words to him all the days and he was weary. What is "and he was weary"? Rabbi Yitzchak said in the name of Rabbi Ami: When a person's soul is exhausted from his suffering, it is removed from beneath him. (

And now, behold! Be careful and do not drink wine or strong drink and do not eat any unclean thing. What is "any unclean thing"? Until when did unclean things cease to be eaten?! Said Rabbi Yitzchak on behalf of Rabbi Ami: Unclean things that are forbidden to a Nazir. (
And God rent asunder the curtain that was in the midst. Said Rabbi Yitzchak, citing Rabbi Ami: He is Iyov for a matter of uncleanness — therefore his life was bound up with a matter of uncleanness. (
"And the spirit of God hovered and went." Said Rabbi Hamnuna, son of Rabbi Chanina: "The prophecy of our father Jacob has been fulfilled, as it is written: 'Behold, a serpent lies on the path.'"

"For the sake of his father-in-law in camp" - said Rabbi Yitzchak, citing Rabbi Ami. He teaches that a Shechinah (Divine Presence) was fluttering before him like a dove. As it is written here: "For the sake of his father-in-law in camp", and as it is written there: "Paeamon and Rimmon".
"Between Zera'ah and Between Eshtao'ol", said Rabbi Asi: "Zera'ah and Eshtao'ol were two great mountains, and the foundation of Shimon and Tchanan was this in that."
"And he will strive to save Israel", said Rabbi Hamuna before Rabbi Chanina. (

sentences.text: פָּנֶיהָ מוֹרִיקוֹת. הִיא כָּחֲלָה לוֹ עֵינֶיהָ — לְפִיכָךְ עֵינֶיהָ בּוֹלְטוֹת. הִיא קָלְעָה לוֹ אֶת שְׂעָרָהּ — לְפִיכָךְ כֹּהֵן סוֹתֵר אֶת שְׂעָרָהּ. הִיא הֶרְאֲתָה לוֹ בְּאֶצְבַּע — לְפִיכָךְ צִיפּוֹרְנֶיהָ נוֹשְׁרוֹת. הִיא חָגְרָה לוֹ בְּצִילְצוֹל — לְפִיכָךְ כֹּהֵן מֵבִיא חֶבֶל הַמִּצְרִי וְקוֹשֵׁר לָהּ לְמַעְלָה מִדַּדֶּיהָ. הִיא פָּשְׁטָה לוֹ אֶת יְרֵיכָהּ — לְפִיכָךְ יְרֵיכָהּ נוֹפֶלֶת.
sentences.human_translation: her face becomes sallow she painted her eyes for therefore her eyes bulge she braided her hair for therefore a priest unbraids her hair she indicated to with a finger therefore her fingernails fall off; she girded herself for with a ribbon therefore a priest brings an Egyptian rope and ties for her above her breasts; she extended her thigh for therefore her thigh falls away
sentences.llm_translation: Her eyes are bewitching. She has a blemish before Him - therefore her eyes are bulging. She has torn at Him with her hair - therefore a priest tears at his hair. She has shown Him by sign language - therefore her fingers are nimble. She has girded herself to Him with her tresses - therefore a priest brings the Egyptian cord and binds it to her above her measure. She has spread out before Him her lap - therefore her lap is falling.

sentences.text: הִיא קִיבְּלַתּוּ עַל כְּרֵיסָהּ — לְפִיכָךְ בִּטְנָהּ צָבָה. הִיא הֶאֱכִילַתּוּ מַעֲדַנֵּי עוֹלָם — לְפִיכָךְ קׇרְבָּנָהּ מַאֲכַל בְּהֵמָה. הִיא הִשְׁקַתְהוּ יַיִן מְשׁוּבָּח בְּכוֹסוֹת מְשׁוּבָּחִים — לְפִיכָךְ כֹּהֵן מַשְׁקֶה מַיִם הַמָּרִים בִּמְקִידָּה שֶׁל חֶרֶשׂ.
sentences.human_translation: She received upon her stomach, therefore her stomach swells; she fed him delicacies of the world, therefore her offering animal food, she gave him fine wine to drink in fine cups, therefore a priest gives her bitter water in an earthenware mekeida , to drink.
sentences.llm_translation: She accepted upon herself — therefore her soul is troubled. She fed the desires of the world — therefore her offering is consumed by beasts. She poured out wine from a vessel, a vessel of the wicked — therefore a priest pours out water from the well of the bitter waters in the measure of the mute.

sentences.text: הִיא עָשְׂתָה בַּסֵּתֶר — ״יוֹשֵׁב בְּסֵתֶר עֶלְיוֹן״ שָׂם בָּהּ פָּנִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעֵין נֹאֵף שָׁמְרָה נֶשֶׁף לֵאמֹר לֹא תְשׁוּרֵנִי עָיִן וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: She acted in secret; “Who dwell in secret, with the Most High” turns face to her, as it is stated: “The eye of the adulterer waits for the twilight, saying: No eye shall see me;
sentences.llm_translation: She did it in secret — "He sits in secret, the upper one" she placed a face upon her, as it is said: "And a bird hast thou prepared for me, and a stone thou hast set before me, saying 'Turn aside from me, I will not look at thee'".

sentences.text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: הִיא עָשְׂתָה בַּסֵּתֶר — הַמָּקוֹם פִּירְסְמָה בַּגָּלוּי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תִּכַּסֶּה שִׂנְאָה בְּמַשָּׁאוֹן תִּגָּלֶה רָעָתוֹ בְקָהָל (וְגוֹ׳)״.
sentences.human_translation: Alternatively, she acted in secret, the Omnipresent revealed it in the open, as it is stated: “Though his hatred be concealed with deceit, his wickedness shall be revealed before the congregation”
sentences.llm_translation: דָּבָר אַחֵר: הִיא עָשְׂתָה בַּסֵּתֶר — הַמָּקוֹם פִּירְסְמָה בַּגָּלוּי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תִּכַּסֶּה שִׂנְאָה בְּמַשָּׁאוֹן תִּגָּלֶה רָעָתוֹ בְקָהָל (וְגוֹ׳)״. English translation: Another matter: She did it in secret — the place is hidden away from the public, as it is said: "She covers her face with a veil, she will reveal her wickedness in the assembly (and so on)."

sentences.text: וּמֵאַחַר דְּנָפְקָא לֵיהּ מֵ״אַחַת לְאַחַת לִמְצֹא חֶשְׁבּוֹן״, ״כִּי כׇל סְאוֹן סֹאֵן בְּרַעַשׁ״ לְמָה לִי? לְכַמִּדָּה.
sentences.human_translation: And since Rabbi derives from: adding one thing to another, to find out the account” why do I “For every boot stamped with fierceness” to by the measure,
sentences.llm_translation: And after he had departed from him, one by one to find his reckoning, "all is vanity" as it says in the Torah, "all is vanity, a chasing after wind" (Qohelet 1:14), for what? To learn.

sentences.text: וּמֵאַחַר דְּנָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״כִּי כׇל סְאוֹן סֹאֵן בְּרַעַשׁ״, ״בְּסַאסְּאָה בְּשַׁלְּחָהּ תְּרִיבֶנָּה״ לְמָה לִי?
sentences.human_translation: And since he derives it from “for every boot stamped with fierceness,” why do I “in full measure, when you send her away, you contend with her”
sentences.llm_translation: And after he had departed from him, saying "For all is vanity in the pursuit of wind", "In a tempestuous storm He will rebuke her" (Job 38:1), why to me?

sentences.text: לְכִדְרַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא. דְּאָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא: אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נִפְרָע מִן הָאוּמָּה עַד שְׁעַת שִׁילּוּחָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּסַאסְּאָה בְּשַׁלְּחָהּ וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: to as by Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa, for Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, does not punish a nation until its time to be banished, as it is stated: “In full measure, when you send her away,
sentences.llm_translation: To Rav Chinnana bar Pappai. Rav Chinnana bar Pappai said: There is no Holy One, blessed be He, who rends Himself from the people until the time of His redemption, as it is written: "In His long-suffering to us, He did not forsake us" (Isaiah 26:8).

sentences.text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: שָׁלֹשׁ(ה) כּוֹסוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בְּמִצְרַיִם, לָמָּה? אַחַת שֶׁשָּׁתָת בִּימֵי מֹשֶׁה, וְאַחַת שֶׁשָּׁתָת בִּימֵי פַּרְעֹה נְכֹה, וְאַחַת שֶׁעֲתִידָה לִשְׁתּוֹת עִם חַבְרוֹתֶיהָ!
sentences.human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rava say: Why three cups that are stated with regard to Egypt One that it drank in the days of Moses one that it drank in the days of Pharaoh Neco, and one that it will drink in the future with its companions,
sentences.llm_translation: I am not sure? And Rava says: Three cups of the said words are spoken in Egypt, why? One that was drunk during the days of Moses, and one that was drunk during the days of Pharaoh Neco, and one that is destined to be drunk with her friends!

sentences.text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָנָךְ אֲזַדוּ וְהָנֵי אַחֲרִינֵי נִינְהוּ — וְהָתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מִנְיָמִין גֵּר הַמִּצְרִי הָיָה לִי חָבֵר מִתַּלְמִידֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אָמַר מִנְיָמִין גֵּר הַמִּצְרִי: אֲנִי מִצְרִי רִאשׁוֹן, וְנָשָׂאתִי מִצְרִית רִאשׁוֹנָה, אַשִּׂיא לִבְנֵי מִצְרִית שְׁנִיָּה כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא בֶּן בְּנִי מוּתָּר לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל!
sentences.human_translation: And if you would say those have gone, and these are different ones, but isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda said: Minyamin, an Egyptian convert, was a friend of mine from among the students of Rabbi Akiva, Minyamin the Egyptian convert said: I a first- Egyptian and I married first- Egyptian I will marry off my son, a second- to second- Egyptian in order that my son’s son will be permitted to enter into the congregation.
sentences.llm_translation: And if you say that the other one is correct, and this one is not - and the Tanna teaches: Rabbi Yehudah said: Minyamin Ger HaMitzri was a fellow student of mine from the students of Rabbi Akiva. Minyamin Ger HaMitzri said: I am the first Egyptian, and I lifted up the first Egyptian woman, and I will build for the children of Egypt in the second generation so that my son may be worthy to come into the congregation!

sentences.text: אֶלָּא אִי אִיתְּמַר הָכִי אִיתְּמַר: אָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא: אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נִפְרָע מִן הַמֶּלֶךְ עַד שְׁעַת שִׁילּוּחוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּסַאסְּאָה בְּשַׁלְּחָהּ תְּרִיבֶנָּה וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: Rather, if was stated was stated like this: Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, does not punish king until his time to be banished, as it is stated: “In full measure, when you send her away, you contend with her”
sentences.llm_translation: To him, if it was said that he said: Said Rav Chinnana bar Pappai: There is no Holy One, blessed be He, who rends Himself from the King until His time of redemption, as it is said: "In His wrath He will not strive nor will He regard any one in His anger" (Psalm 30:5).

sentences.text: אַמֵּימָר מַתְנֵי לְהָא דְּרַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא אַהָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי אֲנִי ה׳ לֹא שָׁנִיתִי וְאַתֶּם בְּנֵי יַעֲקֹב לֹא כְלִיתֶם״? ״אֲנִי ה׳ לֹא שָׁנִיתִי״ — לֹא הִכֵּיתִי לְאוּמָּהּ וְשָׁנִיתִי לָהּ. ״וְאַתֶּם בְּנֵי יַעֲקֹב לֹא כְלִיתֶם״ — הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״חִצַּי אֲכַלֶּה בָּם״. חִצַּי כָּלִין, וְהֵן אֵינָן כָּלִין.
sentences.human_translation: Ameimar teaches that of Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa with regard to this: What is which is written: “For I the Lord change not; and you, sons of Jacob, are not consumed” “For I the Lord change [ shaniti ] not” I did not strike a nation and repeat [ shaniti ] it, “And you, sons of Jacob, are not consumed,” This is as that which is written: I will consume My arrows upon them” My arrows are consumed and they, are not consumed
sentences.llm_translation: Amora of Rav Chinnana bar Pappai said: What does it write? "For I am the Lord, I have not spoken, and you, sons of Jacob, have not come to an end"? "I am the Lord, I have not spoken"? - I did not establish for her the people and spoke to her. "And you, sons of Jacob, have not come to an end"? - Behold it writes: "My flesh shall be food for them". My flesh is finished, and then they are finished.

sentences.text: אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נִפְרָע מִן הָאָדָם עַד שֶׁתִּתְמַלֵּא סְאָתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בִּמְלֹאות שִׂפְקוֹ יֵצֶר לוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Hamnuna says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, does not punish a person until his se’a , is filled, as it is stated: “In the fullness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits;
sentences.llm_translation: Said Rav Huna: There is no Holy One, blessed be He, who rends himself from man until his vessel is filled, as it says: "When His word goes forth, He causes the earth to yield its produce."

sentences.text: דָּרֵשׁ רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״רַנְּנוּ צַדִּיקִים בַּה׳ לַיְשָׁרִים נָאוָה תְהִלָּה״? אַל תִּקְרֵי ״נָאוָה תְהִלָּה״, אֶלָּא ״נָוֶה תְהִלָּה״, זֶה מֹשֶׁה וְדָוִד, שֶׁלֹּא שָׁלְטוּ שׂוֹנְאֵיהֶם בְּמַעֲשֵׂיהֶם.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa interpreted homiletically: What is which is written: “Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous, praise is comely for the upright [ nava tehilla ]” Do not read Praise is comely [ nava ]; rather, A house [ naveh ] of praise. This Moses and David, whose enemies did not rule over their achievements,
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Chihna bar Pappah asks, What does it write? "Rejoice, righteous ones, in God to the upright is pleasant praise"? Do not say "pleasant praise", but rather "praiseworthy praise", this is Moses and David, for their enemies did not prevail over their deeds.

sentences.text: דָּוִד — דִּכְתִיב: ״טָבְעוּ בָאָרֶץ שְׁעָרֶיהָ״. מֹשֶׁה — דְּאָמַר מָר: מִשֶּׁנִּבְנָה מִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן נִגְנַז אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד, קְרָשָׁיו קְרָסָיו וּבְרִיחָיו וְעַמּוּדָיו וַאֲדָנָיו. הֵיכָא? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר אֲבִימִי: תַּחַת מְחִילּוֹת שֶׁל הֵיכָל.
sentences.human_translation: David, as it is written: “Her gates are sunk into the ground” Moses, as the Master said: When the first Temple was built, the Tent of Meeting was sequestered, its boards, its clasps, and its bars, and its pillars, and its sockets. Where Rav Ḥisda says Avimi says: Beneath the tunnels of the Sanctuary.
sentences.llm_translation: David — it is written: "You have made the boundary of the earth, its furrows." Moses — he said to Mar: "From when the first sanctuary was built, the tent of meeting was taken down, its curtains, its sockets, and its pillars, and its stakes. Where? Said Rav Hisda said Abimi: Underneath the measurements of the heavenly palace."

sentences.text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: סוֹטָה נָתְנָה עֵינֶיהָ בְּמִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לָהּ, מַה שֶּׁבִּיקְּשָׁה — לֹא נִיתַּן לָהּ, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדָהּ — נְטָלוּהוּ מִמֶּנָּה. שֶׁכׇּל הַנּוֹתֵן עֵינָיו בְּמַה שֶּׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ — מַה שֶּׁמְבַקֵּשׁ אֵין נוֹתְנִין לוֹ, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדוֹ — נוֹטְלִין הֵימֶנּוּ.
sentences.human_translation: The Sages taught sota placed her eyes, on one who is unfit for her, That which she desired, is not given to her, And that which she had, was taken away from her, that anyone who places his eyes on that which is not his is not given what he desires, and that which he had is taken from him.
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: Our Rabbis taught: A fornicator gives her eyes to whoever is not worthy of her, what she seeks - it is not given to her, and what is in her possession - it is taken from her. For one who gives his eyes to something that does not belong to him - what he seeks is not given to him, and what is in his possession is taken from him. (

sentences.text: וְכֵן מָצִינוּ בְּנָחָשׁ הַקַּדְמוֹנִי, שֶׁנָּתַן עֵינָיו בְּמַה שֶּׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לוֹ — מַה שֶּׁבִּיקֵּשׁ לֹא נָתְנוּ לוֹ, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדוֹ נְטָלוּהוּ מִמֶּנּוּ. אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי יְהֵא מֶלֶךְ עַל כׇּל בְּהֵמָה וְחַיָּה, וְעַכְשָׁיו ״אָרוּר הוּא מִכׇּל הַבְּהֵמָה וּמִכֹּל חַיַּת הַשָּׂדֶה״.
sentences.human_translation: And, so too, we found with regard to the primeval snake for he placed his eyes on that which was unfit for him, that which he desired was not given to him, and that which was in his possession was taken from him. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: I said will be king over every domesticated animal and non-domesticated animal, but now he is cursed more than all the domesticated animals and all the non-domesticated animals of the field,
sentences.llm_translation: And thus we found in the ancient serpent, that he gave his eyes to what is not seen by him - that which he sought was not given to him, and that which was in his hand was taken away from him. The Holy One, blessed be He, said: "I have said, 'Let there be a king over all the beasts of the forest, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.' And now it is written, 'Blessed are you, O Israel, who are not like these nations; but you shall behold the Lord your God from the place which He will choose to cause His name to dwell there - from before the sun, even toward the going down of the same.'"

sentences.text: אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי יְהַלֵּךְ בְּקוֹמָה זְקוּפָה, עַכְשָׁיו — ״עַל גְּחוֹנוֹ יֵלֵךְ״. אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי יְהֵא מַאֲכָלוֹ מַאֲכַל אָדָם, עַכְשָׁיו — ״עָפָר יֹאכַל״. הוּא אָמַר אֶהֱרוֹג אֶת אָדָם וְאֶשָּׂא אֶת חַוָּה, עַכְשָׁיו — ״אֵיבָה אָשִׁית בֵּינְךָ וּבֵין הָאִשָּׁה וּבֵין זַרְעֲךָ וּבֵין זַרְעָהּ״.
sentences.human_translation: I said will walk upright, now he shall go on his belly; I said his food will be food a person, now he shall eat dust. said: I will kill Adam and marry Eve, now: “I will put enmity between you and the woman and between your seed and her seed”
sentences.llm_translation: I said, "He shall walk in a high place," now — "Upon his height he shall walk." I said, "Let him eat the food of man," now — "Dust he shall eat." He said, "I will kill the man and raise up Eve," now — "Hate I will set between you and the woman and between your seed and her seed."

sentences.text: וְכֵן מָצִינוּ בְּקַיִן וְקֹרַח וּבִלְעָם וְדוֹאֵג וַאֲחִיתוֹפֶל וְגֵחֲזִי וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם וַאֲדוֹנִיָּהוּ וְעוּזִּיָּהוּ וְהָמָן — שֶׁנָּתְנוּ עֵינֵיהֶם בְּמַה שֶּׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לָהֶם. מַה שֶּׁבִּיקְּשׁוּ — לֹא נִיתַּן לָהֶם, וּמַה שֶּׁבְּיָדָם — נְטָלוּהוּ מֵהֶם.
sentences.human_translation: And so we found with regard to Cain, and Korah, and Balaam, and Doeg, and Ahithophel, and Gehazi, and Absalom, and Adonijah, and Uzziah, and Haman, who placed their eyes on that which is unfit for them, and what they desired was not given to them, and what they had was taken from them.
sentences.llm_translation: And thus we found in Cain and Korah, and Balaam and Doeg and Achitophel and Gechazi and Abishalom and Adoniahu and Uzziel and Haman — that their eyes were fixed on what was not visible to them. What they sought — was not given to them, and what was in their possession — we took away from them. (

sentences.text: בַּיָּרֵךְ הִתְחִילָּה בַּעֲבֵירָה וְכוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּתֵת ה׳ אֶת יְרֵכֵךְ נוֹפֶלֶת וְאֶת בִּטְנֵךְ צָבָה״ — וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְצָבְתָה בִטְנָהּ וְנָפְלָה יְרֵכָהּ״?
sentences.human_translation: She began her transgression with thigh From where are these matters If we say because it is written when the Lord does make your thigh to fall away, and your belly to swell” but isn’t written “And her belly shall swell, and her thigh shall fall away”
sentences.llm_translation: In the city of Yerach, it began with a transgression and so on. What is the meaning of these words? Perhaps because it is written: "When God gives you your back, you stumble and your belly is exposed" - and it is also written: "And your belly will be exposed and your back will stumble"? (

sentences.text: אֲמַר אַבָּיֵי: כִּי לָיֵיט — לָיֵיט תְּחִילָּה יָרֵךְ, וַהֲדַר בֶּטֶן לָיֵיט, וּמַיָּא כִּי בָּדְקִי — כִּי אוֹרְחַיְיהוּ בָּדְקִי, בֶּטֶן בְּרֵישָׁא וַהֲדַר יָרֵךְ. בִּקְלָלָה נָמֵי כְּתִיב: ״לַצְבּוֹת בֶּטֶן וְלַנְפִּל יָרֵךְ״! הָהוּא דְּמוֹדַע לַהּ כֹּהֵן דְּבֶטֶן בְּרֵישָׁא וַהֲדַר יָרֵךְ, שֶׁלֹּא לְהוֹצִיא לַעַז עַל מַיִם הַמָּרִים.
sentences.human_translation: Abaye said When curses he first curses the thigh and then he curses the stomach, but when the water evaluates it evaluates along its way first stomach and then thigh. in curse it is also written: and will cause your belly to swell, and your thigh to fall away” That that the priest notifies her that stomach first and then thigh, so that not cast aspersions on the bitter water.
sentences.llm_translation: Amar Abaye: Ki la-yet — la-yet tachila yarek, va-hadar beten la-yet, umai ki badki — ki oirhayihu badki, beten berisha va-hadar yarek. Biklalah namay ki k'tiv: "La-tzuvot ben ve-lanpil yarek"! Hahu d'mo'da la hu kohein d'beten berisha va-hadar yarek, shelo lehotzi la-az al mayim hama-rim.

sentences.text: מַתְנִי׳ שִׁמְשׁוֹן הָלַךְ אַחַר עֵינָיו — לְפִיכָךְ נִקְּרוּ פְּלִשְׁתִּים אֶת עֵינָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאחֲזוּהוּ פְלִשְׁתִּים וַיְנַקְּרוּ אֶת עֵינָיו״.
sentences.human_translation: Samson followed his eyes, therefore the Philistines gouged out his eyes, as it is stated: “And the Philistines laid hold on him, and put out his eyes”
sentences.llm_translation: Mishnah: Shimon haLevi went after his eyes - therefore, the Philistines were called those who pierced his eyes, as it is said: "And the Philistines took him and pierced their eyes."

sentences.text: אַבְשָׁלוֹם נִתְגָּאָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְלָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ. וּלְפִי שֶׁבָּא עַל עֶשֶׂר פִּלַגְשֵׁי אָבִיו — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְּנוּ בּוֹ עֶשֶׂר לוֹנְבִיּוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיָּסֹבּוּ עֲשָׂרָה אֲנָשִׁים נוֹשְׂאֵי כְּלֵי יוֹאָב״. וּלְפִי שֶׁגָּנַב שָׁלֹשׁ גְּנֵבוֹת: לֵב אָבִיו, וְלֵב בֵּית דִּין, וְלֵב יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְגַנֵּב אַבְשָׁלוֹם אֶת לֵב אַנְשֵׁי יִשְׂרָאֵל״ — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְקְעוּ בּוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁבָטִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקַּח שְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁבָטִים בְּכַפּוֹ וַיִּתְקָעֵם בְּלֵב אַבְשָׁלוֹם״.
sentences.human_translation: Absalom was proud of his hair, therefore he was hanged by his hair. And because he engaged in sexual intercourse with ten of his father’s concubines therefore ten spears [ loneviyyot ] were put, into him, as it is stated: “And ten young men that bore Joab’s armor compassed about And because he stole three thefts The heart of his father, the heart of the court, and the heart of the Jewish people, as it is stated: “So Absalom stole the hearts of the men of Israel” therefore three spears were embedded into as it is stated: And he took three spears in his hand, and thrust them through the heart of Absalom,
sentences.llm_translation: Abshalom was exalted in his eyes - therefore he was exalted in his eyes. And because he came upon ten concubines of his father's - therefore they were given to him ten wives, as it says: "And they took ten men, mighty men of valor, out of Joseph's servants" (Genesis 47:2). And because he stole three thievests: the heart of his father, and the heart of the court, and the heart of Israel, as it says: "And Abshalom stole the heart of Israel" (1 Samuel 27:12) - therefore three tribes were torn apart in him, as it says: "And he took three tribes and rent them in the midst of Israel" (Numbers 25:17).

sentences.text: וְכֵן לְעִנְיַן הַטּוֹבָה: מִרְיָם הִמְתִּינָה לְמֹשֶׁה שָׁעָה אַחַת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתֵּתַצַּב אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵרָחוֹק״ — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְעַכְּבוּ לָהּ יִשְׂרָאֵל שִׁבְעָה יָמִים בַּמִּדְבָּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָעָם לֹא נָסַע עַד הֵאָסֵף מִרְיָם״.
sentences.human_translation: And the same with regard to the good Miriam waited for Moses one hour as it is stated: “And his sister stood afar off, Therefore the Jewish people delayed seven days for her as it is stated: and the people journeyed not until Miriam was brought in again”
sentences.llm_translation: And thus for a good reason: Miriam waited seven days for Moses, as it is said: "His sister stood at a distance" - therefore Israel tarried in the wilderness seven days on account of her, as it is said: "And the people did not journey until Miriam was gathered".

sentences.text: יוֹסֵף זָכָה לִקְבּוֹר אֶת אָבִיו, וְאֵין בְּאֶחָיו גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּעַל יוֹסֵף לִקְבֹּר אֶת אָבִיו וַיַּעֲלוּ עִמּוֹ גַּם רֶכֶב גַּם פָּרָשִׁים״. מִי לָנוּ גָּדוֹל מִיּוֹסֵף, שֶׁלֹּא נִתְעַסֵּק בּוֹ אֶלָּא מֹשֶׁה.
sentences.human_translation: Joseph merited to bury his father, and there was none among his brothers greater than he as it is stated: “And Joseph went up to bury his father; And there went up with him both chariots and horsemen; Who, to us, a greater than Joseph, as it was none Moses who involved his
sentences.llm_translation: Yossef is worthy to bury his father, and there is none greater among his brothers, as it is said: "And Yossef took to bury his father, and they also brought up with him chariots and horsemen." Who is great for us except Yossef, that we do not busy ourselves with anyone except Moses.

sentences.text: מֹשֶׁה זָכָה בְּעַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף, וְאֵין בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקַּח מֹשֶׁה אֶת עַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף עִמּוֹ״ — מִי גָּדוֹל מִמֹּשֶׁה שֶׁלֹּא נִתְעַסֵּק בּוֹ אֶלָּא הַמָּקוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקְבֹּר אוֹתוֹ בַּגַּי״. לֹא עַל מֹשֶׁה בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא עַל כׇּל הַצַּדִּיקִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָלַךְ לְפָנֶיךָ צִדְקֶךָ כְּבוֹד ה׳ יַאַסְפֶךָ״.
sentences.human_translation: Moses merited in Joseph’s bones and there was none among the Jewish people greater than he, as it is stated: “And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him” Who a greater than Moses, as no one involved himself in his other than the Omnipresent as it is stated: “And He buried him in the valley Not only with regard to Moses did say but with regard to all the righteous individuals, as it is stated: “Your righteousness shall go before you and the glory of the Lord shall gather you in”
sentences.llm_translation: Moses was vindicated in the bones of Joseph, and there is no great one in Israel greater than him, as it is said: "And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him" — Who is great besides Moses that he not be concerned about his place, as it is said: "And He buried him in his grave"? It was not only Moses who said this, but all the righteous ones, as it is said: "Walk in your ways and follow after Me, that I may give you rest"

sentences.text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שִׁמְשׁוֹן בְּעֵינָיו מָרַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר שִׁמְשׁוֹן אֶל אָבִיו אוֹתָהּ קַח לִי כִּי הִיא יָשְׁרָה בְעֵינָי״ — לְפִיכָךְ נִקְּרוּ פְּלִשְׁתִּים אֶת עֵינָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאחֲזוּהוּ פְלִשְׁתִּים וַיְנַקְּרוּ אֶת עֵינָיו״.
sentences.human_translation: The Sages taught Samson rebelled with his eyes, as it is stated: And Samson said to his father: Get her for me; for she is pleasant in my eyes” Therefore, the Philistines gouged out his eyes, as it is stated: “And the Philistines laid hold on him, and put out his eyes”
sentences.llm_translation: Gemara: It was taught by our Rabbis: Shimon saw with his own eyes that he rebelled, as it is said: "And Shimon said to his father, 'Take her for me, for she is beautiful in my eyes.'" Genesis 34:3 Therefore, the Philistines were called to gaze at his eyes, as it is said: "And the Philistines took him and gouged out his eyes."

sentences.text: אִינִי? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְאָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ לֹא יָדְעוּ כִּי מֵה׳ הִיא״. כִּי אֲזַל מִיהָא — בָּתַר יַשְׁרוּתֵיהּ אֲזַל.
sentences.human_translation: Is that so? But isn’t it written: “But his father and his mother knew not that it was from the Lord; in any event when he went, he followed his inclination
sentences.llm_translation: I am not? And it is written: "And his father and mother knew not that it was from Me." Because he went out from there - after the merits of his mother, he went out.

sentences.text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: תְּחִילַּת קִלְקוּלוֹ בְּעַזָּה, לְפִיכָךְ לָקָה בְּעַזָּה. תְּחִילַּת קִלְקוּלוֹ בְּעַזָּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּלֶךְ שִׁמְשׁוֹן עַזָּתָה וַיַּרְא שָׁם אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה וְגוֹ׳״, לְפִיכָךְ לָקָה בְּעַזָּה דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיּוֹרִידוּ אוֹתוֹ עַזָּתָהּ״.
sentences.human_translation: It is taught Rabbi says: His initial wrongdoing was in Gaza, therefore he was smitten in Gaza. His initial wrongdoing was in Gaza, as it is written: “And Samson went to Gaza, and saw there a harlot, Therefore, he was smitten in Gaza, as it is written: and they brought him down to Gaza,
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: A story, Rabbi says: The beginning of his trouble was in Azza, therefore he was troubled in Azza. The beginning of his trouble was in Azza, as it is written: "And Shimshon went down to Gaza and saw there a woman harlot, and so on", therefore he was troubled in Azza as it is written: "And they brought him down to Gaza". English translation: A story, Rabbi says: The beginning of his trouble was in Azza, therefore he was troubled in Azza. The beginning of his trouble was in Azza, for it is written: "And Shimshon went down to Gaza and saw there a woman harlot, and so on", therefore he was troubled in Azza as it is written: "And they brought him down to Gaza".

sentences.text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּרֶד שִׁמְשׁוֹן תִּמְנָתָה״? תְּחִלַּת קִלְקוּלוֹ מִיהָא בְּעַזָּה הֲוָה.
sentences.human_translation: But isn’t it written “And Samson went down to Timnah, Gemara answers: In any event, his initial wrongdoing was in Gaza,
sentences.llm_translation: And it is written: "And Shimshon came down to Timnathah"? The beginning of his discussion was in Azza, how so? (

sentences.text: ״וַיְהִי אַחֲרֵי כֵן וַיֶּאֱהַב אִשָּׁה בְּנַחַל שֹׂרֵק וּשְׁמָהּ דְּלִילָה״. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אִילְמָלֵא לֹא נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ ״דְּלִילָה״ — רְאוּיָה הָיְתָה שֶׁתִּקָּרֵא דְּלִילָה: דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת כֹּחוֹ, דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת לִבּוֹ, דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת מַעֲשָׂיו.
sentences.human_translation: “And it came to pass afterward, that he loved a woman in the valley of Sorek, whose name was Delilah” It is taught Rabbi says: if she had not been called name Delilah, it would have been fitting that she be called Delilah, she weakened [ dildela ] his strength, she weakened his heart, she weakened his deeds,
sentences.llm_translation: And it happened after this, and he loved a woman in the field of Sorek, and her name was Dillah. Talmudic tradition, Rabbi says: If not for the fact that her name is called "Dillah" — behold, she was worthy to be called Dillah: She weakened her strength, she weakened her heart, she weakened her deeds. (

sentences.text: דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת כֹּחוֹ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּסַר כֹּחוֹ מֵעָלָיו״. דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת לִבּוֹ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתֵּרֶא דְּלִילָה כִּי הִגִּיד לָהּ אֶת כׇּל לִבּוֹ״. דִּילְדְּלָה אֶת מַעֲשָׂיו — דְּאִיסְתַּלַּק שְׁכִינָה מִינֵּיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהוּא לֹא יָדַע כִּי ה׳ סָר מֵעָלָיו״.
sentences.human_translation: She weakened his strength, as it is written: and his strength went from him” She weakened his heart, as it is written: “And when Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart, She weakened his deeds, as the Divine Presence left him, as it is written: But he knew not that the Lord was departed from him”
sentences.llm_translation: He weakened his strength — as it is written: "And he weakened his strength from him." He weakened his heart — as it is written: "And behold, the weak one saw that God had revealed to her all his heart." He weakened his deeds — and shame departed from him, as it is written: "And he did not know that God had turned away from him."

sentences.text: ״וַתֵּרֶא דְּלִילָה כִּי הִגִּיד לָהּ אֶת כׇּל לִבּוֹ״. מְנָא יָדְעָה? אָמַר רַבִּי חָנִין אָמַר רַב: נִיכָּרִין דִּבְרֵי אֱמֶת. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: יָדְעָה בּוֹ בְּאוֹתוֹ צַדִּיק דְּלָא מַפֵּיק שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם לְבַטָּלָה. כֵּיוָן דַּאֲמַר ״נְזִיר אֱלֹהִים אֲנִי״, אֲמַרָה: הַשְׁתָּא וַדַּאי קוּשְׁטָא קָאָמַר.
sentences.human_translation: “And when Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart” From where did she know Rabbi Ḥanin says Rav says: Words of truth are recognizable, Abaye says She knew about a righteous individual, that he would not express the name of Heaven in vain. Once he said: I have been a nazirite unto God she said: Now he is certainly saying the truth.
sentences.llm_translation: "And behold, Lilah, for he revealed to her all his heart." Is it known? Said Rabbi Chanin said Rav: We are made aware of true words. Abaye said: She knew him in that very righteous one who does not take the name of Heaven in vain. When he says "I am a Nazirite unto God", she said: Now, indeed, he is saying.

sentences.text: ״וַיְהִי כִּי הֵצִיקָה לּוֹ בִדְבָרֶיהָ כׇּל הַיָּמִים וַתְּאַלְצֵהוּ״. מַאי ״וַתְּאַלְצֵהוּ״? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: בִּשְׁעַת גְּמַר בִּיאָה נִשְׁמְטָה מִתַּחְתָּיו.
sentences.human_translation: “And it came to pass, when she pressed him daily with her words, and urged him, What “and urged him”? Rabbi Yitzḥak of the school of Rabbi Ami says: At the moment completion of intercourse, she slipped away from beneath him.
sentences.llm_translation: And it happened when she poured out her words to him all the days and he was weary. What is "and he was weary"? Rabbi Yitzchak said in the name of Rabbi Ami: When a person's soul is exhausted from his suffering, it is removed from beneath him. (

sentences.text: ״וְעַתָּה הִשָּׁמְרִי נָא וְאַל תִּשְׁתִּי יַיִן וְשֵׁכָר וְאַל תֹּאכְלִי כׇּל טָמֵא״. מַאי ״כׇּל טָמֵא״? וְתוּ: עַד הַשְׁתָּא דְּבָרִים טְמֵאִים קָאָכְלָה?! אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: דְּבָרִים הָאֲסוּרִים בְּנָזִיר.
sentences.human_translation: “Now therefore beware, I pray of you, and drink no wine nor strong drink, and eat not any unclean thing” what “any unclean thing”? And more, until now was she eating unclean things, Rabbi Yitzḥak of the school of Rabbi Ami says: items that are forbidden to a nazirite.
sentences.llm_translation: And now, behold! Be careful and do not drink wine or strong drink and do not eat any unclean thing. What is "any unclean thing"? Until when did unclean things cease to be eaten?! Said Rabbi Yitzchak on behalf of Rabbi Ami: Unclean things that are forbidden to a Nazir. (

sentences.text: ״וַיִּבְקַע אֱלֹהִים אֶת הַמַּכְתֵּשׁ אֲשֶׁר בַּלֶּחִי״. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: הוּא אִיוָּה לְדָבָר טָמֵא — לְפִיכָךְ נִתְלוּ חַיָּיו בְּדָבָר טָמֵא.
sentences.human_translation: “But God cleaved the hollow place that is in Lehi, Rabbi Yitzḥak of the school of Rabbi Ami says: He desired something unclean, Therefore, his life was dependent on something unclean,
sentences.llm_translation: And God rent asunder the curtain that was in the midst. Said Rabbi Yitzchak, citing Rabbi Ami: He is Iyov for a matter of uncleanness — therefore his life was bound up with a matter of uncleanness. (

sentences.text: ״וַתָּחֵל רוּחַ ה׳ וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: חָלְתָה נְבוּאָתוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״יְהִי דָן נָחָשׁ עֲלֵי דֶרֶךְ״.
sentences.human_translation: “And the spirit of the Lord began [ vataḥel ] Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: The prophecy of Jacob our forefather took effect [ ḥaleta ] as it is written: “Dan shall be a serpent in the way,
sentences.llm_translation: "And the spirit of God hovered and went." Said Rabbi Hamnuna, son of Rabbi Chanina: "The prophecy of our father Jacob has been fulfilled, as it is written: 'Behold, a serpent lies on the path.'"

sentences.text: ״לְפַעֲמוֹ בְּמַחֲנֵה דָן״, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיְתָה שְׁכִינָה מְקַשְׁקֶשֶׁת לְפָנָיו כְּזוֹג. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״לְפַעֲמוֹ בְּמַחֲנֵה דָן״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״פַּעֲמֹן וְרִמֹּן״.
sentences.human_translation: “To move him [ lefa’amo ] in Mahaneh Dan.” Rabbi Yitzḥak of the school of Rabbi Ami says: teaches that the Divine Presence jangled before him, like a bell [ zog ], it is written here: “To move him [ lefa’amo ] in Mahaneh Dan,” and it is written there “A bell [ pa’amon ] and a pomegranate”
sentences.llm_translation: "For the sake of his father-in-law in camp" - said Rabbi Yitzchak, citing Rabbi Ami. He teaches that a Shechinah (Divine Presence) was fluttering before him like a dove. As it is written here: "For the sake of his father-in-law in camp", and as it is written there: "Paeamon and Rimmon".

sentences.text: ״בֵּין צׇרְעָה וּבֵין אֶשְׁתָּאוֹל״, אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: צׇרְעָה וְאֶשְׁתָּאוֹל שְׁנֵי הָרִים גְּדוֹלִים הָיוּ, וַעֲקָרָן שִׁמְשׁוֹן וּטְחָנָן זֶה בָּזֶה.
sentences.human_translation: “Between Zorah and Eshtaol.” Rabbi Asi says: Zorah and Eshtaol were two large mountains, and Samson uprooted them and ground them one against the other.
sentences.llm_translation: "Between Zera'ah and Between Eshtao'ol", said Rabbi Asi: "Zera'ah and Eshtao'ol were two great mountains, and the foundation of Shimon and Tchanan was this in that."

sentences.text: ״וְהוּא יָחֵל לְהוֹשִׁיעַ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל״, אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא:
sentences.human_translation: and he shall begin to save Israel Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says:
sentences.llm_translation: "And he will strive to save Israel", said Rabbi Hamuna before Rabbi Chanina. (

text: קִיֵּים זֶה כׇּל מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בָּזֶה.

וְאִי לָא עֲסִיק בֵּיהּ מֹשֶׁה — יִשְׂרָאֵל לָא הֲווֹ מִיעַסְקִי בֵּיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת עַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱלוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִמִּצְרַיִם קָבְרוּ בִשְׁכֶם״! וְתוּ: אִי לָא אִיעֲסַקוּ בֵּיהּ יִשְׂרָאֵל — בָּנָיו לָא הֲווֹ מִיעַסְקִי בֵּיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיִּהְיוּ לִבְנֵי יוֹסֵף לְנַחֲלָה״?!
אָמְרוּ: הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ, כְּבוֹדוֹ בִּמְרוּבִּים יוֹתֵר מִבְּמוּעָטִין. וְתוּ אָמְרוּ: הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ, כְּבוֹדוֹ בִּגְדוֹלִים יוֹתֵר מִבִּקְטַנִּים.
״קָבְרוּ בִּשְׁכֶם״. מַאי שְׁנָא בִּשְׁכֶם? אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִשְּׁכֶם גְּנָבוּהוּ, וְלִשְׁכֶם נַחְזִיר אֲבֵידָתוֹ.
קָשׁוּ קְרָאֵי אַהֲדָדֵי, כְּתִיב: ״וַיִּקַּח מֹשֶׁה אֶת עַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף עִמּוֹ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת עַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱלוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹ׳״!
אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כָּל הָעוֹשֶׂה דָּבָר וְלֹא גְּמָרוֹ, וּבָא אַחֵר וּגְמָרוֹ — מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב עַל שֶׁגְּמָרוֹ כְּאִילּוּ עֲשָׂאוֹ.
רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַף מוֹרִידִין אוֹתוֹ מִגְּדוּלָּתוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי בָּעֵת הַהִיא וַיֵּרֶד יְהוּדָה״.
רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: אַף קוֹבֵר אִשְׁתּוֹ וּבָנָיו, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתָּמׇת בַּת שׁוּעַ אֵשֶׁת יְהוּדָה וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּמׇת עֵר וְאוֹנָן״.
אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מִפְּנֵי מָה נִקְרָא יוֹסֵף עֲצָמוֹת בְּחַיָּיו — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא מִיחָה בִּכְבוֹד אָבִיו, דְּקָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ ״עַבְדְּךָ אָבִינוּ״, וְלָא אֲמַר לְהוּ וְלָא מִידֵּי.
וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה מֵת יוֹסֵף קוֹדֶם לְאֶחָיו — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִנְהִיג עַצְמוֹ בְּרַבָּנוּת.
״וְיוֹסֵף הוּרַד מִצְרָיְמָה״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״הוּרַד״ אֶלָּא ״הוֹרִיד״, שֶׁהוֹרִיד אִיצְטַגְנִינֵי פַּרְעֹה מִגְּדוּלָּתָן.

״וַיִּקְנֵהוּ פּוֹטִיפַר סְרִיס פַּרְעֹה״, אָמַר רַב: שֶׁקְּנָאוֹ לְעַצְמוֹ. בָּא (גַּבְרִיאֵל) [מִיכָאֵל] וְסֵירְסוֹ, בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וּפֵירְעוֹ. מֵעִיקָּרָא כְּתִיב ״פּוֹטִיפַר״, וּלְבַסּוֹף ״פּוֹטִיפֶרַע״.

מִי לָנוּ גָּדוֹל מִמֹּשֶׁה וְכוּ׳. ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֵלַי רַב לָךְ״, אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: בְּ״רַב״ בִּישֵּׂר, בְּ״רַב״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ. בְּ״רַב״ בִּישֵּׂר — ״רַב לָכֶם״. בְּ״רַב״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ — ״רַב לָךְ״.
דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״רַב לָךְ״ — רַב יֵשׁ לְךָ, וּמַנּוּ — יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״רַב לָךְ״, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ: הָרַב כַּמָּה קָשֶׁה, וְתַלְמִיד כַּמָּה סָרְבָן. וְכׇל כָּךְ לָמָּה? תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: לְפוּם גַּמְלָא שִׁיחְנָא.

״וַיֹּאמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם בֶּן מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים שָׁנָה אָנֹכִי הַיּוֹם״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״הַיּוֹם״: הַיּוֹם מָלְאוּ יָמַי וּשְׁנוֹתַי. לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַשְׁלִים שְׁנוֹתֵיהֶם שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים מִיּוֹם לְיוֹם וּמֵחֹדֶשׁ לְחֹדֶשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶת מִסְפַּר יָמֶיךָ אֲמַלֵּא״.

״לֹא אוּכַל עוֹד לָצֵאת וְלָבוֹא״. מַאי ״לָצֵאת וְלָבוֹא״? אִילֵימָא לָצֵאת וְלָבֹא מַמָּשׁ, וְהָכְתִיב: ״וּמֹשֶׁה בֶּן מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים שָׁנָה בְּמוֹתוֹ לֹא נָס לֵחֹה״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַל מֹשֶׁה מֵעַרְבֹת מוֹאָב אֶל הַר נְבוֹ״, וְתַנְיָא: שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה מַעֲלוֹת הָיוּ שָׁם, וּפְסָעָן מֹשֶׁה בִּפְסִיעָה אַחַת.
אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: לָצֵאת וְלָבוֹא בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁנִּסְתַּתְּמוּ מִמֶּנּוּ שַׁעֲרֵי חׇכְמָה.
״וַיֵּלֶךְ מֹשֶׁה וִיהוֹשֻׁעַ וַיִּתְיַצְּבוּ בְּאֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״. תָּנָא: אוֹתָהּ שַׁבָּת שֶׁל דְּיוֹ זוּגֵי הָיְתָה, נִיטְּלָה רְשׁוּת מִזֶּה, וְנִיתְּנָה לָזֶה.

וְתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אִילְמָלֵא מִקְרָא כָּתוּב, אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְאוֹמְרוֹ. הֵיכָן מֹשֶׁה מֵת — בְּחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל רְאוּבֵן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַל מֹשֶׁה מֵעַרְבֹת מוֹאָב אֶל הַר נְבוֹ״, וּנְבוֹ בְּחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל רְאוּבֵן קָיְימָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבְנֵי רְאוּבֵן בָּנוּ וְגוֹ׳ וְאֶת נְבוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.
״נְבוֹ״ — שֶׁשָּׁם מֵתוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה נְבִיאִים: מֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן וּמִרְיָם.

וְהֵיכָן מֹשֶׁה קָבוּר — בְּחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל גָּד, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּרְא רֵאשִׁית לוֹ וְגוֹ׳״. וּמֵחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל רְאוּבֵן עַד חֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל גָּד כַּמָּה הָוֵי — אַרְבָּעָה מִילִין. אוֹתָן אַרְבָּעָה מִילִין מִי הוֹלִיכוֹ?

מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיָה מֹשֶׁה מוּטָּל בְּכַנְפֵי שְׁכִינָה, וּמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת אוֹמְרִים: ״צִדְקַת ה׳ עָשָׂה וּמִשְׁפָּטָיו עִם יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״מִי יָקוּם לִי עִם מְרֵעִים מִי יִתְיַצֵּב לִי עִם פּוֹעֲלֵי אָוֶן״.

וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: ״מִי כְּהֶחָכָם וּמִי יוֹדֵעַ פֵּשֶׁר דָּבָר״, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: ״הַחׇכְמָה מֵאַיִן תִּמָּצֵא״, וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: ״וַיָּמׇת שָׁם מֹשֶׁה וְגוֹ׳״, סְמַלְיוֹן אָמַר: ״וַיָּמׇת שָׁם מֹשֶׁה סָפְרָא רַבָּה דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״.

תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מִיל עַל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מִיל, כְּנֶגֶד מַחֲנֵה יִשְׂרָאֵל, בַּת קוֹל מַשְׁמִיעַ וְאוֹמֵר: ״וַיָּמׇת מֹשֶׁה סָפְרָא רַבָּה דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: לֹא מֵת מֹשֶׁה, כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וַיָּמׇת שָׁם״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וַיְהִי שָׁם עִם ה׳״, מָה לְהַלָּן עוֹמֵד וּמְשַׁמֵּשׁ, אַף כָּאן עוֹמֵד וּמְשַׁמֵּשׁ.
״וַיִּקְבֹּר אוֹתוֹ בַגַּיְ בְּאֶרֶץ מוֹאָב מוּל בֵּית פְּעוֹר״. אָמַר רַבִּי בֶּרֶכְיָה: סִימָן בְּתוֹךְ סִימָן, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי: ״וְלֹא יָדַע אִישׁ אֶת קְבֻרָתוֹ״.

וְאִי לָא עֲסִיק בֵּיהּ מֹשֶׁה — יִשְׂרָאֵל לָא הֲווֹ מִיעַסְקִי בֵּיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת עַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱלוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִמִּצְרַיִם קָבְרוּ בִשְׁכֶם״! וְתוּ: אִי לָא אִיעֲסַקוּ בֵּיהּ יִשְׂרָאֵל — בָּנָיו לָא הֲווֹ מִיעַסְקִי בֵּיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיִּהְיוּ לִבְנֵי יוֹסֵף לְנַחֲלָה״?!
אָמְרוּ: הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ, כְּבוֹדוֹ בִּמְרוּבִּים יוֹתֵר מִבְּמוּעָטִין. וְתוּ אָמְרוּ: הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ, כְּבוֹדוֹ בִּגְדוֹלִים יוֹתֵר מִבִּקְטַנִּים.
״קָבְרוּ בִּשְׁכֶם״. מַאי שְׁנָא בִּשְׁכֶם? אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִשְּׁכֶם גְּנָבוּהוּ, וְלִשְׁכֶם נַחְזִיר אֲבֵידָתוֹ.
קָשׁוּ קְרָאֵי אַהֲדָדֵי, כְּתִיב: ״וַיִּקַּח מֹשֶׁה אֶת עַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף עִמּוֹ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת עַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱלוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹ׳״!
אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כָּל הָעוֹשֶׂה דָּבָר וְלֹא גְּמָרוֹ, וּבָא אַחֵר וּגְמָרוֹ — מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב עַל שֶׁגְּמָרוֹ כְּאִילּוּ עֲשָׂאוֹ.
רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַף מוֹרִידִין אוֹתוֹ מִגְּדוּלָּתוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי בָּעֵת הַהִיא וַיֵּרֶד יְהוּדָה״.
רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: אַף קוֹבֵר אִשְׁתּוֹ וּבָנָיו, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתָּמׇת בַּת שׁוּעַ אֵשֶׁת יְהוּדָה וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּמׇת עֵר וְאוֹנָן״.
אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מִפְּנֵי מָה נִקְרָא יוֹסֵף עֲצָמוֹת בְּחַיָּיו — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא מִיחָה בִּכְבוֹד אָבִיו, דְּקָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ ״עַבְדְּךָ אָבִינוּ״, וְלָא אֲמַר לְהוּ וְלָא מִידֵּי.
וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה מֵת יוֹסֵף קוֹדֶם לְאֶחָיו — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִנְהִיג עַצְמוֹ בְּרַבָּנוּת.
״וְיוֹסֵף הוּרַד מִצְרָיְמָה״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״הוּרַד״ אֶלָּא ״הוֹרִיד״, שֶׁהוֹרִיד אִיצְטַגְנִינֵי פַּרְעֹה מִגְּדוּלָּתָן.

״וַיִּקְנֵהוּ פּוֹטִיפַר סְרִיס פַּרְעֹה״, אָמַר רַב: שֶׁקְּנָאוֹ לְעַצְמוֹ. בָּא (גַּבְרִיאֵל) [מִיכָאֵל] וְסֵירְסוֹ, בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וּפֵירְעוֹ. מֵעִיקָּרָא כְּתִיב ״פּוֹטִיפַר״, וּלְבַסּוֹף ״פּוֹטִיפֶרַע״.

מִי לָנוּ גָּדוֹל מִמֹּשֶׁה וְכוּ׳. ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֵלַי רַב לָךְ״, אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: בְּ״רַב״ בִּישֵּׂר, בְּ״רַב״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ. בְּ״רַב״ בִּישֵּׂר — ״רַב לָכֶם״. בְּ״רַב״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ — ״רַב לָךְ״.
דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״רַב לָךְ״ — רַב יֵשׁ לְךָ, וּמַנּוּ — יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״רַב לָךְ״, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ: הָרַב כַּמָּה קָשֶׁה, וְתַלְמִיד כַּמָּה סָרְבָן. וְכׇל כָּךְ לָמָּה? תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: לְפוּם גַּמְלָא שִׁיחְנָא.

״וַיֹּאמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם בֶּן מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים שָׁנָה אָנֹכִי הַיּוֹם״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״הַיּוֹם״: הַיּוֹם מָלְאוּ יָמַי וּשְׁנוֹתַי. לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַשְׁלִים שְׁנוֹתֵיהֶם שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים מִיּוֹם לְיוֹם וּמֵחֹדֶשׁ לְחֹדֶשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶת מִסְפַּר יָמֶיךָ אֲמַלֵּא״.

And so: If not engaged in it with Israel - are his sons not to be engaged in it? And it is written: "They became the inheritance of the children of Joseph"?!

"They buried him in Shechem." What is the reason for burying him in Shechem? Rabbi Hamuna, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: "They stole it from Shechem, and we will restore its loss to Shechem."
Kashu k'rei ahaddei, ke'tiv: "Vayiqach Moshe et atsmot Yosef imo", u'ke'tiv: "Ve'et atsmot Yosef asher he'elevu b'nei Yisrael ve-gov"!

Rabbi Chama bar Rabbi Chanina said: Any one who does a thing and does not complete it, and another comes and completes it — the Scriptural text is elevated upon him because he completed it as if he had done it.
Rabbi El'eazar says: Even we teach him from his greatness, as it is written: "And it was at that time that he descended to Judea".

Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: Even if he covers his wife and children, as it is written: "And the daughter of Shelah, a woman of Judah, was married to Yehudah" (Genesis 38:26), and it is written: "And Er died, and Oren also".

Said Rav Yehudah said Rav: Because of what is Joseph called "Bones in his lifetime" - because he did not provoke shame to his father, as it says, "Your servant our Father" (Genesis 32:19), and he did not say to him i.e., Jacob nor did he do.
And Rav Yehudah said, and Rav said, and Rabi Hamuna said in the name of Rabi Chanina: Because of what Joseph died before his brothers — because he stirred up his soul with regard to our Master.
And Yosef said, "He will bring down from Mizraim". Rabbi Elazar said: Do not read "Hurad" but rather "Horid", for it is Horid that brings down the Egyptians' pride from their grandeur.

And Potiphar's eunuch acquired him. He said: He acquired him for himself. Gabriel Michael came and saw, Gabriel came and perceived. From the Torah it is written "Potiphar", and at the end "Potiphera".

Who is great to us than Moses and so-and-so? "And He said, 'My master to you'" (Genesis 15:2), said Rabbi Levi: In the case of "Rab" in Isaiah, it means "your lord", and in the case of "Rab" in Isaiah, it means "your lord him". In the case of "Rab" in Isaiah, it means "your lord to you". In the case of "Rab" in Isaiah, it means "my master to you".
Another matter: "Rav lach" - Rav is yours, and M'nai - Joshua.

Another matter: "Rav lach" 1, which they do not say: "The Rav is as hard as a rock, and the Talmid is as stubborn as an ox." And so what? The Tanna of Rabi Yishmael says: "For the sake of a camel's load."

"He said to them, 'I am thirty years old today.' But there is no tradition to say 'today': Today my days and years are fulfilled. To teach you that the Holy One, blessed be He, completes the years of the righteous from day to day and from month to month. As it is written: 'I will fill up your days'."

"Not shall I eat any longer to go out and come in." What is "to go out and come in"? Perhaps it means to go out and come back immediately, and it is written: "And Moses was eighty years old when he died, not having tasted death" (Deuteronomy 34:7), and it is written: "And Moses went up from the plains of Moab unto Mount Nebo" (Deuteronomy 34:1). And a tradition: There were seventeen ascents there, and Moses was in one ascent.
Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani, said Rabbi Yonatan: "To go out and to come in with words of Torah. Teaches that we were tested from him (i.e., from the Torah) gates of wisdom."

And Moses went and Joshua, and they sat in the Tent of Meeting. Tanna: That Sabbath which was the Sabbath of the Bonding of the Curtain, permission to remove from this side and to place on that side was given.

And it was taught, Rabbi Yehudah said: If there is no Scriptural basis for saying so, then it cannot be said. Where did Moses die? It is written: "And Moses went up from the plains of Moab unto Mount Nebo" (Deuteronomy 34:1), and Nebo is in the portion of Reuben, as it is written: "For to the sons of Reuben and to the sons of Gad had I given their inheritance" (Deuteronomy 3:15) and "And the children of Reuben and the children of Gad called the name of that land after them Nahaliel, by the river Jordan" (Joshua 13:26).
"Nevo'" - There, where three prophets died: Moses and Aaron and Miriam.

And where is Moses buried? In the portion of Gad, as it is written: "And he saw the resting place thereof, and Israel gave rest unto the face thereof" (Deuteronomy 3:27). And from the portion of Reuben until the portion of Gad how many cubits are there? Four mil. Who takes them?

Teaches that Moses was suspended in the wings of Shechinah, and the ministering angels say: "The righteousness of God has done, and His judgments with Israel", and the Holy One, blessed be He, says: "Who will rouse me against my enemies? Who will stand up for me against evildoers?"

And Shmuel said: "Who is as wise and who understands the explanation of a thing?" And Rabi Yochanan said: "Wisdom will not be found except from afar." And Rav Nachman said: "And there died Moses, and..." And Simeon said: "And there died Moses, a great scribe of Israel."

Talmudic text: A story, Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: Twelve miles on one side and twelve miles on the other side, like the camp of Israel. The voice is heard and it says: "And Moses died; a great prophet, mighty in all the signs and wonders that he wrought." And some say: Moses did not die, as it is written here: "He died there," and as it is written there: "There he was with God," what then is standing and serving? Even so, standing and serving.
And he buried him in the valley in the land of Moab, opposite Beth-Peor. Said Rabbi Berakya: Sign in the midst of sign, and even so: "And no man knoweth his grave."
And as for one who sends forth the kingdom of evil near.
