Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: Two Tannaim were, one in Yerida, and one in Aliya.

Rav Pappah said: One should not measure the extent of this courtyard — descent, and one should not measure the extent of this courtyard — ascent. Like a valley and a mountain, and in the midst of rivers and a market of fish.

"And he sat in the opening of eyes." 1 Rabbi Eliezer said: He teaches that she went and sat to him at the entrance of Abraham our father's, a place where the eyes are looking to see. Rabbi Chanin said Rab: That is the place called Eyes, and thus he says: "A flower and the eyes."

Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: "I have given eyes to her words." When she was asked, she said to him: "Perhaps you are a Gentile?" She replied to him: "I am a virgin." Perhaps you are the wife of a man? She replied to him: "I am a widow." Perhaps your father has received a divorce from you? She replied to him: "I am an orphan." Perhaps you are unclean? She replied to him: "I am pure."
And it was said: "And he planted a vineyard in Be'er Sheva" 1, said Reish Lakish: He teaches that he did a pardes, and planted in him all kinds of figs.

Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Nachman, one says: Pardes, and one says: Punedak. In any case, whoever says Pardes, behold it is written "And He planted". But whoever says Punedak, what is "And He planted"? As it is written: "And He planted tents for them and so on".
"And he called there in the name of God, the Eternal." He said Reish Lakish: "Do not read 'And he called'," (

To what may it be compared? It is written אֶלָּא "And He read" (Genesis 22:1). Teaches that Abraham our father read the name of the Holy One, blessed be He, in every place he passed and returned. How so? After they ate and drank, they stood to bless Him. He said to them: And is it from My table you are eating? From the table of the God of the universe you are eating! Praise, glorify, and bless whoever said and caused the world to be.
And Judah saw her and thought to prostitute her because she had uncovered her face. Because she had uncovered her face, did he think to prostitute her?!

Rabbi Elazar said: When she has turned her face towards her father's house. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: Any woman who is modest in her father's house - she is worthy and they send from her kings and prophets. Menalan - from Tammar. Prophets - as it is written: "The vision of Isaiah son of Amot." Kings - from David. And Rabbi Levi said: This matter is a tradition passed down to us from our ancestors: Amot and Amatziah - brothers they were.
"He is sought." "He is being sought" - from where? Rabbi Elazar said: After we found her signs, the angel Samiel came and pushed them away; Gabriel came and drew near.

The Gemara states: "According to what is written: 'To the end, for the chief musician, of the sons of Korah. David.'", Rabbi Yohanan said: When we remove the signs from it, it becomes like a widow's lament. "Of David" - this refers to David who went out from there, and he was full of wisdom and understanding for all. Another matter: "Of David" - this was his final blow, as he was born in haste. Another matter: "Of David" - just as in his smallness he diminished himself alongside someone greater than him to learn Torah, so too in his greatness.

"And she sent to her mother-in-law, saying to the man whose wife this is, 'I am pregnant.' And she said to him, 'Tell it!' Said Rabbi Zutra bar Tovia, and I said to him, 'Said Rabbi Chanina bar Bizna, and I said to him, 'Said Rabbi Shimon Chasida, and I said to him, 'Said Rabbi Yochanan on behalf of Rabbi Shimon ben Yohei: "Noah's merit is that he should throw himself into the midst of the fiery furnace, and not let his face be ashamed before the great ones." M'nalan — from Tammar."

"He shall know." He said, Rabbi Hamuna bar Rabbi Chanina: "In 'He shall know' the verse says to his father - in 'He shall know' it is said of him. In 'He shall know', it is said: 'He shall know now the garment of your son is this.' In 'He shall know', it is said: 'He shall know now, to whom?'
"Na'". There is no "na'" except for a request. He said to him: In a request from you, know the face of your Creator and do not lift up your eyes from me.

And Judah knew and said, "Righteousness is from me." Now, what did Rav Chanina bar Bizna say that Rabbi Shimon Chasida said? Joseph who sanctified the name of Heaven in secret - he has merit and you add to him one letter from the name of the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is written: "Testimony is from Joseph, he has placed."

Yehudah, who sanctified the name of Heaven in a parshya, is worthy and called upon to recite the entire blessing on the Name of the Holy One, blessed be He. When Yehudah said, "Vindicate me from mine enemy," a voice went forth and said: You have saved Tamar and her two sons from the fiery furnace - your life that I am saving in your merit, three of your children from the fiery furnace. Who is it that has been saved? Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah.
"Righteousness is from me." What did he know? A daughter of the voice went out and said: "From me shall go forth the bound ones." (

And he did not cease to know. Said Shmuel Saba, a student of Rav Shmuel bar Ami, in the name of his teacher Rav Shmuel bar Ami: When he knew it - he did not desist from it. As it is written here: "And he did not cease to know", and as it is written there: "A great voice and he did not cease". (

Abishalom was exalted in his esteem and so on. The rabbis taught: Abishalom was exalted in his esteem, for it is said: "And there was no man so renowned as Abishalom." And when he shaved his head and became bald, it would be after many days that he would shave again, because it weighed heavily upon him and he would shave and weigh the weight of his head at two hundred shekels in the king's stone. The Tanna taught: This is the stone which men of Teverya and men of Zippori weigh.

Therefore, it was suspended in his hair, as it is said: "And Absalom rode on the mule and came to the pool of Gibeon. And he took hold of the pillars and leaned upon them, and all the people that were with him did likewise. And Absalom spoke unto Joab, and sent for him, yet he looked not down upon him; but he saw him, and cursed him in his heart" (2 Samuel 16:14-15). Consider the words of Rav Yishmael: At that very hour, Sheol was rent asunder from beneath.

וַיִּרְגַּז הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיַּעַל עַל עֲלִיַּית הַשַּׁעַר וַיֵּבְךְּ וְכֹה אָמַר בְּלֶכְתּוֹ בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם מִי יִתֵּן מוּתִי אֲנִי תַחְתֶּיךָ אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי. וְהַמֶּלֶךְ לָאַט אֶת פָּנָיו וַיִּזְעַק הַמֶּלֶךְ קוֹל גָּדוֹל בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי. הָנֵי תְּמָנְיָא "בְּנִי" לְמָה? שִׁבְעָה דְּאַסְּקֵיהּ מִשִּׁבְעָה מְדוֹרֵי גֵיהִנָּם, וְאִידַּךְ, אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּקָרֵיב רֵישֵׁיהּ לְגַבֵּי גוּפֵיהּ, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּאַיְיתֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי. English translation: And the king was enraged and ascended to the upper gate and wept, and he said when he came in: "My son Absalom! My son Absalom! Who will give me to die? I am beneath your feet, my son Absalom! My son Absalom! And the king covered his face and a great cry was heard from the king: "My son Absalom! My son Absalom!" And these are the words of the prophet: "Why?" Because seven times he asked for it from seven heavens, and I said: "It is fitting that his head be upon his body," and I said: "He will give him to the world of the end."

And Abishalom took and set for himself in his lifetime. What is "took"? Rabbi Lakish said: He took a bad deal for himself. "As the setting of the tabernacle which is in the valley of the king and so on", said Rabbi Chanina bar Pappi: In a deep counsel of the King of the World, (

sentences.text: הוּחַל שְׁבוּעָתוֹ שֶׁל אֲבִימֶלֶךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם תִּשְׁקֹר לִי וּלְנִינִי וּלְנֶכְדִּי״.
sentences.human_translation: the oath of Abimelech, was negated, as it is written that you will not deal falsely with me, nor with my son, nor with my son’s son;
sentences.llm_translation: הוּחַל שְׁבוּעָתוֹ שֶׁל אֲבִימֶלֶךְ, דִּכְתִיב: "אִם תִּשְׁקֹר לִי וּלְנִינִי וּלְנֶכְדִּי" (

sentences.text: ״וַיִּגְדַּל הַנַּעַר וַיְבָרְכֵהוּ ה׳״. בַּמֶּה בֵּרְכוֹ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, שֶׁבֵּרְכוֹ בְּאַמָּתוֹ: אַמָּתוֹ כִּבְנֵי אָדָם, וְזַרְעוֹ כְּנַחַל שׁוֹטֵף.
sentences.human_translation: and the child grew, and the Lord blessed him” With what did He bless him? Rav Yehuda says Rav says: that He blessed him with regard to his penis, his penis like men, and his seed like an overflowing river.
sentences.llm_translation: And the boy grew up and God blessed him. How did He bless him? Said Rabbi Yehuda said Rabbi, that He blessed him in his measure: His measure is like the sons of men, and his seed is like a flowing stream.

sentences.text: ״וַיִּקְרָא שִׁמְשׁוֹן אֶל ה׳ וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֱלֹהִים זׇכְרֵנִי נָא וְחַזְּקֵנִי נָא אַךְ הַפַּעַם הַזֶּה וְאִנָּקְמָה נְקַם אַחַת מִשְּׁתֵי עֵינַי מִפְּלִשְׁתִּים״. אָמַר רַב: אָמַר שִׁמְשׁוֹן לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, זְכוֹר לִי עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁתַּיִם שָׁנָה שֶׁשָּׁפַטְתִּי אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְלֹא אָמַרְתִּי לְאֶחָד מֵהֶם הַעֲבֵר לִי מַקֵּל מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם.
sentences.human_translation: “And Samson called unto the Lord, and said: Lord God, remember me, I pray to You, and strengthen me, I pray to You, only this once, that I may be this once avenged of the Philistines for my two eyes” Rav said Samson said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, remember my twenty-two years that I judged the Jewish people and I did not say to any one of them: Move a stick for me from place to place.
sentences.llm_translation: "And Shimon called out to Hashem and said, 'Hashem, God of the universe, remember me now and strengthen me now. Only this time and I will take revenge for one of my eyes from the Philistines.' He said Rav: Shimon said before the Holy One, blessed be He: 'My Master, Lord of the world, remember to me twenty-five years since I judged Israel, and I did not say to any of them, "Move from place to place."'"

sentences.text: ״וַיֵּלֶךְ שִׁמְשׁוֹן וַיִּלְכֹּד שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת שׁוּעָלִים״. מַאי שְׁנָא שׁוּעָלִים? אָמַר רַבִּי אַיְּבוּ בַּר נַגְדִּי אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: אָמַר שִׁמְשׁוֹן, יָבֹא מִי שֶׁחוֹזֵר לַאֲחוֹרָיו, וְיִפָּרַע מִפְּלִשְׁתִּים שֶׁחָזְרוּ בִּשְׁבוּעָתָן.
sentences.human_translation: “And Samson went and caught three hundred foxes, What is different foxes Rabbi Aivu bar Nagdi says Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says: Samson said: Let that goes in reverse come and exact punishment from the Philistines, who reneged on their oath
sentences.llm_translation: "And Shimshon went and took three hundred shoalim." What are shoalim? Rabbi Ayyub bar Nagdi said that Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said: Shimshon said, "Whoever returns to his fellow, and will redeem from plunderers those who returned in their oath."

sentences.text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הֶחָסִיד: בֵּין כְּתֵיפָיו שֶׁל שִׁמְשׁוֹן שִׁשִּׁים אַמָּה הָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּשְׁכַּב שִׁמְשׁוֹן עַד חֲצִי הַלַּיְלָה וַיָּקׇם בַּחֲצִי הַלַּיְלָה וַיֶּאֱחֹז בְּדַלְתוֹת שַׁעַר הָעִיר וּבִשְׁתֵּי הַמְּזוּזוֹת וַיִּסָּעֵם עִם הַבְּרִיחַ וַיָּשֶׂם עַל כְּתֵיפָיו״, וּגְמִירִי דְּאֵין דַּלְתוֹת עַזָּה פְּחוּתוֹת מִשִּׁשִּׁים אַמָּה.
sentences.human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon the Pious said: between the shoulders of Samson was sixty cubits, as it is stated: “And Samson lay till midnight, and arose at midnight, and grabbed hold of the doors of the gate of the city, and the two posts, and plucked them up, bar and all, and put them upon his shoulders, and it is learned that doors of Gaza were no less than sixty cubits
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: A tale, said Rabbi Shimon HaChasid: Between the gates of Shimson, which were sixty cubits, as it is said: "And Shimson lay down until half the night and arose in the middle of the night and took hold of the doorposts of the city and the lintels and the hinges and placed them on his shoulders," and there are no doorposts stronger than sixty cubits.

sentences.text: ״וַיְהִי טוֹחֵן בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִים״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין טְחִינָה אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן עֲבֵירָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״תִּטְחַן לְאַחֵר אִשְׁתִּי״. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד הֵבִיא לוֹ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ לְבֵית הָאֲסוּרִים כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּתְעַבֵּר הֵימֶנּוּ. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: קַמֵּי דְּשָׁתֵי חַמְרָא — חַמְרָא, קַמֵּי רָפוֹקָא (גְּרִידְיָא — דּוּבְלָא).
sentences.human_translation: and he did grind in the prison-house” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Grinding is nothing other a language of a transgression and so says: “Then let my wife grind unto another man” teaches that each and every brought his wife to the prison in order that she should be impregnated by Rav Pappa said: This that people say: Before a wine drinker, wine; before one who digs in the ground, figs.
sentences.llm_translation: It was when Tachan was in the house of the Asurim. Rabbi Yohanan said: There is no Tachanah except for a forbidden tongue, and thus he says: "Tachan le-achar ish'ti". He teaches that one person brought his wife to the house of the Asurim so that she would be ashamed before him. Rabbi Pappai said: Now we say as people say: Kamei d'Shatay Chamra — Chamra, Kamei Rapoka (Griadya — Dubla).

sentences.text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַמְזַנֶּה — אִשְׁתּוֹ (מְזַנֶּנֶת) [מְזַנָּה] עָלָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם נִפְתָּה לִבִּי עַל אִשָּׁה וְעַל פֶּתַח רֵעִי אָרָבְתִּי״, וּכְתִיב: ״תִּטְחַן לְאַחֵר אִשְׁתִּי וְעָלֶיהָ יִכְרְעוּן אֲחֵרִין״, וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: אִיהוּ בֵּי קָארֵי, וְאִיתְּתֵיהּ בֵּי בוּצִינֵי.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: anyone who commits adultery, his wife commits adultery against him, as it is stated: “If my heart has been enticed unto a woman, and I have lain in wait at my neighbor’s door” and it is written: “Then let my wife grind unto another man and may strangers kneel over her” And this that people say: He is among the pumpkins [ karei ] and his wife among the zucchinis [ butzinei ],
sentences.llm_translation: And Rabbi Yohanan said: All the troubles that befall him - he is responsible for them (מְזַנֶּה) מְזַנָּה upon himself, as it is written: "If my heart has been enticed by a woman and I have been caught by the thoughts of my neighbor" 1, and it is written: "Trust in another wife and may others be bound to her", and behold, we say: He is in the midst of troubles (בֵּי קָארֵי), and she is in the midst of snares (בֵּי בוּצִינֵי).

sentences.text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שִׁמְשׁוֹן דָּן אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל כַּאֲבִיהֶם שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״דָּן יָדִין עַמּוֹ כְּאַחַד וְגוֹ׳״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שִׁמְשׁוֹן עַל שְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נִקְרָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי שֶׁמֶשׁ וּמָגֵן ה׳ אֱלֹהִים וְגוֹ׳״. אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, לֹא יִמָּחֶה! אֶלָּא: מֵעֵין שְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: מָה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מֵגֵין עַל כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ — אַף שִׁמְשׁוֹן מֵגֵין בְּדוֹרוֹ עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Samson judged the Jewish people as their Father in Heaven as it is stated: “Dan shall judge his people, as one And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Samson [ Shimshon ] is called by the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, as it is stated: “For the Lord God is a sun [ shemesh ] and a shield” If that is so, should not be erased Rather, is akin to the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, just as the Holy One, Blessed be He, protects the entire world, so too Samson, in his generation, protected all the Jewish people.
sentences.llm_translation: And Rabbi Yohanan said: Shimon Dan is judging Israel as their father in heaven, as it is written: "Judge your people, O God, and deal with us that we may be aware of it" (Psalm 82:8). And Rabbi Yohanan said: Shimon is on the name of the Holy One, blessed be He, which is called, as it is written: "For the Lord, the Lord, is a God of knowledge, and by Him actions are weighed" (Psalm 36:6). But now, let him not be erased! Rather: from the aspect of the name of the Holy One, blessed be He: what does the Holy One, blessed be He, weigh in judgment over all the world - so too Shimon weighs in judgment over Israel.

sentences.text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בִּלְעָם חִיגֵּר בְּרַגְלוֹ אַחַת הָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וַיֵּלֶךְ שֶׁפִי״. שִׁמְשׁוֹן חִיגֵּר בִּשְׁתֵּי רַגְלָיו הָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שְׁפִיפֹן עֲלֵי אֹרַח״.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Balaam was lame in one of his legs, as it is stated “And he went, limping [ shefi ]” Samson was lame in his two legs, as it is stated a horned snake [ shefifon ] in the path”
sentences.llm_translation: And Rabbi Yohanan said: Bilam was a chigger on his leg once, as it is written "And he went with the flow". Shimon was a chigger on both of his legs, as it is written: "A stumbling block on the path".

sentences.text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חֲמִשָּׁה נִבְרְאוּ מֵעֵין דּוּגְמָא שֶׁל מַעְלָה, וְכוּלָּן לָקוּ בָּהֶן. שִׁמְשׁוֹן בְּכֹחוֹ, שָׁאוּל בְּצַוָּארוֹ, אַבְשָׁלוֹם בִּשְׂעָרוֹ, צִדְקִיָּה בְּעֵינָיו, אָסָא בְּרַגְלָיו.
sentences.human_translation: The Sages taught Five were created akin to a representation of the High, and they were all stricken by that Samson in his strength, Saul in his neck Absalom in his hair, Zedekiah in his eyes, Asa in his feet.
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: Our Rabbis taught: Five people were compared to a pattern from above, and all of them fulfilled it. Shimon was in his strength, Saul in his necktie, Avshalom in his hair, Tzidkiyah in his eyes, and Asa in his feet.

sentences.text: שִׁמְשׁוֹן בְּכֹחוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּסַר כֹּחוֹ מֵעָלָיו״.
sentences.human_translation: Samson by his strength, as it is written: and his strength went from him”
sentences.llm_translation: Shimon b'Kocho, as it is written: "And He took His power from Him."

sentences.text: שָׁאוּל בְּצַוָּארוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּקַּח שָׁאוּל אֶת הַחֶרֶב וַיִּפֹּל עָלֶיהָ״.
sentences.human_translation: Saul in his neck, as it is written: Therefore, Saul took his sword and fell upon it”
sentences.llm_translation: Shaul b'tzavaro, d'ikhtiv: "Vayiqach Shaul et ha'cherev vayi'pol alah".

sentences.text: אַבְשָׁלוֹם בִּשְׂעָרוֹ, כִּדְבָעֵינַן לְמֵימַר קַמַּן. צִדְקִיָּה בְּעֵינָיו, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת עֵינֵי צִדְקִיָּהוּ עִוֵּר״.
sentences.human_translation: Absalom in his hair, as we will state later. Zedekiah in his eyes, as it is written: and put out the eyes of Zedekiah,
sentences.llm_translation: Abshalom in his wisdom, as we have learned in the previous chapter. Tzidkiyah in his eyes, as it is written: "And the eyes of Tzidkiyah shall be blinded."

sentences.text: אָסָא בְּרַגְלָיו, דִּכְתִיב: ״רַק לְעֵת זִקְנָתוֹ חָלָה אֶת רַגְלָיו״, וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: שֶׁאֲחָזַתּוּ פָּדַגְרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן לְרַב נַחְמָן: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי פָּדַגְרָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּמַחַט בִּבְשַׂר הַחַי. מְנָא יָדַע? אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: מֵיחַשׁ הֲוָה חָשׁ בֵּיהּ. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: מֵרַבֵּיהּ שְׁמַע לֵיהּ. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: ״סוֹד ה׳ לִירֵאָיו וּבְרִיתוֹ לְהוֹדִיעָם״.
sentences.human_translation: Asa in his feet, as it is written: But in the time of his old age he was diseased in his feet” And Rav Yehuda says Rav says: that gout [ padagra ] grabbed hold of him. Mar Zutra, son of Rav Naḥman, said to Rav Naḥman: What are the circumstances gout? He said to him: like a needle into living flesh. From where did he know this? Some say suffered from this and some say he heard it from his teacher, and some say “The secret of the Lord is with them that fear Him; and His covenant, to make them know it”
sentences.llm_translation: He said in accordance with his leg, as it is written: "Only in his old age does he suffer from his leg," and Rav Yehuda said that Rav said: We have learned a Pdagra. His teacher, Mar Zutra, asked him before Rav Nachman to Rav Nachman: How do we expound Pdagra? He said to him: As one cuts flesh from the living. Did he know? There is someone who says: It was a matter of great concern for him. And there is someone who says: Listen to his words. And there is someone who says: "The secret of Hashem is with those who fear Him, and His covenant He will show them."

sentences.text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה נֶעֱנַשׁ אָסָא — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעָשָׂה אַנְגַּרְיָא בְּתַלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהַמֶּלֶךְ אָסָא הִשְׁמִיעַ אֶת כׇּל יְהוּדָה אֵין נָקִי״. מַאי ״אֵין נָקִי״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אֲפִילּוּ חָתָן מֵחֶדְרוֹ וְכַלָּה מֵחוּפָּתָהּ.
sentences.human_translation: Rava taught: For what Asa punished Because he made Torah scholars perform forced labor [ angarya ], as it is stated: “Then King Asa made a proclamation unto all Judah; none was exempted; everyone, including What “None was exempted [ ein naki ]”? Rav Yehuda says Rav says: even a bridegroom from his chamber and a bride from her canopy,
sentences.llm_translation: Darash Rava: Because of what we are embarrassed, Aisa - because Angarya was done by students of wise men, as it is said: "And King Aisa proclaimed throughout all Judah that there is no innocent one." What does "there is no innocent one" mean? Said Rav Yehuda said Rav: Even a groom from his chamber and a bride from her canopy.

sentences.text: כְּתִיב: ״וַיֵּרֶד שִׁמְשׁוֹן תִּמְנָתָה״, וּכְתִיב: ״הִנֵּה חָמִיךְ עֹלֶה תִמְנָתָה״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שִׁמְשׁוֹן שֶׁנִּתְגַּנָּה בָּהּ — כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ יְרִידָה. יְהוּדָה שֶׁנִּתְעַלָּה בָּהּ — כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ עֲלִיָּה.
sentences.human_translation: It is written “And Samson went down to Timnah, and it is written Behold, your father-in-law is going up to Timnah Rabbi Elazar says: Samson, who was disgraced there descent is written with regard to his Judah, who was elevated there, ascent is written with regard to his
sentences.llm_translation: It is written: "And Shimshon came down to Timnathah", and it is written: "Behold, the mountain of Gilboa is lifted up over Timnathah". Rabbi Elazar said: Shimshon who was humbled in her - it is written about him a descent. Judah who was exalted in her - it is written about him an elevation. (

sentences.text: רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: שְׁתֵּי תִּמְנָאוֹת הָיוּ, חֲדָא בִּירִידָה, וַחֲדָא בַּעֲלִיָּה.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says There were two Timnah, one by descent and one by ascent.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: Two Tannaim were, one in Yerida, and one in Aliya.

sentences.text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: חֲדָא תִּמְנָה הֲוַאי, דְּאָתֵי מֵהַאי גִּיסָא — יְרִידָה, וּדְאָתֵי מֵהַאי גִּיסָא — עֲלִיָּה. כְּגוֹן וַרְדּוֹנְיָא וּבֵי בָארֵי וְשׁוּקָא דְנַרֶשׁ.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Pappa said There was one Timnah, who came from this side descent, and who came from that side ascent. For example: Vardonia, and Bei Varei, and the market of Neresh.
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Pappah said: One should not measure the extent of this courtyard — descent, and one should not measure the extent of this courtyard — ascent. Like a valley and a mountain, and in the midst of rivers and a market of fish.

sentences.text: ״וַתֵּשֶׁב בְּפֶתַח עֵינַיִם״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִי: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָלְכָה וְיָשְׁבָה לָהּ בְּפִתְחוֹ שֶׁל אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ, מָקוֹם שֶׁכׇּל עֵינַיִם צוֹפוֹת לִרְאוֹתוֹ. רַבִּי חָנִין אָמַר רַב: מָקוֹם הוּא שֶׁשְּׁמוֹ עֵינַיִם, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״תַּפּוּחַ וְהָעֵינָם״.
sentences.human_translation: and sat in the entrance of Enaim [ befetaḥ einayim ], Rabbi Alexandri says: teaches that she went and she sat at the entrance of Abraham our forefather, a place that all eyes hope to see it, Rabbi Ḥanin Rav says: a place called Enaim, and similarly states “Tappuah and Enam”
sentences.llm_translation: "And he sat in the opening of eyes." 1 Rabbi Eliezer said: He teaches that she went and sat to him at the entrance of Abraham our father's, a place where the eyes are looking to see. Rabbi Chanin said Rab: That is the place called Eyes, and thus he says: "A flower and the eyes."

sentences.text: רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: שֶׁנָּתְנָה עֵינַיִם לִדְבָרֶיהָ. כְּשֶׁתְּבָעָהּ אָמַר לָהּ: שֶׁמָּא נׇכְרִית אַתְּ? אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: גִּיּוֹרֶת אֲנִי. שֶׁמָּא אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ אַתְּ? אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: פְּנוּיָה אֲנִי. שֶׁמָּא קִיבֵּל בִּךְ אָבִיךָ קִידּוּשִׁין? אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: יְתוֹמָה אֲנִי. שֶׁמָּא טְמֵאָה אַתְּ? אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: טְהוֹרָה אֲנִי.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says: She provided eyes [ einayim ] for her statements, When solicited her he said to her: you perhaps are a gentile? She said to him: I am a convert. Perhaps you are a married woman? She said to him: I am an unmarried woman. Perhaps your father accepted betrothal for you She said to him: I am an orphan. Maybe you are impure? She said to him: I am pure.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: "I have given eyes to her words." When she was asked, she said to him: "Perhaps you are a Gentile?" She replied to him: "I am a virgin." Perhaps you are the wife of a man? She replied to him: "I am a widow." Perhaps your father has received a divorce from you? She replied to him: "I am an orphan." Perhaps you are unclean? She replied to him: "I am pure."

sentences.text: ״וַיִּטַּע אֶשֶׁל בִּבְאֵר שָׁבַע״, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעָשָׂה פַּרְדֵּס, וְנָטַע בּוֹ כׇּל מִינֵי מְגָדִים.
sentences.human_translation: “And he planted an eshel in Beersheba, Reish Lakish says: teaches that made an orchard and planted in it all kinds of sweet things.
sentences.llm_translation: And it was said: "And he planted a vineyard in Be'er Sheva" 1, said Reish Lakish: He teaches that he did a pardes, and planted in him all kinds of figs.

sentences.text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, חַד אָמַר: פַּרְדֵּס, וְחַד אָמַר: פּוּנְדָּק. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פַּרְדֵּס, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״וַיִּטַּע״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פּוּנְדָּק, מַאי ״וַיִּטַּע״? כְּדִכְתִיב: ״וַיִּטַּע אׇהֳלֵי אַפַּדְנוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Neḥemya One said an orchard [ pardes ], and one said an inn [ pundak ]. Granted, according to the one who said an orchard, this is what is written: “And he planted,” But according to the one who said an inn, what is “and he planted”? As it is written: “And he shall plant [ vayitta ] the tents of his palace
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Nachman, one says: Pardes, and one says: Punedak. In any case, whoever says Pardes, behold it is written "And He planted". But whoever says Punedak, what is "And He planted"? As it is written: "And He planted tents for them and so on".

sentences.text: ״וַיִּקְרָא שָׁם בְּשֵׁם ה׳ אֵל עוֹלָם״. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״וַיִּקְרָא״,
sentences.human_translation: and called there [ vayyikra ] on the name of the Lord, the Everlasting God” Reish Lakish said: Do not read “ vayyikra ,”
sentences.llm_translation: "And he called there in the name of God, the Eternal." He said Reish Lakish: "Do not read 'And he called'," (

sentences.text: אֶלָּא ״וַיַּקְרִיא״. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִקְרִיא אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ לִשְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּפֶה כׇּל עוֹבֵר וָשָׁב. כֵּיצַד? לְאַחַר שֶׁאָכְלוּ וְשָׁתוּ, עָמְדוּ לְבָרְכוֹ. אָמַר לָהֶם: וְכִי מִשֶּׁלִּי אֲכַלְתֶּם? מִשֶּׁל אֱלֹהֵי עוֹלָם אֲכַלְתֶּם! הוֹדוּ וְשַׁבְּחוּ וּבָרְכוּ לְמִי שֶׁאָמַר וְהָיָה הָעוֹלָם.
sentences.human_translation: rather vayyakri , and he caused to call. teaches that Abraham our forefather caused the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, to be called in the mouth of all passersby. How so? After ate and drank, they arose to bless him. He said to them: But did you eat from mine? you ate from the God of the world. you thank and praise and bless the One Who spoke and the world was
sentences.llm_translation: To what may it be compared? It is written אֶלָּא "And He read" (Genesis 22:1). Teaches that Abraham our father read the name of the Holy One, blessed be He, in every place he passed and returned. How so? After they ate and drank, they stood to bless Him. He said to them: And is it from My table you are eating? From the table of the God of the universe you are eating! Praise, glorify, and bless whoever said and caused the world to be.

sentences.text: ״וַיִּרְאֶהָ יְהוּדָה וַיַּחְשְׁבֶהָ לְזוֹנָה כִּי כִסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ״. מִשּׁוּם דְּכִסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ, חַשְּׁבַהּ לְזוֹנָה?!
sentences.human_translation: “When Judah saw her, he thought her to be a prostitute, for she had covered her face” Because she had covered her face he thought her to be a prostitute?
sentences.llm_translation: And Judah saw her and thought to prostitute her because she had uncovered her face. Because she had uncovered her face, did he think to prostitute her?!

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שֶׁכִּסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: כׇּל כַּלָּה שֶׁהִיא צְנוּעָה בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ — זוֹכָה וְיוֹצְאִין מִמֶּנָּה מְלָכִים וּנְבִיאִים. מְנָלַן — מִתָּמָר. נְבִיאִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״חֲזוֹן יְשַׁעְיָהוּ בֶן אָמוֹץ״. מְלָכִים — מִדָּוִד. וְאָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: דָּבָר זֶה מָסוֹרֶת בְּיָדֵינוּ מֵאֲבוֹתֵינוּ: אָמוֹץ וַאֲמַצְיָה — אַחִים הֲווֹ.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: that covered her face in the home of her father-in-law, As Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: Any daughter-in-law who is modest in the house of her father-in-law merits that kings and prophets emerge from her. From where do we From Tamar. Prophets as it is written: “The vision of Isaiah, the son of Amoz” Kings from David. And Rabbi Levi says: This matter is a tradition we from our ancestors: Amoz, and Amaziah, were brothers.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: When she has turned her face towards her father's house. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: Any woman who is modest in her father's house - she is worthy and they send from her kings and prophets. Menalan - from Tammar. Prophets - as it is written: "The vision of Isaiah son of Amot." Kings - from David. And Rabbi Levi said: This matter is a tradition passed down to us from our ancestors: Amot and Amatziah - brothers they were.

sentences.text: ״הִיא מוּצֵאת״. ״הִיא מִיתּוֹצֵאת״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ סִימָנֶיהָ בָּא סַמָּאֵל וְרִיחֲקָן, בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וְקֵירְבָן.
sentences.human_translation: “When she was brought forth [ mutzet ], It should have When she was mitutzet . Rabbi Elazar says: After her signs, were brought out, Samael came and distanced them Gabriel came and moved closer
sentences.llm_translation: "He is sought." "He is being sought" - from where? Rabbi Elazar said: After we found her signs, the angel Samiel came and pushed them away; Gabriel came and drew near.

sentences.text: הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״לִמְנַצֵּחַ עַל יוֹנַת אֵלֶם רְחוֹקִים לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנִּתְרַחֲקוּ סִימָנֶיהָ נַעֲשֵׂית כְּיוֹנָה אִילֶּמֶת. ״לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם״: שֶׁיָּצָא מִמֶּנָּה דָּוִד, שֶׁהָיָה מָךְ וְתָם לַכֹּל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מִכְתָּם״ — שֶׁהָיְתָה מַכָּתוֹ תַּמָּה, שֶׁנּוֹלַד כְּשֶׁהוּא מָהוּל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מִכְתָּם״ — כְּשֵׁם שֶׁבְּקַטְנוּתוֹ הִקְטִין עַצְמוֹ אֵצֶל מִי שֶׁגָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה, כָּךְ בִּגְדוּלָּתוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: This is as it is written: “For the leader, upon yonat eilem reḥokim , a psalm [ mikhtam ] of David” Rabbi Yoḥanan says From the moment that her signs were distanced [ reḥokim ], she became like a mute dove [ yona illemet ]. “a psalm [ mikhtam ] of David” from whom David emerged, as he was modest [ makh ] and flawless [ tam ] with everyone. Alternatively, mikhtam that makkato , was complete [ tama ], that was born circumcised. Alternatively, mikhtam just as in his youth made himself small in front of one who was greater than him to learn Torah so too, when he became great
sentences.llm_translation: The Gemara states: "According to what is written: 'To the end, for the chief musician, of the sons of Korah. David.'", Rabbi Yohanan said: When we remove the signs from it, it becomes like a widow's lament. "Of David" - this refers to David who went out from there, and he was full of wisdom and understanding for all. Another matter: "Of David" - this was his final blow, as he was born in haste. Another matter: "Of David" - just as in his smallness he diminished himself alongside someone greater than him to learn Torah, so too in his greatness.

sentences.text: ״וְהִיא שָׁלְחָה אֶל חָמִיהָ לֵאמֹר לְאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר אֵלֶּה לּוֹ אָנֹכִי הָרָה״. וְתֵימָא לֵיהּ מֵימָר! אָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא, וְאָמְרִי לָהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: נוֹחַ לוֹ לָאָדָם שֶׁיַּפִּיל עַצְמוֹ לְתוֹךְ כִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ, וְאַל יַלְבִּין פְּנֵי חֲבֵירוֹ בָּרַבִּים. מְנָלַן — מִתָּמָר.
sentences.human_translation: “She sent to her father-in-law, saying: By the man whose these are, am I with child” And let her say to him Rav Zutra bar Tuviyya says Rav says, and some say Rav Ḥana bar Bizna says Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida says, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: It is more amenable for a person to throw himself into a fiery furnace and not humiliate another in public. From where do we From Tamar,
sentences.llm_translation: "And she sent to her mother-in-law, saying to the man whose wife this is, 'I am pregnant.' And she said to him, 'Tell it!' Said Rabbi Zutra bar Tovia, and I said to him, 'Said Rabbi Chanina bar Bizna, and I said to him, 'Said Rabbi Shimon Chasida, and I said to him, 'Said Rabbi Yochanan on behalf of Rabbi Shimon ben Yohei: "Noah's merit is that he should throw himself into the midst of the fiery furnace, and not let his face be ashamed before the great ones." M'nalan — from Tammar."

sentences.text: ״הַכֶּר נָא״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישֵּׂר לְאָבִיו — בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ. בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישֵּׂר: ״הַכֶּר נָא הַכְּתֹנֶת בִּנְךָ הִיא״. בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ: ״הַכֶּר נָא לְמִי״.
sentences.human_translation: Discern, please, Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: With discern informed his father with discern they informed With discern he informed Discern now whether it is your son’s coat With discern they informed him: Discern, please, whose are
sentences.llm_translation: "He shall know." He said, Rabbi Hamuna bar Rabbi Chanina: "In 'He shall know' the verse says to his father - in 'He shall know' it is said of him. In 'He shall know', it is said: 'He shall know now the garment of your son is this.' In 'He shall know', it is said: 'He shall know now, to whom?'

sentences.text: ״נָא״. אֵין ״נָא״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן בַּקָּשָׁה. אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: בְּבַקָּשָׁה מִמְּךָ, הַכֵּר פְּנֵי בּוֹרַאֲךָ וְאַל תַּעֲלִים עֵינֶיךָ מִמֶּנִּי.
sentences.human_translation: please [ na ].” na nothing other a language of request. She said to him: I request of you: Discern the image of your Creator and do not avert your eyes from me.
sentences.llm_translation: "Na'". There is no "na'" except for a request. He said to him: In a request from you, know the face of your Creator and do not lift up your eyes from me.

sentences.text: ״וַיַּכֵּר יְהוּדָה וַיֹּאמֶר צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַב חָנִין בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא: יוֹסֵף שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בַּסֵּתֶר — זָכָה וְהוֹסִיפוּ לוֹ אוֹת אַחַת מִשְּׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״עֵדוּת בִּיהוֹסֵף שָׂמוֹ״.
sentences.human_translation: “And Judah acknowledged them, and said: She is more righteous than I; This is as Rav Ḥanin bar Bizna says Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida says: Joseph, who sanctified the name of Heaven in private merited that one letter from the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, was added to his as it is written: “He appointed it in Joseph [ bihosef ] for a testimony in his name,
sentences.llm_translation: And Judah knew and said, "Righteousness is from me." Now, what did Rav Chanina bar Bizna say that Rabbi Shimon Chasida said? Joseph who sanctified the name of Heaven in secret - he has merit and you add to him one letter from the name of the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is written: "Testimony is from Joseph, he has placed."

sentences.text: יְהוּדָה שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא — זָכָה וְנִקְרָא כּוּלּוֹ עַל שְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהוֹדָה וְאָמַר ״צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״, יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: אַתָּה הִצַּלְתָּ תָּמָר וּשְׁנֵי בָּנֶיהָ מִן הָאוּר — חַיֶּיךָ שֶׁאֲנִי מַצִּיל בִּזְכוּתְךָ שְׁלֹשָׁה מִבָּנֶיךָ מִן הָאוּר. מַאן נִינְהוּ — חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה.
sentences.human_translation: Judah, who sanctified the name of Heaven in public, merited that his entire is called by the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, When he confessed and said: “She is more righteous than I,” a Divine Voice went forth and said: You saved Tamar and her two children from the fire. your life, in your merit, I will save three of your children from the fire. who are they? Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah
sentences.llm_translation: Yehudah, who sanctified the name of Heaven in a parshya, is worthy and called upon to recite the entire blessing on the Name of the Holy One, blessed be He. When Yehudah said, "Vindicate me from mine enemy," a voice went forth and said: You have saved Tamar and her two sons from the fiery furnace - your life that I am saving in your merit, three of your children from the fiery furnace. Who is it that has been saved? Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah.

sentences.text: ״צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. מְנָא יָדַע? יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: מִמֶּנִּי יָצְאוּ כְּבוּשִׁים.
sentences.human_translation: “She is more righteous than I [ mimmenni ].” From where did he know A Divine Voice went forth and said: From Me these hidden emerged,
sentences.llm_translation: "Righteousness is from me." What did he know? A daughter of the voice went out and said: "From me shall go forth the bound ones." (

sentences.text: ״וְלֹא יָסַף עוֹד לְדַעְתָּה״. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל סָבָא חֲמוּהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי: כֵּיוָן שֶׁיְּדָעָהּ — שׁוּב לֹא פָּסַק מִמֶּנָּה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְלֹא יָסַף עוֹד לְדַעְתָּה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״קוֹל גָּדוֹל וְלֹא יָסָף״.
sentences.human_translation: “And he knew her [ leda’atah ] again no more [ velo yasaf ],” Shmuel the Elder, father-in-law of Rav Shmuel bar Ami, says in the name of Rav Shmuel bar Ami: once he knew her he did not desist from her again, it is written here: “ Velo yasaf od leda’atah ,” and it is written there with a great voice and it went on no more [ velo yasaf ]”
sentences.llm_translation: And he did not cease to know. Said Shmuel Saba, a student of Rav Shmuel bar Ami, in the name of his teacher Rav Shmuel bar Ami: When he knew it - he did not desist from it. As it is written here: "And he did not cease to know", and as it is written there: "A great voice and he did not cease". (

sentences.text: אַבְשָׁלוֹם נִתְגָּאָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַבְשָׁלוֹם בִּשְׂעָרוֹ מָרַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּכְאַבְשָׁלוֹם לֹא הָיָה אִישׁ יָפֶה וְגוֹ׳. וּבְגַלְּחוֹ אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ וְהָיָה מִקֵּץ יָמִים לַיָּמִים אֲשֶׁר יְגַלֵּחַ כִּי כָבֵד עָלָיו וְגִלְּחוֹ וְשָׁקַל אֶת שְׂעַר רֹאשׁוֹ מָאתַיִם שְׁקָלִים בְּאֶבֶן הַמֶּלֶךְ״. תָּנָא: אֶבֶן שֶׁאַנְשֵׁי טְבֶרְיָא וְאַנְשֵׁי צִיפּוֹרִי שׁוֹקְלִים בָּהּ.
sentences.human_translation: Absalom was proud of his hair, The Sages taught Absalom rebelled due to his hair, as it is stated: there was none as Absalom for his beauty; And when he shaved his head, as it was at every year’s end that he shaved it; because the hair was heavy on him, therefore he shaved it, and he weighed the hair of his head at two hundred shekels, by the king’s stone” taught: A stone with which the people of Tiberias and the people of Tzippori weigh
sentences.llm_translation: Abishalom was exalted in his esteem and so on. The rabbis taught: Abishalom was exalted in his esteem, for it is said: "And there was no man so renowned as Abishalom." And when he shaved his head and became bald, it would be after many days that he would shave again, because it weighed heavily upon him and he would shave and weigh the weight of his head at two hundred shekels in the king's stone. The Tanna taught: This is the stone which men of Teverya and men of Zippori weigh.

sentences.text: לְפִיכָךְ נִתְלָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקְרָא אַבְשָׁלוֹם לִפְנֵי עַבְדֵי דָוִד וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם רֹכֵב עַל הַפֶּרֶד וַיָּבֹא הַפֶּרֶד תַּחַת שׂוֹבֶךְ הָאֵלָה הַגְּדוֹלָה וַיֶּחֱזַק רֹאשׁוֹ בָאֵלָה וַיֻּתַּן בֵּין הַשָּׁמַיִם וּבֵין הָאָרֶץ וְהַפֶּרֶד אֲשֶׁר תַּחְתָּיו עָבָר״. שְׁקַל סַפְסִירָא בְּעָא לְמִיפְסְקֵיהּ. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִבְקַע שְׁאוֹל מִתַּחְתָּיו.
sentences.human_translation: therefore, he was hung by his hair, as it is stated “And Absalom chanced to meet the servants of David. And Absalom was riding upon his mule, and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great terebinth, and his head caught hold of the terebinth, and he was taken up between the heaven and the earth; and the mule that was under him went on” took a sword [ safseira ] and wanted to cut his hair The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: At that moment, the netherworld opened beneath him
sentences.llm_translation: Therefore, it was suspended in his hair, as it is said: "And Absalom rode on the mule and came to the pool of Gibeon. And he took hold of the pillars and leaned upon them, and all the people that were with him did likewise. And Absalom spoke unto Joab, and sent for him, yet he looked not down upon him; but he saw him, and cursed him in his heart" (2 Samuel 16:14-15). Consider the words of Rav Yishmael: At that very hour, Sheol was rent asunder from beneath.

sentences.text: ״וַיִּרְגַּז הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיַּעַל עַל עֲלִיַּית הַשַּׁעַר וַיֵּבְךְּ וְכֹה אָמַר בְּלֶכְתּוֹ בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם מִי יִתֵּן מוּתִי אֲנִי תַחְתֶּיךָ אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי. וְהַמֶּלֶךְ לָאַט אֶת פָּנָיו וַיִּזְעַק הַמֶּלֶךְ קוֹל גָּדוֹל בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי״. הָנֵי תְּמָנְיָא ״בְּנִי״ לְמָה? שִׁבְעָה דְּאַסְּקֵיהּ מִשִּׁבְעָה מְדוֹרֵי גֵיהִנָּם, וְאִידַּךְ, אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּקָרֵיב רֵישֵׁיהּ לְגַבֵּי גוּפֵיהּ, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּאַיְיתֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי.
sentences.human_translation: “And the king was much moved, and went up to the chamber over the gate, and wept; and as he went about he said: O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! Would I had died in your place, O Absalom, my son, my son” “And the king covered his face, and the king cried with a loud voice: O my son Absalom, O Absalom, my son, my son” Why these eight “my son” Seven which he raised him up from the seven chambers of Gehenna. And the other, some say that brought head close to body, and some say that brought to the World-to-Come.
sentences.llm_translation: וַיִּרְגַּז הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיַּעַל עַל עֲלִיַּית הַשַּׁעַר וַיֵּבְךְּ וְכֹה אָמַר בְּלֶכְתּוֹ בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם מִי יִתֵּן מוּתִי אֲנִי תַחְתֶּיךָ אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי. וְהַמֶּלֶךְ לָאַט אֶת פָּנָיו וַיִּזְעַק הַמֶּלֶךְ קוֹל גָּדוֹל בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי. הָנֵי תְּמָנְיָא "בְּנִי" לְמָה? שִׁבְעָה דְּאַסְּקֵיהּ מִשִּׁבְעָה מְדוֹרֵי גֵיהִנָּם, וְאִידַּךְ, אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּקָרֵיב רֵישֵׁיהּ לְגַבֵּי גוּפֵיהּ, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּאַיְיתֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי. English translation: And the king was enraged and ascended to the upper gate and wept, and he said when he came in: "My son Absalom! My son Absalom! Who will give me to die? I am beneath your feet, my son Absalom! My son Absalom! And the king covered his face and a great cry was heard from the king: "My son Absalom! My son Absalom!" And these are the words of the prophet: "Why?" Because seven times he asked for it from seven heavens, and I said: "It is fitting that his head be upon his body," and I said: "He will give him to the world of the end."

text: וְשׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם, וּכְנוּסָה. אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא נִטְמֵאתִי, וְאִם נִטְמֵאתִי — יָבוֹאוּ בִּי.
רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא נִטְמֵאתִי, אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא אֶטָּמֵא.
הַכֹּל שָׁוִין שֶׁאֵין מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ, לֹא עַל קוֹדֶם שֶׁתִּתְאָרֵס וְלֹא עַל אַחַר שֶׁתִּתְגָּרֵשׁ.
נִסְתְּרָה לְאֶחָד וְנִטְמֵאת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ הֶחְזִירָה — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ.
זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל שֶׁתִּבָּעֵל וְלֹא הָיְתָה אֲסוּרָה לוֹ — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ.
גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁזִּינְּתָה — אֲסוּרָה לִיבָמָהּ. מִמַּאי — מִדְּקָתָנֵי שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם וּכְנוּסָה.

אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא אֲסִירָה — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי מַתְנֵה בַּהֲדַהּ, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לָא אֲסִירָה — הֵיכִי מַתְנֵה בַּהֲדַהּ? וְהָתְנַן, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁאִילּוּ תִּיבָּעֵל וְלֹא תְּהֵא אֲסוּרָה לוֹ — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ!
אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא: לֵית הִילְכְתָא כְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא.
אֶלָּא הָא דְּקָתָנֵי ״שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם וּכְנוּסָה״ — הָא מַנִּי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין קִידּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין, וּמְשַׁוֵּי לַהּ כִּי עֶרְוָה.
בָּעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: מַהוּ שֶׁיַּתְנֶה אָדָם עַל נִישּׂוּאִין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, עַל נִישּׂוּאֵי אָחִיו, מַהוּ?
תָּא שְׁמַע, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁתִּיבָּעֵל וְלֹא תְּהֵא אֲסוּרָה לוֹ — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ. הָא אֲסִירָה — הָכִי נָמֵי דְּמַתְנֶה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.

רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא נִטְמֵאתִי וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא: לֹא כְּשֶׁאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא אֶטָּמֵא שֶׁאִם תִּטָּמֵא מַיִם בּוֹדְקִין אוֹתָהּ מֵעַכְשָׁיו, אֶלָּא: לִכְשֶׁתִּטָּמֵא — מַיִם מְעַרְעֲרִין אוֹתָהּ וּבוֹדְקִין אוֹתָהּ.
בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: מַהוּ שֶׁיַּתְנֶה אָדָם עַל נִישּׂוּאִין הָאַחֲרוֹנִים? הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא לָא אֲסִירָה לֵיהּ, אוֹ דִילְמָא זִימְנִין דִּמְגָרֵשׁ לַהּ וַהֲדַר מַהְדַּר לַהּ?

תָּא שְׁמַע: הַכֹּל שָׁוִין שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ לֹא עַל קוֹדֶם שֶׁתִּתְאָרֵס, וְלֹא עַל אַחַר שֶׁתִּתְגָּרֵשׁ. נִסְתְּרָה לְאֶחָד וְנִטְמֵאת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ יַחְזִירֶנָּה — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה. הָא יַחְזִירֶנָּה וְתִיטָּמֵא, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּמַתְנֵי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הַקְּנָאֹת״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה.

רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״זֹאת״, שֶׁאֵין הָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה וְהֵעִיד לְפָנֵינוּ נְחוּנְיָא חוֹפֵר שִׁיחִין שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה, וְקִיבַּלְנוּ עֵדוּתוֹ בִּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים, אֲבָל לֹא בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד.
וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין הָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה, בֵּין בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד בֵּין בִּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים.
וְתַנָּא קַמָּא נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב ״זֹאת״! וְרַבָּנַן בָּתְרָאֵי נָמֵי, הָא כְתִיב ״תּוֹרַת״!
אָמַר רָבָא: בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד וּבוֹעֵל אֶחָד — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּאֵין הָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה,

text: אוֹמֵר בֶּן עַזַּאי: חַיָּיב אָדָם לְלַמֵּד אֶת וְכוּ׳. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַמְלַמֵּד אֶת בִּתּוֹ תּוֹרָה — מְלַמְּדָהּ תִּיפְלוּת. תִּיפְלוּת סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כְּאִילּוּ לִמְּדָהּ תִּיפְלוּת.
אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֲנִי חׇכְמָה שָׁכַנְתִּי עׇרְמָה״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּכְנְסָה חׇכְמָה בְּאָדָם — נִכְנְסָה עִמּוֹ עַרְמוּמִית.

וְרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״אֲנִי חׇכְמָה״ מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אֵין דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה מִתְקַיְּימִין אֶלָּא בְּמִי שֶׁמַּעֲמִיד עַצְמוֹ עָרוֹם עֲלֵיהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֲנִי חׇכְמָה שָׁכַנְתִּי עׇרְמָה״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה מִתְקַיְּימִין אֶלָּא בְּמִי שֶׁמֵּשִׂים עַצְמוֹ כְּמִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהַחׇכְמָה מֵאַיִן תִּמָּצֵא״.
רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: רוֹצָה אִשָּׁה וְכוּ׳. מַאי קָאָמַר? הָכִי קָאָמַר: רוֹצָה אִשָּׁה בְּקַב וְתִיפְלוּת עִמּוֹ, מִתִּשְׁעַת קַבִּין וּפְרִישׁוּת.
הוּא הָיָה אוֹמֵר: חָסִיד שׁוֹטֶה כּוּ׳. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי חָסִיד שׁוֹטֶה? כְּגוֹן דְּקָא טָבְעָה אִיתְּתָא בְּנַהֲרָא, וְאָמַר: לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְאִיסְתַּכּוֹלֵי בַּהּ וְאַצּוֹלַהּ.

הֵיכִי דָּמֵי רָשָׁע עָרוּם? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זֶה הַמַּטְעִים דְּבָרָיו לַדַּיָּין קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּבֹא בַּעַל דִּין חֲבֵרוֹ. רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אוֹמֵר: זֶה הַנּוֹתֵן דִּינָר לְעָנִי לְהַשְׁלִים לוֹ מָאתַיִם זוּז. דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מָאתַיִם זוּז — לֹא יִטּוֹל לֶקֶט שִׁכְחָה וּפֵאָה וּמַעְשַׂר עָנִי. הָיָה לוֹ מָאתַיִם חָסֵר דִּינָר, אֲפִילּוּ אֶלֶף נוֹתְנִין לוֹ כְּאַחַת — הֲרֵי זֶה יִטּוֹל.

רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זֶה הַמַּשִּׂיא עֵצָה לִמְכּוֹר בִּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִין. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: יְתוֹמִים שֶׁקָּדְמוּ וּמָכְרוּ בִּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִין — מַה שֶּׁמָּכְרוּ מָכְרוּ.

אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: זֶה הַמַּשִּׂיא עֵצָה לִמְכּוֹר בִּנְכָסִים כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. דְּתַנְיָא: ״נְכָסַי לְךָ, וְאַחֲרֶיךָ לִפְלוֹנִי״, וְיָרַד הָרִאשׁוֹן וּמָכַר וְאָכַל — הַשֵּׁנִי מוֹצִיא מִיַּד הַלָּקוֹחוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵין לַשֵּׁנִי אֶלָּא מַה שֶּׁשִּׁיֵּיר רִאשׁוֹן.
רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר חָמָא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: זֶה הַמַּכְרִיעַ אֲחֵרִים בְּאוֹרְחוֹתָיו. רַבִּי זְרִיקָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: זֶה הַמֵּיקֵל לְעַצְמוֹ וּמַחְמִיר לַאֲחֵרִים. עוּלָּא אָמַר: זֶה
שֶׁקָּרָא וְשָׁנָה וְלֹא שִׁימֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים.

אִתְּמַר: קָרָא וְשָׁנָה וְלֹא שִׁימֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה עַם הָאָרֶץ. רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: הֲרֵי זֶה בּוּר. רַבִּי יַנַּאי אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה כּוּתִי.

רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה מָגוֹשׁ. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּרַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב, דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רָטֵין מָגוֹשָׁא וְלָא יָדַע מַאי אָמַר, תָּנֵי תַּנָּא וְלָא יָדַע מַאי אָמַר.

תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ עַם הָאָרֶץ? כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע שַׁחֲרִית וְעַרְבִית בְּבִרְכוֹתֶיהָ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַנִּיחַ תְּפִילִּין. בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ צִיצִית בְּבִגְדוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן יוֹסֵף אָמַר: כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים וְאֵינוֹ מְגַדְּלָן לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה. אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: אֲפִילּוּ קוֹרֵא וְשׁוֹנֶה וְלֹא שִׁימֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים — זֶהוּ עַם הָאָרֶץ.
קָרָא וְלֹא שָׁנָה — הֲרֵי זֶה בּוּר, לֹא קָרָא וְלֹא שָׁנָה — עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וְזָרַעְתִּי אֶת בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֶת בֵּית יְהוּדָה זֶרַע אָדָם וְזֶרַע בְּהֵמָה״.

״יְרָא אֶת ה׳ בְּנִי וָמֶלֶךְ עִם שׁוֹנִים אַל תִּתְעָרָב״, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אֵלּוּ שֶׁשּׁוֹנִים הֲלָכוֹת. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא — שׁוֹנִין בְּחֵטְא, וְכִדְרַב הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָבַר אָדָם עֲבֵירָה וְשָׁנָה בָּהּ — הוּתְּרָה לוֹ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.

תָּנָא: הַתַּנָּאִים — מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם. מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אָמַר רָבִינָא: שֶׁמּוֹרִין הֲלָכָה מִתּוֹךְ מִשְׁנָתָן. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: וְכִי מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם הֵן? וַהֲלֹא מְיַישְּׁבֵי עוֹלָם הֵן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲלִיכוֹת עוֹלָם לוֹ״! אֶלָּא, שֶׁמּוֹרִין הֲלָכָה מִתּוֹךְ מִשְׁנָתָן.
אִשָּׁה פְּרוּשָׁה וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּתוּלָה צַלְיָינִית, וְאַלְמָנָה שׁוֹבָבִית, וְקָטָן שֶׁלֹּא כָּלוּ לוֹ חֳדָשָׁיו — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם.

אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָמַדְנוּ יִרְאַת חֵטְא מִבְּתוּלָה, וְקִיבּוּל שָׂכָר מֵאַלְמָנָה. יִרְאַת חֵטְא מִבְּתוּלָה — דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שַׁמְעַהּ לְהַהִיא בְּתוּלָה דְּנָפְלָה אַאַפַּהּ וְקָאָמְרָה: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, בָּרָאתָ גַּן עֵדֶן וּבָרָאתָ גֵּיהִנָּם, בָּרָאתָ צַדִּיקִים וּבָרָאתָ רְשָׁעִים. יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ שֶׁלֹּא יִכָּשְׁלוּ בִּי בְּנֵי אָדָם.

קִיבּוּל שָׂכָר מֵאַלְמָנָה — דְּהָהִיא אַלְמָנָה דַּהֲוַאי בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא בְּשִׁיבָבוּתַהּ. כׇּל יוֹמָא הֲוָת אָתְיָא וּמְצַלָּה בֵּי מִדְרְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. אֲמַר לַהּ: בִּתִּי, לֹא בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת בְּשִׁיבָבוּתִיךְ? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: רַבִּי, וְלֹא שְׂכַר פְּסִיעוֹת יֵשׁ לִי?
כִּי קָאָמַר, כְּגוֹן יוֹחָנִי בַּת רְטִיבִי.
מַאי ״קָטָן שֶׁלֹּא כָּלוּ לוֹ חֳדָשָׁיו״? הָכָא תַּרְגִּימוּ: זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הַמְבַעֵט בְּרַבּוֹתָיו.

רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר: זֶה תַּלְמִיד שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה וּמוֹרֶה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים הִפִּילָה וַעֲצוּמִים כׇּל הֲרוּגֶיהָ״. ״כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים הִפִּילָה״ — זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה וּמוֹרֶה. ״וַעֲצוּמִים כׇּל הֲרוּגֶיהָ״ — זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה וְאֵינוֹ מוֹרֶה.

הוּא הָיָה אוֹמֵר: חָסִיד שׁוֹטֶה כּוּ׳. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי חָסִיד שׁוֹטֶה? כְּגוֹן דְּקָא טָבְעָה אִיתְּתָא בְּנַהֲרָא, וְאָמַר: לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְאִיסְתַּכּוֹלֵי בַּהּ וְאַצּוֹלַהּ.

הֵיכִי דָּמֵי רָשָׁע עָרוּם? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זֶה הַמַּטְעִים דְּבָרָיו לַדַּיָּין קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּבֹא בַּעַל דִּין חֲבֵרוֹ. רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אוֹמֵר: זֶה הַנּוֹתֵן דִּינָר לְעָנִי לְהַשְׁלִים לוֹ מָאתַיִם זוּז. דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מָאתַיִם זוּז — לֹא יִטּוֹל לֶקֶט שִׁכְחָה וּפֵאָה וּמַעְשַׂר עָנִי. הָיָה לוֹ מָאתַיִם חָסֵר דִּינָר, אֲפִילּוּ אֶלֶף נוֹתְנִין לוֹ כְּאַחַת — הֲרֵי זֶה יִטּוֹל.

רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זֶה הַמַּשִּׂיא עֵצָה לִמְכּוֹר בִּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִין. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: יְתוֹמִים שֶׁקָּדְמוּ וּמָכְרוּ בִּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִין — מַה שֶּׁמָּכְרוּ מָכְרוּ.

אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: זֶה הַמַּשִּׂיא עֵצָה לִמְכּוֹר בִּנְכָסִים כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. דְּתַנְיָא: ״נְכָסַי לְךָ, וְאַחֲרֶיךָ לִפְלוֹנִי״, וְיָרַד הָרִאשׁוֹן וּמָכַר וְאָכַל — הַשֵּׁנִי מוֹצִיא מִיַּד הַלָּקוֹחוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵין לַשֵּׁנִי אֶלָּא מַה שֶּׁשִּׁיֵּיר רִאשׁוֹן.
רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר חָמָא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: זֶה הַמַּכְרִיעַ אֲחֵרִים בְּאוֹרְחוֹתָיו. רַבִּי זְרִיקָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: זֶה הַמֵּיקֵל לְעַצְמוֹ וּמַחְמִיר לַאֲחֵרִים. עוּלָּא אָמַר: זֶה
שֶׁקָּרָא וְשָׁנָה וְלֹא שִׁימֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים.

אִתְּמַר: קָרָא וְשָׁנָה וְלֹא שִׁימֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה עַם הָאָרֶץ. רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: הֲרֵי זֶה בּוּר. רַבִּי יַנַּאי אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה כּוּתִי.

רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה מָגוֹשׁ. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּרַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב, דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רָטֵין מָגוֹשָׁא וְלָא יָדַע מַאי אָמַר, תָּנֵי תַּנָּא וְלָא יָדַע מַאי אָמַר.

תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ עַם הָאָרֶץ? כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע שַׁחֲרִית וְעַרְבִית בְּבִרְכוֹתֶיהָ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַנִּיחַ תְּפִילִּין. בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ צִיצִית בְּבִגְדוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן יוֹסֵף אָמַר: כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים וְאֵינוֹ מְגַדְּלָן לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה. אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: אֲפִילּוּ קוֹרֵא וְשׁוֹנֶה וְלֹא שִׁימֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים — זֶהוּ עַם הָאָרֶץ.
קָרָא וְלֹא שָׁנָה — הֲרֵי זֶה בּוּר, לֹא קָרָא וְלֹא שָׁנָה — עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וְזָרַעְתִּי אֶת בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֶת בֵּית יְהוּדָה זֶרַע אָדָם וְזֶרַע בְּהֵמָה״.

״יְרָא אֶת ה׳ בְּנִי וָמֶלֶךְ עִם שׁוֹנִים אַל תִּתְעָרָב״, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אֵלּוּ שֶׁשּׁוֹנִים הֲלָכוֹת. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא — שׁוֹנִין בְּחֵטְא, וְכִדְרַב הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָבַר אָדָם עֲבֵירָה וְשָׁנָה בָּהּ — הוּתְּרָה לוֹ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.

תָּנָא: הַתַּנָּאִים — מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם. מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אָמַר רָבִינָא: שֶׁמּוֹרִין הֲלָכָה מִתּוֹךְ מִשְׁנָתָן. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: וְכִי מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם הֵן? וַהֲלֹא מְיַישְּׁבֵי עוֹלָם הֵן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲלִיכוֹת עוֹלָם לוֹ״! אֶלָּא, שֶׁמּוֹרִין הֲלָכָה מִתּוֹךְ מִשְׁנָתָן.
אִשָּׁה פְּרוּשָׁה וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּתוּלָה צַלְיָינִית, וְאַלְמָנָה שׁוֹבָבִית, וְקָטָן שֶׁלֹּא כָּלוּ לוֹ חֳדָשָׁיו — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם.

אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָמַדְנוּ יִרְאַת חֵטְא מִבְּתוּלָה, וְקִיבּוּל שָׂכָר מֵאַלְמָנָה. יִרְאַת חֵטְא מִבְּתוּלָה — דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שַׁמְעַהּ לְהַהִיא בְּתוּלָה דְּנָפְלָה אַאַפַּהּ וְקָאָמְרָה: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, בָּרָאתָ גַּן עֵדֶן וּבָרָאתָ גֵּיהִנָּם, בָּרָאתָ צַדִּיקִים וּבָרָאתָ רְשָׁעִים. יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ שֶׁלֹּא יִכָּשְׁלוּ בִּי בְּנֵי אָדָם.

קִיבּוּל שָׂכָר מֵאַלְמָנָה — דְּהָהִיא אַלְמָנָה דַּהֲוַאי בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא בְּשִׁיבָבוּתַהּ. כׇּל יוֹמָא הֲוָת אָתְיָא וּמְצַלָּה בֵּי מִדְרְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. אֲמַר לַהּ: בִּתִּי, לֹא בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת בְּשִׁיבָבוּתִיךְ? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: רַבִּי, וְלֹא שְׂכַר פְּסִיעוֹת יֵשׁ לִי?
כִּי קָאָמַר, כְּגוֹן יוֹחָנִי בַּת רְטִיבִי.
מַאי ״קָטָן שֶׁלֹּא כָּלוּ לוֹ חֳדָשָׁיו״? הָכָא תַּרְגִּימוּ: זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הַמְבַעֵט בְּרַבּוֹתָיו.

רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר: זֶה תַּלְמִיד שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה וּמוֹרֶה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים הִפִּילָה וַעֲצוּמִים כׇּל הֲרוּגֶיהָ״. ״כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים הִפִּילָה״ — זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה וּמוֹרֶה. ״וַעֲצוּמִים כׇּל הֲרוּגֶיהָ״ — זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה וְאֵינוֹ מוֹרֶה.
llm_translation: Ben Azai says: A person is obligated to teach his daughter Torah. Rabbi Eliezer says: Whoever teaches his daughter Torah - teaches her foolishness. Teaches her foolishness? Rather, it should be said: As if he were teaching her foolishness.
Rabbi Abahu said: What is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer, as it is written: "I have made wisdom my desire" Wisdom 7:27, when wisdom enters a person - wickedness enters with him.

And our Rabbis, what does "I am wisdom" mean? What did I do for it? It was because I did it for Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina. And Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina said: The words of Torah are not established except by one who makes his own soul a vessel for them, as it is written: "I am wisdom that I may know her." Rabbi Yohanan said: The words of Torah are not established except by one who makes his own soul like one who has nothing, as it is written: "And wisdom will be found in the absence."
Rabbi Yehoshua says: A woman desires and so-and-so. What was he saying? He was saying: A woman desires in a kiss and intimacy with him, from the time of the first kiss and separation. (

He used to say: A pious person is like a well. How do we know that a pious person is like a well? As it is written, "And I will make rivers flow on the dry ground" (Isaiah 41:18). And he would say: There is no path in the world for those who are not seeking to be filled and satisfied.

How great is the wicked man's wisdom? Said Rabbi Yohanan: This is the one who prepares his words before he comes to render judgment on behalf of his fellow. Rabbi Avahu says: This is the one who gives a dinar to someone to settle his account with him for two hundred zuz. Let us examine: Whoever has two hundred zuz - he shall not exact interest, and payment, and commission from the poor man. If he had two hundred dinars lacking, even if they give him a thousand, it is as one - behold, this one will exact.
Rabbi Asi said, Rabbi Yohanan: This is the counsel to sell minor properties. Said Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yohanan: Orphans who preceded and sold minor properties - what they sold, they sold. (

Abaye said: This is the counsel to sell inalienable property, as Rabbi Shimon ben Gamaliel. A teaching: "My possessions are yours, and after you, for Phineas," and the first one went down and sold and ate — the second one takes out from the hands of the buyers, words of my teacher. Rabbi Shimon ben Gamaliel says: There is nothing to the second one except what the first one has.

Rav Yosef bar Ḥama said in the name of Rav Sheshet: This one is the one who subjugates others to his ways. Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav Huna: This one is the one who frees himself and binds others. Ulla said:
Še-qara ve-shanah ve-lo shim-mesh talmidei ḥakamim. Translation: He read and year and did not find the students of the wise.

It was stated: He read and a year passed, and the students of wise men did not occupy themselves. Rabbi El'eazar says: Behold, this is the people of the land. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani says: Behold, this is a vineyard. Rabbi Yannai says: Behold, this is a cutting. (

Rav Acha bar Yaakov says: Behold, this is a dispute. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: It is established according to Rav Acha bar Yaakov, that they say: They are disputing and do not know what he said, just as the Tana taught and did not know what he said.

Our Rabbis taught: What is the people of the earth? Any one who does not recite Shema twice daily, morning and evening, in its blessings - this is the saying of Rabbi Meir. And wise men say: Any one who does not put on tefillin. Ben Azai says: Any one who has no tzitzit on his garment. Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef said: Any one who has sons but does not teach them Torah. Others say: Even if he recites and studies and does not engage in the study of wise men - this is the people of the earth.
Kara ve-lo shanah — Harei zeh bor, lo kara ve-lo shanah — Alav ha-katuv omer: "Ve-zera'ti et beit Yisrael ve-et beit Yehudah zer'a adam ve-zer'a behemah".

"He should fear the Lord my son and king with those who are familiar with laws. He said Rabbi Yitzchak: These are those who are familiar with laws. Indeed! What is the matter? Those who are familiar with laws sin, and so they will be punished. For it was said by Rav Huna: When a person transgresses and sins in it - forgiveness is given to him, as we learned."

Tanna: The tannaim - eternal beings. Eternal beings, what is your wisdom?! Said Rabbiina: They establish halakha from within mishnah. Tanya na'ami, said Rabbi Yehoshua: And if eternal beings are? And do not those who dwell in eternity dwell, as it is said: "The paths of eternity are His"? But they establish halakha from within mishnah.
A woman is free and unbound. The Rabbis taught: A virgin, a widow, and one who has not completed her marriage - these are the ones who have no portion in the world to come.

I know? And Rabbi Yohanan said: We learned that the fear of sin from a virgin, and the reward of wine from an almond. The fear of sin from a virgin - Rabbi Yohanan heard it in his youth when he fell asleep and woke up saying: Our Master of the Universe, You created Eden's garden and You created Gehinnom, You created righteous ones and You created wicked ones. May Your will be done before You regarding those who are not to stumble over me through human beings.

The bundle of drink-offerings from an orphan — that orphan who was in a state of mourning. Every day, he would come and settle accounts with him, Rabbi Yohanan. He said to her: My daughter, do you not have a house of assembly in your mourning? She replied to him: Rabbi, and I do not have any drink-offerings for the poor?
Since it was said, "As is the custom of Yohanan in the town of Rativai."
What is "Katan she-lo kulo lo chodashav"? Here you will find the answer: This is a wise student who busies himself with his predecessors.

Rabbi Abba said: This is a student who has not reached wisdom and teaching. Rabbi Avahu said, Rabbi Huna said, Rabbi: What does it say? "For many are wounded and maimed, and the number of the slain falls short." "For many are wounded" - this is a wise student who has not reached wisdom and teaching. "And the number of the slain falls short" - this is a wise student who has reached wisdom and is not a teacher. (

sentences.text: אוֹמֵר בֶּן עַזַּאי: חַיָּיב אָדָם לְלַמֵּד אֶת וְכוּ׳. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַמְלַמֵּד אֶת בִּתּוֹ תּוֹרָה — מְלַמְּדָהּ תִּיפְלוּת. תִּיפְלוּת סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כְּאִילּוּ לִמְּדָהּ תִּיפְלוּת.

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֲנִי חׇכְמָה שָׁכַנְתִּי עׇרְמָה״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּכְנְסָה חׇכְמָה בְּאָדָם — נִכְנְסָה עִמּוֹ עַרְמוּמִית.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: What is the reason for Rabbi Eliezer’s as it is written: “I, wisdom, dwell with cunning” once wisdom enters into a person, cunning enters with it.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Abahu said: What is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer, as it is written: "I have made wisdom my desire" Wisdom 7:27, when wisdom enters a person - wickedness enters with him.

sentences.text: וְרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״אֲנִי חׇכְמָה״ מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אֵין דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה מִתְקַיְּימִין אֶלָּא בְּמִי שֶׁמַּעֲמִיד עַצְמוֹ עָרוֹם עֲלֵיהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֲנִי חׇכְמָה שָׁכַנְתִּי עׇרְמָה״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה מִתְקַיְּימִין אֶלָּא בְּמִי שֶׁמֵּשִׂים עַצְמוֹ כְּמִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהַחׇכְמָה מֵאַיִן תִּמָּצֵא״.
sentences.human_translation: And the Rabbis what do they do with this “I, wisdom, He requires that for that which Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, as Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: The matters of Torah do not endure except in one who stands naked for them, as it is stated: “I, wisdom, dwell with nakedness [ orma ]” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The matters of Torah do not endure except in one who considers himself as one who does not as it is stated: “But wisdom, it can be found in nothingness”
sentences.llm_translation: And our Rabbis, what does "I am wisdom" mean? What did I do for it? It was because I did it for Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina. And Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina said: The words of Torah are not established except by one who makes his own soul a vessel for them, as it is written: "I am wisdom that I may know her." Rabbi Yohanan said: The words of Torah are not established except by one who makes his own soul like one who has nothing, as it is written: "And wisdom will be found in the absence."

sentences.text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: רוֹצָה אִשָּׁה וְכוּ׳. מַאי קָאָמַר? הָכִי קָאָמַר: רוֹצָה אִשָּׁה בְּקַב וְתִיפְלוּת עִמּוֹ, מִתִּשְׁעַת קַבִּין וּפְרִישׁוּת.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: A woman desires What is he saying? This is what is saying: A woman desires to a kav and with it a sexual relationship, than nine kav and abstinence,
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: A woman desires and so-and-so. What was he saying? He was saying: A woman desires in a kiss and intimacy with him, from the time of the first kiss and separation. (

sentences.text: הוּא הָיָה אוֹמֵר: חָסִיד שׁוֹטֶה כּוּ׳. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי חָסִיד שׁוֹטֶה? כְּגוֹן דְּקָא טָבְעָה אִיתְּתָא בְּנַהֲרָא, וְאָמַר: לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְאִיסְתַּכּוֹלֵי בַּהּ וְאַצּוֹלַהּ.
sentences.human_translation: He, would say: A foolish man of piety, Who is considered a foolish man of piety? For example, that a woman is drowning in a river, and he says: not proper conduct to look at her and save her.
sentences.llm_translation: He used to say: A pious person is like a well. How do we know that a pious person is like a well? As it is written, "And I will make rivers flow on the dry ground" (Isaiah 41:18). And he would say: There is no path in the world for those who are not seeking to be filled and satisfied.

sentences.text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי רָשָׁע עָרוּם? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זֶה הַמַּטְעִים דְּבָרָיו לַדַּיָּין קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּבֹא בַּעַל דִּין חֲבֵרוֹ. רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אוֹמֵר: זֶה הַנּוֹתֵן דִּינָר לְעָנִי לְהַשְׁלִים לוֹ מָאתַיִם זוּז. דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מָאתַיִם זוּז — לֹא יִטּוֹל לֶקֶט שִׁכְחָה וּפֵאָה וּמַעְשַׂר עָנִי. הָיָה לוֹ מָאתַיִם חָסֵר דִּינָר, אֲפִילּוּ אֶלֶף נוֹתְנִין לוֹ כְּאַחַת — הֲרֵי זֶה יִטּוֹל.
sentences.human_translation: Who is considered a conniving wicked person? Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This is one who presents his statement to the judge before the other litigant comes Rabbi Abbahu says: This one who gives a dinar to a poor man to complete two hundred dinars for him, as we learned One who has two hundred dinars may not collect gleanings, forgotten pe’a , and poor man’s tithe, he has two hundred less dinar, even he is given one thousand at once, he may collect.
sentences.llm_translation: How great is the wicked man's wisdom? Said Rabbi Yohanan: This is the one who prepares his words before he comes to render judgment on behalf of his fellow. Rabbi Avahu says: This is the one who gives a dinar to someone to settle his account with him for two hundred zuz. Let us examine: Whoever has two hundred zuz - he shall not exact interest, and payment, and commission from the poor man. If he had two hundred dinars lacking, even if they give him a thousand, it is as one - behold, this one will exact.

sentences.text: רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זֶה הַמַּשִּׂיא עֵצָה לִמְכּוֹר בִּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִין. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: יְתוֹמִים שֶׁקָּדְמוּ וּמָכְרוּ בִּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִין — מַה שֶּׁמָּכְרוּ מָכְרוּ.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Asi Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one who provides advice to sell from the small quantity of property as Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: orphans who preemptively sold from a small estate, that which they sold, they sold,
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Asi said, Rabbi Yohanan: This is the counsel to sell minor properties. Said Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yohanan: Orphans who preceded and sold minor properties - what they sold, they sold. (

sentences.text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: זֶה הַמַּשִּׂיא עֵצָה לִמְכּוֹר בִּנְכָסִים כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. דְּתַנְיָא: ״נְכָסַי לְךָ, וְאַחֲרֶיךָ לִפְלוֹנִי״, וְיָרַד הָרִאשׁוֹן וּמָכַר וְאָכַל — הַשֵּׁנִי מוֹצִיא מִיַּד הַלָּקוֹחוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵין לַשֵּׁנִי אֶלָּא מַה שֶּׁשִּׁיֵּיר רִאשׁוֹן.
sentences.human_translation: Abaye says: is one who provides advice to sell property in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, as it is taught My property to you, and after you to so-and-so, and the first entered and sold and consumed the second repossesses from the purchasers, this is the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The second only that which the first left,
sentences.llm_translation: Abaye said: This is the counsel to sell inalienable property, as Rabbi Shimon ben Gamaliel. A teaching: "My possessions are yours, and after you, for Phineas," and the first one went down and sold and ate — the second one takes out from the hands of the buyers, words of my teacher. Rabbi Shimon ben Gamaliel says: There is nothing to the second one except what the first one has.

sentences.text: רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר חָמָא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: זֶה הַמַּכְרִיעַ אֲחֵרִים בְּאוֹרְחוֹתָיו. רַבִּי זְרִיקָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: זֶה הַמֵּיקֵל לְעַצְמוֹ וּמַחְמִיר לַאֲחֵרִים. עוּלָּא אָמַר: זֶה
sentences.human_translation: Rav Yosef bar Ḥama Rav Sheshet says: one who persuades others with his ways, Rabbi Zerika Rav Huna says: one who is lenient for himself and strict for others. Ulla says: This
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Yosef bar Ḥama said in the name of Rav Sheshet: This one is the one who subjugates others to his ways. Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav Huna: This one is the one who frees himself and binds others. Ulla said:

sentences.text: שֶׁקָּרָא וְשָׁנָה וְלֹא שִׁימֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים.
sentences.human_translation: who read and learned but did not serve Torah scholars
sentences.llm_translation: Še-qara ve-shanah ve-lo shim-mesh talmidei ḥakamim. Translation: He read and year and did not find the students of the wise.

sentences.text: אִתְּמַר: קָרָא וְשָׁנָה וְלֹא שִׁימֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה עַם הָאָרֶץ. רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: הֲרֵי זֶה בּוּר. רַבִּי יַנַּאי אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה כּוּתִי.
sentences.human_translation: It was stated: read and learned but did not serve Torah scholars, Rabbi Elazar says: This is an ignoramus. Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said: This is a boor. Rabbi Yannai says: This is a Samaritan,
sentences.llm_translation: It was stated: He read and a year passed, and the students of wise men did not occupy themselves. Rabbi El'eazar says: Behold, this is the people of the land. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani says: Behold, this is a vineyard. Rabbi Yannai says: Behold, this is a cutting. (

sentences.text: רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה מָגוֹשׁ. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּרַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב, דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רָטֵין מָגוֹשָׁא וְלָא יָדַע מַאי אָמַר, תָּנֵי תַּנָּא וְלָא יָדַע מַאי אָמַר.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov says: This is a sorcerer [ magosh ], Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: It is reasonable to Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov, as people say The sorcerer chants and does not know what he is saying; the tanna teaches and does not know what he is saying.
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov says: Behold, this is a dispute. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: It is established according to Rav Acha bar Yaakov, that they say: They are disputing and do not know what he said, just as the Tana taught and did not know what he said.

sentences.text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ עַם הָאָרֶץ? כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע שַׁחֲרִית וְעַרְבִית בְּבִרְכוֹתֶיהָ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַנִּיחַ תְּפִילִּין. בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ צִיצִית בְּבִגְדוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן יוֹסֵף אָמַר: כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים וְאֵינוֹ מְגַדְּלָן לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה. אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: אֲפִילּוּ קוֹרֵא וְשׁוֹנֶה וְלֹא שִׁימֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים — זֶהוּ עַם הָאָרֶץ.
sentences.human_translation: The Sages taught: Who is an ignoramus [ am ha’aretz ]? anyone who does not recite Shema morning and evening with its blessings; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: anyone who does not don phylacteries. Ben Azzai says: anyone who does not have ritual fringes on his garment. Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef said: anyone who has sons and does not raise them to study Torah. Aḥerim say: Even if one reads and learns but does not serve Torah scholars, he is an ignoramus.
sentences.llm_translation: Our Rabbis taught: What is the people of the earth? Any one who does not recite Shema twice daily, morning and evening, in its blessings - this is the saying of Rabbi Meir. And wise men say: Any one who does not put on tefillin. Ben Azai says: Any one who has no tzitzit on his garment. Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef said: Any one who has sons but does not teach them Torah. Others say: Even if he recites and studies and does not engage in the study of wise men - this is the people of the earth.

sentences.text: קָרָא וְלֹא שָׁנָה — הֲרֵי זֶה בּוּר, לֹא קָרָא וְלֹא שָׁנָה — עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וְזָרַעְתִּי אֶת בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֶת בֵּית יְהוּדָה זֶרַע אָדָם וְזֶרַע בְּהֵמָה״.
sentences.human_translation: read but did not learn he is a boor. With regard to did not read and did not learn the verse states: and I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man, and with the seed of beast”
sentences.llm_translation: Kara ve-lo shanah — Harei zeh bor, lo kara ve-lo shanah — Alav ha-katuv omer: "Ve-zera'ti et beit Yisrael ve-et beit Yehudah zer'a adam ve-zer'a behemah".

sentences.text: ״יְרָא אֶת ה׳ בְּנִי וָמֶלֶךְ עִם שׁוֹנִים אַל תִּתְעָרָב״, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אֵלּוּ שֶׁשּׁוֹנִים הֲלָכוֹת. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא — שׁוֹנִין בְּחֵטְא, וְכִדְרַב הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָבַר אָדָם עֲבֵירָה וְשָׁנָה בָּהּ — הוּתְּרָה לוֹ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
sentences.human_translation: “My son, fear the Lord and the king; and meddle not with those who are repeating” Rabbi Yitzḥak says: These are who repeatedly learn halakhot Isn’t obvious? lest you say repeatedly sins, and in accordance with Rav Huna, as Rav Huna says: Once a person committed a transgression and repeated it, it became permitted for him. teaches us
sentences.llm_translation: "He should fear the Lord my son and king with those who are familiar with laws. He said Rabbi Yitzchak: These are those who are familiar with laws. Indeed! What is the matter? Those who are familiar with laws sin, and so they will be punished. For it was said by Rav Huna: When a person transgresses and sins in it - forgiveness is given to him, as we learned."

sentences.text: תָּנָא: הַתַּנָּאִים — מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם. מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אָמַר רָבִינָא: שֶׁמּוֹרִין הֲלָכָה מִתּוֹךְ מִשְׁנָתָן. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: וְכִי מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם הֵן? וַהֲלֹא מְיַישְּׁבֵי עוֹלָם הֵן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲלִיכוֹת עוֹלָם לוֹ״! אֶלָּא, שֶׁמּוֹרִין הֲלָכָה מִתּוֹךְ מִשְׁנָתָן.
sentences.human_translation: It was taught The tanna’im , are who erode the world. Could enter your mind who erode the world? Ravina says: who issue halakhic rulings based their mishnayot . This is also taught Rabbi Yehoshua said: Are they who erode the world? Aren’t they settling the world, as it is stated: “His ways [ halikhot ] are eternal” Rather, who issue halakhic rulings based their mishnayot .
sentences.llm_translation: Tanna: The tannaim - eternal beings. Eternal beings, what is your wisdom?! Said Rabbiina: They establish halakha from within mishnah. Tanya na'ami, said Rabbi Yehoshua: And if eternal beings are? And do not those who dwell in eternity dwell, as it is said: "The paths of eternity are His"? But they establish halakha from within mishnah.

sentences.text: אִשָּׁה פְּרוּשָׁה וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּתוּלָה צַלְיָינִית, וְאַלְמָנָה שׁוֹבָבִית, וְקָטָן שֶׁלֹּא כָּלוּ לוֹ חֳדָשָׁיו — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מְבַלֵּי עוֹלָם.
sentences.human_translation: an abstinent woman The Sages taught: A maiden who prays and a neighborly [ shovavit ] widow and a child whose months were not completed, these are who erode the world.
sentences.llm_translation: A woman is free and unbound. The Rabbis taught: A virgin, a widow, and one who has not completed her marriage - these are the ones who have no portion in the world to come.

sentences.text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָמַדְנוּ יִרְאַת חֵטְא מִבְּתוּלָה, וְקִיבּוּל שָׂכָר מֵאַלְמָנָה. יִרְאַת חֵטְא מִבְּתוּלָה — דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שַׁמְעַהּ לְהַהִיא בְּתוּלָה דְּנָפְלָה אַאַפַּהּ וְקָאָמְרָה: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, בָּרָאתָ גַּן עֵדֶן וּבָרָאתָ גֵּיהִנָּם, בָּרָאתָ צַדִּיקִים וּבָרָאתָ רְשָׁעִים. יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ שֶׁלֹּא יִכָּשְׁלוּ בִּי בְּנֵי אָדָם.

sentences.text: רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר: זֶה תַּלְמִיד שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה וּמוֹרֶה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים הִפִּילָה וַעֲצוּמִים כׇּל הֲרוּגֶיהָ״. ״כִּי רַבִּים חֲלָלִים הִפִּילָה״ — זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה וּמוֹרֶה. ״וַעֲצוּמִים כׇּל הֲרוּגֶיהָ״ — זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְהוֹרָאָה וְאֵינוֹ מוֹרֶה.
