text: אֲגַם, כְּדִכְתִיב: ״קָנֶה וָסוּף קָמֵלוּ״.

״וַתֵּרֶד בַּת פַּרְעֹה לִרְחוֹץ עַל הַיְאֹר״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁיָּרְדָה לִרְחוֹץ מִגִּלּוּלֵי [בֵּית] אָבִיהָ, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אִם רָחַץ ה׳ אֵת צוֹאַת בְּנוֹת צִיּוֹן וְגוֹ׳״.
״וְנַעֲרֹתֶיהָ הוֹלְכוֹת וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין הֲלִיכָה זוֹ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן מִיתָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״הִנֵּה אָנֹכִי הוֹלֵךְ לָמוּת״.

״וַתֵּרֶא אֶת הַתֵּיבָה בְּתוֹךְ הַסּוּף״, כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזוֹ דְּקָא בָעוּ לְאַצּוֹלֵי לְמֹשֶׁה, אָמְרוּ לָהּ: גְּבִירְתֵּנוּ, מִנְהָגוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם מֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וָדָם גּוֹזֵר גְּזֵירָה, אִם כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ אֵין מְקַיְּימִין אוֹתָהּ — בָּנָיו וּבְנֵי בֵיתוֹ מְקַיְּימִין אוֹתָהּ, וְאַתְּ עוֹבֶרֶת עַל גְּזֵירַת אָבִיךְ? בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וַחֲבָטָן בַּקַּרְקַע.

״וַתִּשְׁלַח אֶת אֲמָתָהּ וַתִּקָּחֶהָ״. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, חַד אָמַר: יָדָהּ, וְחַד אָמַר: שִׁפְחָתָהּ. מַאן דְּאָמַר יָדָהּ — דִּכְתִיב ״אַמָּתָהּ״. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר שִׁפְחָתָהּ — מִדְּלָא כְּתִיב ״יָדָהּ״.
וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר שִׁפְחָתָהּ, הָא אָמְרַתְּ בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וַחֲבָטָן בַּקַּרְקַע! דְּשַׁיַּיר לַהּ חֲדָא, דְּלָאו אוֹרְחַהּ דְּבַת מַלְכָּא לְמֵיקַם לְחוֹדַהּ.

וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר יָדָהּ, לִיכְתּוֹב ״יָדָהּ״! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאִישְׁתַּרְבַּב אִישְׁתַּרְבּוֹבֵי. דְּאָמַר מָר: וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בְּאַמָּתָהּ שֶׁל בַּת פַּרְעֹה, וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בְּשִׁינֵּי רְשָׁעִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״שִׁנֵּי רְשָׁעִים שִׁבַּרְתָּ״, וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״שִׁבַּרְתָּ״, אֶלָּא ״שֶׁרִיבַּבְתָּה״.
״וַתִּפְתַּח וַתִּרְאֵהוּ אֶת הַיֶּלֶד״. ״וַתֵּרֶא״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שֶׁרָאֲתָה שְׁכִינָה עִמּוֹ.

״וְהִנֵּה נַעַר בֹּכֶה״. קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״יֶלֶד״, וְקָרֵי לֵיהּ ״נַעַר״. תָּנָא: הוּא יֶלֶד וְקוֹלוֹ כְּנַעַר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה: אִם כֵּן, עֲשִׂיתוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ בַּעַל מוּם. אֶלָּא, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעָשְׂתָה לוֹ אִמּוֹ חוּפַּת נְעוּרִים בַּתֵּיבָה, אָמְרָה: שֶׁמָּא לֹא אֶזְכֶּה לְחוּפָּתוֹ.
״וַתַּחְמֹל עָלָיו וַתֹּאמֶר מִיַּלְדֵי הָעִבְרִים זֶה״. מְנָא יָדְעָה? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שֶׁרָאֲתָה אוֹתוֹ מָהוּל.
״זֶה״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁנִּתְנַבְּאָה שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתָּהּ — זֶה נוֹפֵל, וְאֵין אַחֵר נוֹפֵל.

וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכִי יֹאמְרוּ אֲלֵיכֶם דִּרְשׁוּ אֶל הָאֹבוֹת וְאֶל הַיִּדְּעֹנִים הַמְצַפְצְפִים וְהַמַּהְגִּים״: צוֹפִין וְאֵינָם יוֹדְעִין מָה צוֹפִין, מְהַגִּים וְאֵינָן יוֹדְעִים מָה מְהַגִּים.

רָאוּ שֶׁמּוֹשִׁיעָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמַּיִם הוּא לוֹקֶה, עָמְדוּ וְגָזְרוּ: ״כׇּל הַבֵּן הַיִּלּוֹד הַיְאֹרָה תַּשְׁלִיכֻהוּ״. כֵּיוָן דְּשַׁדְיוּהּ לְמֹשֶׁה, אָמְרוּ: תּוּ לָא חָזֵינַן כִּי הָהוּא סִימָנָא, בַּטִּלוּ לִגְזֵירְתַּיְיהוּ. וְהֵם אֵינָן יוֹדְעִין שֶׁעַל מֵי מְרִיבָה הוּא לוֹקֶה.

וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״הֵמָּה מֵי מְרִיבָה אֲשֶׁר רָבוּ״ — הֵמָּה שֶׁרָאוּ אִיצְטַגְנִינֵי פַּרְעֹה וְטָעוּ. וְהַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר מֹשֶׁה: ״שֵׁשׁ מֵאוֹת אֶלֶף רַגְלִי וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר לָהֶן מֹשֶׁה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: בִּשְׁבִילִי נִצַּלְתֶּם כּוּלְּכֶם.

רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא אָמַר: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם עֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן הָיָה, אָמְרוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מִי שֶׁעָתִיד לוֹמַר שִׁירָה עַל הַיָּם בְּיוֹם זֶה — יִלְקֶה בְּיוֹם זֶה?

רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם שִׁשָּׁה בְּסִיוָן הָיָה, אָמְרוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מִי שֶׁעָתִיד לְקַבֵּל תּוֹרָה מֵהַר סִינַי בְּיוֹם זֶה — יִלְקֶה בְּיוֹם זֶה?

בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּשִׁשָּׁה בְּסִיוָן, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ תְּלָתָא יַרְחֵי. דְּאָמַר מָר: בְּשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר מֵת, וּבְשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר נוֹלָד מֹשֶׁה, וּמִשִּׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר וְעַד שִׁשָּׁה בְּסִיוָן תְּלָתָא יַרְחֵי. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
אוֹתָהּ שָׁנָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת הָיְתָה: רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן, וְרוּבּוֹ שֶׁל אַחֲרוֹן, וְאֶמְצָעִי שָׁלֵם.
״וַתֹּאמֶר אֲחוֹתוֹ אֶל בַּת פַּרְעֹה הַאֵלֵךְ וְקָרָאתִי לָךְ אִשָּׁה מֵינֶקֶת מִן הָעִבְרִיּוֹת״. וּמַאי שְׁנָא מֵעִבְרִיּוֹת?

מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהֶחְזִירוּהוּ לְמֹשֶׁה עַל כׇּל הַמִּצְרִיּוֹת כּוּלָּן, וְלֹא יָנַק, אָמַר: פֶּה שֶׁעָתִיד לְדַבֵּר עִם הַשְּׁכִינָה יִינַק דָּבָר טָמֵא? וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶת מִי יוֹרֶה דֵעָה וְגוֹ׳״. לְמִי יוֹרֶה דֵּעָה וּלְמִי יָבִין שְׁמוּעָה — ״לִגְמוּלֵי מֵחָלָב וּלְעַתִּיקֵי מִשָּׁדַיִם״.
״וַתֹּאמֶר לָהּ בַּת פַּרְעֹה לֵכִי וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָלְכָה בִּזְרִיזוּת כְּעַלְמָה. רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: ״הָעַלְמָה״ — שֶׁהֶעֱלִימָה אֶת דְּבָרֶיהָ.

״וַתֹּאמֶר לָהּ בַּת פַּרְעֹה הֵילִיכִי אֶת הַיֶּלֶד הַזֶּה״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִתְנַבְּאָה וְאֵינָהּ יוֹדַעַת מָה מִתְנַבְּאָה, ״הֵילִיכִי״ — הָא שֶׁלִּיכִי. ״וַאֲנִי אֶתֵּן אֶת שְׂכָרֵךְ״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לֹא דַּיָּין לַצַּדִּיקִים שֶׁמַּחְזִירִין לָהֶן אֲבֵידָתָן, אֶלָּא שֶׁנּוֹתְנִין לָהֶן שְׂכָרָן.

״וַתִּקַּח מִרְיָם הַנְּבִיאָה אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן וְגוֹ׳״. אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן וְלֹא אֲחוֹת מֹשֶׁה? אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַב: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיְתָה מִתְנַבְּאָה כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן,

וְאוֹמֶרֶת: עֲתִידָה אִמִּי שֶׁתֵּלֵד בֵּן שֶׁמּוֹשִׁיעַ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁנּוֹלַד מֹשֶׁה נִתְמַלֵּא כָּל הַבַּיִת כּוּלּוֹ אוֹר. עָמַד אָבִיהָ וּנְשָׁקָהּ עַל רֹאשָׁהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: בִּתִּי, נִתְקַיְּימָה נְבוּאָתִיךְ. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁהִטִּילוּהוּ לַיְאוֹר, עָמַד אָבִיהָ וּטְפָחָהּ עַל רֹאשָׁהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: בִּתִּי הֵיכָן נְבוּאָתִיךְ? וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתֵּתַצַּב אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵרָחוֹק לְדֵעָה מַה יֵּעָשֶׂה לוֹ״ — לֵידַע מָה יְהֵא בְּסוֹף נְבוּאָתָהּ.

יוֹסֵף זָכָה וְכוּ׳. מַאי שְׁנָא מֵעִיקָּרָא דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַל יוֹסֵף לִקְבּוֹר אֶת אָבִיו וַיַּעֲלוּ אִתּוֹ כׇּל עַבְדֵי פַּרְעֹה וְגוֹ׳״, וַהֲדַר: ״וְכֹל בֵּית יוֹסֵף וְאֶחָיו וּבֵית אָבִיו״, וּמַאי שְׁנָא לְבַסּוֹף דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּשׇׁב יוֹסֵף מִצְרַיְמָה הוּא וְאֶחָיו״, וַהֲדַר: ״וְכׇל הָעוֹלִים אִתּוֹ לִקְבּוֹר אֶת אָבִיו״?
אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בַּתְּחִילָּה עַד שֶׁלֹּא רָאוּ בִּכְבוֹדָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל — לֹא נָהֲגוּ בָּהֶן כָּבוֹד, וּלְבַסּוֹף שֶׁרָאוּ בִּכְבוֹדָן — נָהֲגוּ בָּהֶן כָּבוֹד.

דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּבֹאוּ עַד גּוֹרֶן הָאָטָד״, וְכִי גוֹרֶן יֵשׁ לוֹ לָאָטָד? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִקִּיפוּהוּ כְּתָרִים לַאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב כְּגוֹרֶן זֶה שֶׁמַּקִּיפִים לוֹ אָטָד, שֶׁבָּאוּ בְּנֵי עֵשָׂו וּבְנֵי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וּבְנֵי קְטוּרָה.

תָּנָא: כּוּלָּם לַמִּלְחָמָה בָּאוּ, כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאוּ כִּתְרוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף תָּלוּי בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב, נָטְלוּ כּוּלָּן כִּתְרֵיהֶן וּתְלָאוּם בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב. תָּנָא: שְׁלֹשִׁים וְשִׁשָּׁה כְּתָרִים נִתְלוּ בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב.
״וַיִּסְפְּדוּ שָׁם מִסְפֵּד גָּדוֹל וְכָבֵד מְאֹד״. תָּנָא: אֲפִילּוּ סוּסִים וַאֲפִילּוּ חֲמוֹרִים.

(מֵאֵילּוּ מֵאֵילּוּ) כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעוּ לִמְעָרַת הַמַּכְפֵּלָה, אֲתָא עֵשָׂו קָא מְעַכֵּב, אָמַר לָהֶן: ״מַמְרֵא קִרְיַת הָאַרְבַּע הִיא חֶבְרוֹן״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: קִרְיַת אַרְבַּע — אַרְבַּע זוּגוֹת הָיוּ: אָדָם וְחַוָּה, אַבְרָהָם וְשָׂרָה, יִצְחָק וְרִבְקָה, יַעֲקֹב וְלֵאָה. אִיהוּ קַבְרַהּ לְלֵאָה בְּדִידֵיהּ, וְהַאי דְּפָיֵישׁ — דִּידִי הוּא.

אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: זַבֵּינְתֵּהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: נְהִי דְּזַבֵּינִי בְּכֵירוּתָא, פְּשִׁיטוּתָא מִי זַבֵּינִי? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּקִבְרִי אֲשֶׁר כָּרִיתִי לִי״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק: אֵין ״כִּירָה״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן מְכִירָה, שֶׁכֵּן בִּכְרַכֵּי הַיָּם קוֹרִין לִמְכִירָה ״כִּירָה״.

אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַבוּ לִי אִיגַּרְתָּא! אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִיגַּרְתָּא בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם הִיא. וּמַאן נֵיזִיל — נֵיזִיל נַפְתָּלִי דְּקַלִּיל כִּי אַיָּילְתָּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״נַפְתָּלִי אַיָּלָה שְׁלוּחָה הַנּוֹתֵן אִמְרֵי שָׁפֶר״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״אִמְרֵי שָׁפֶר״, אֶלָּא ״אִמְרֵי סֵפֶר״.

חוּשִׁים בְּרֵיהּ דְּדָן תַּמָּן הֲוָה, וְיַקִּירָן לֵיהּ אוּדְנֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאי הַאי? וְאָמְרוּ לֵיהּ: קָא מְעַכֵּב הַאי עַד דְּאָתֵי נַפְתָּלִי מֵאַרְעָא דְּמִצְרַיִם. אֲמַר לְהוּ: וְעַד דְּאָתֵי נַפְתָּלִי מֵאַרְעָא דְּמִצְרַיִם, יְהֵא אֲבִי אַבָּא מוּטָל בְּבִזָּיוֹן? שְׁקַל קוּלְפָא מַחְיֵיהּ אַרֵישֵׁיהּ, נָתְרָן עֵינֵיהּ וּנְפַלוּ אַכַּרְעָא דְיַעֲקֹב, פַּתְחִינְהוּ יַעֲקֹב לְעֵינֵיהּ וְאַחֵיךְ. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״יִשְׂמַח צַדִּיק כִּי חָזָה נָקָם פְּעָמָיו יִרְחַץ בְּדַם הָרָשָׁע״.

בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִתְקַיְּימָה נְבוּאָתָהּ שֶׁל רִבְקָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״לָמָּה אֶשְׁכַּל גַּם שְׁנֵיכֶם יוֹם אֶחָד״. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּמִיתָתָן לֹא בְּיוֹם אֶחָד הֲוַאי — קְבוּרָתָן מִיהָא בְּיוֹם אֶחָד הֲוַאי.

וְאִי לָא [אִי]עֲסַק בֵּיהּ יוֹסֵף, אֶחָיו לָא הֲווֹ מִעַסְּקִי בֵּיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׂאוּ אוֹתוֹ בָנָיו אַרְצָה כְּנַעַן״? אָמְרוּ: הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ, כְּבוֹדוֹ בִּמְלָכִים יוֹתֵר מִבְּהֶדְיוֹטוֹת.

מִי לָנוּ גָּדוֹל מִיּוֹסֵף כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בֹּא וּרְאֵה כַּמָּה חֲבִיבוֹת מִצְוֹת עַל מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, שֶׁכׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל כּוּלָּן נִתְעַסְּקוּ בַּבִּיזָּה, וְהוּא נִתְעַסֵּק בְּמִצְוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חֲכַם לֵב יִקַּח מִצְוֹת וְגוֹ׳״.

וּמִנַּיִן הָיָה יוֹדֵעַ מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ הֵיכָן יוֹסֵף קָבוּר? אָמְרוּ: סֶרַח בַּת אָשֵׁר נִשְׁתַּיְּירָה מֵאוֹתוֹ הַדּוֹר. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה אֶצְלָהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: כְּלוּם אַתְּ יוֹדַעַת הֵיכָן יוֹסֵף קָבוּר? אָמְרָה לוֹ: אָרוֹן שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת עָשׂוּ לוֹ מִצְרִים וּקְבָעוּהוּ בְּנִילוּס הַנָּהָר, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּתְבָּרְכוּ מֵימָיו. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה וְעָמַד עַל שְׂפַת נִילוּס, אָמַר לוֹ: יוֹסֵף יוֹסֵף! הִגִּיעַ הָעֵת שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּע הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁאֲנִי גּוֹאֵל אֶתְכֶם, וְהִגִּיעָה הַשְּׁבוּעָה שֶׁהִשְׁבַּעְתָּ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. אִם אַתָּה מַרְאֶה עַצְמְךָ מוּטָב, אִם לָאו — הֲרֵי אָנוּ מְנוּקִּין מִשְּׁבוּעָתֶךָ. מִיָּד צָף אֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף.

בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּשִׁשָּׁה בְּסִיוָן, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ תְּלָתָא יַרְחֵי. דְּאָמַר מָר: בְּשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר מֵת, וּבְשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר נוֹלָד מֹשֶׁה, וּמִשִּׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר וְעַד שִׁשָּׁה בְּסִיוָן תְּלָתָא יַרְחֵי. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
אוֹתָהּ שָׁנָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת הָיְתָה: רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן, וְרוּבּוֹ שֶׁל אַחֲרוֹן, וְאֶמְצָעִי שָׁלֵם.
״וַתֹּאמֶר אֲחוֹתוֹ אֶל בַּת פַּרְעֹה הַאֵלֵךְ וְקָרָאתִי לָךְ אִשָּׁה מֵינֶקֶת מִן הָעִבְרִיּוֹת״. וּמַאי שְׁנָא מֵעִבְרִיּוֹת?

מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהֶחְזִירוּהוּ לְמֹשֶׁה עַל כׇּל הַמִּצְרִיּוֹת כּוּלָּן, וְלֹא יָנַק, אָמַר: פֶּה שֶׁעָתִיד לְדַבֵּר עִם הַשְּׁכִינָה יִינַק דָּבָר טָמֵא? וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶת מִי יוֹרֶה דֵעָה וְגוֹ׳״. לְמִי יוֹרֶה דֵּעָה וּלְמִי יָבִין שְׁמוּעָה — ״לִגְמוּלֵי מֵחָלָב וּלְעַתִּיקֵי מִשָּׁדַיִם״.
״וַתֹּאמֶר לָהּ בַּת פַּרְעֹה לֵכִי וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָלְכָה בִּזְרִיזוּת כְּעַלְמָה. רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: ״הָעַלְמָה״ — שֶׁהֶעֱלִימָה אֶת דְּבָרֶיהָ.

״וַתֹּאמֶר לָהּ בַּת פַּרְעֹה הֵילִיכִי אֶת הַיֶּלֶד הַזֶּה״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִתְנַבְּאָה וְאֵינָהּ יוֹדַעַת מָה מִתְנַבְּאָה, ״הֵילִיכִי״ — הָא שֶׁלִּיכִי. ״וַאֲנִי אֶתֵּן אֶת שְׂכָרֵךְ״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לֹא דַּיָּין לַצַּדִּיקִים שֶׁמַּחְזִירִין לָהֶן אֲבֵידָתָן, אֶלָּא שֶׁנּוֹתְנִין לָהֶן שְׂכָרָן.

״וַתִּקַּח מִרְיָם הַנְּבִיאָה אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן וְגוֹ׳״. אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן וְלֹא אֲחוֹת מֹשֶׁה? אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַב: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיְתָה מִתְנַבְּאָה כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן,

וְאוֹמֶרֶת: עֲתִידָה אִמִּי שֶׁתֵּלֵד בֵּן שֶׁמּוֹשִׁיעַ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁנּוֹלַד מֹשֶׁה נִתְמַלֵּא כָּל הַבַּיִת כּוּלּוֹ אוֹר. עָמַד אָבִיהָ וּנְשָׁקָהּ עַל רֹאשָׁהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: בִּתִּי, נִתְקַיְּימָה נְבוּאָתִיךְ. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁהִטִּילוּהוּ לַיְאוֹר, עָמַד אָבִיהָ וּטְפָחָהּ עַל רֹאשָׁהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: בִּתִּי הֵיכָן נְבוּאָתִיךְ? וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתֵּתַצַּב אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵרָחוֹק לְדֵעָה מַה יֵּעָשֶׂה לוֹ״ — לֵידַע מָה יְהֵא בְּסוֹף נְבוּאָתָהּ.

יוֹסֵף זָכָה וְכוּ׳. מַאי שְׁנָא מֵעִיקָּרָא דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַל יוֹסֵף לִקְבּוֹר אֶת אָבִיו וַיַּעֲלוּ אִתּוֹ כׇּל עַבְדֵי פַּרְעֹה וְגוֹ׳״, וַהֲדַר: ״וְכֹל בֵּית יוֹסֵף וְאֶחָיו וּבֵית אָבִיו״, וּמַאי שְׁנָא לְבַסּוֹף דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּשׇׁב יוֹסֵף מִצְרַיְמָה הוּא וְאֶחָיו״, וַהֲדַר: ״וְכׇל הָעוֹלִים אִתּוֹ לִקְבּוֹר אֶת אָבִיו״?
אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בַּתְּחִילָּה עַד שֶׁלֹּא רָאוּ בִּכְבוֹדָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל — לֹא נָהֲגוּ בָּהֶן כָּבוֹד, וּלְבַסּוֹף שֶׁרָאוּ בִּכְבוֹדָן — נָהֲגוּ בָּהֶן כָּבוֹד.

דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּבֹאוּ עַד גּוֹרֶן הָאָטָד״, וְכִי גוֹרֶן יֵשׁ לוֹ לָאָטָד? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִקִּיפוּהוּ כְּתָרִים לַאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב כְּגוֹרֶן זֶה שֶׁמַּקִּיפִים לוֹ אָטָד, שֶׁבָּאוּ בְּנֵי עֵשָׂו וּבְנֵי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וּבְנֵי קְטוּרָה.

תָּנָא: כּוּלָּם לַמִּלְחָמָה בָּאוּ, כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאוּ כִּתְרוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף תָּלוּי בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב, נָטְלוּ כּוּלָּן כִּתְרֵיהֶן וּתְלָאוּם בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב. תָּנָא: שְׁלֹשִׁים וְשִׁשָּׁה כְּתָרִים נִתְלוּ בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב.
״וַיִּסְפְּדוּ שָׁם מִסְפֵּד גָּדוֹל וְכָבֵד מְאֹד״. תָּנָא: אֲפִילּוּ סוּסִים וַאֲפִילּוּ חֲמוֹרִים.

(מֵאֵילּוּ מֵאֵילּוּ) כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעוּ לִמְעָרַת הַמַּכְפֵּלָה, אֲתָא עֵשָׂו קָא מְעַכֵּב, אָמַר לָהֶן: ״מַמְרֵא קִרְיַת הָאַרְבַּע הִיא חֶבְרוֹן״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: קִרְיַת אַרְבַּע — אַרְבַּע זוּגוֹת הָיוּ: אָדָם וְחַוָּה, אַבְרָהָם וְשָׂרָה, יִצְחָק וְרִבְקָה, יַעֲקֹב וְלֵאָה. אִיהוּ קַבְרַהּ לְלֵאָה בְּדִידֵיהּ, וְהַאי דְּפָיֵישׁ — דִּידִי הוּא.

אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: זַבֵּינְתֵּהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: נְהִי דְּזַבֵּינִי בְּכֵירוּתָא, פְּשִׁיטוּתָא מִי זַבֵּינִי? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּקִבְרִי אֲשֶׁר כָּרִיתִי לִי״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק: אֵין ״כִּירָה״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן מְכִירָה, שֶׁכֵּן בִּכְרַכֵּי הַיָּם קוֹרִין לִמְכִירָה ״כִּירָה״.

אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַבוּ לִי אִיגַּרְתָּא! אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִיגַּרְתָּא בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם הִיא. וּמַאן נֵיזִיל — נֵיזִיל נַפְתָּלִי דְּקַלִּיל כִּי אַיָּילְתָּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״נַפְתָּלִי אַיָּלָה שְׁלוּחָה הַנּוֹתֵן אִמְרֵי שָׁפֶר״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״אִמְרֵי שָׁפֶר״, אֶלָּא ״אִמְרֵי סֵפֶר״.

חוּשִׁים בְּרֵיהּ דְּדָן תַּמָּן הֲוָה, וְיַקִּירָן לֵיהּ אוּדְנֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאי הַאי? וְאָמְרוּ לֵיהּ: קָא מְעַכֵּב הַאי עַד דְּאָתֵי נַפְתָּלִי מֵאַרְעָא דְּמִצְרַיִם. אֲמַר לְהוּ: וְעַד דְּאָתֵי נַפְתָּלִי מֵאַרְעָא דְּמִצְרַיִם, יְהֵא אֲבִי אַבָּא מוּטָל בְּבִזָּיוֹן? שְׁקַל קוּלְפָא מַחְיֵיהּ אַרֵישֵׁיהּ, נָתְרָן עֵינֵיהּ וּנְפַלוּ אַכַּרְעָא דְיַעֲקֹב, פַּתְחִינְהוּ יַעֲקֹב לְעֵינֵיהּ וְאַחֵיךְ. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״יִשְׂמַח צַדִּיק כִּי חָזָה נָקָם פְּעָמָיו יִרְחַץ בְּדַם הָרָשָׁע״.

בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִתְקַיְּימָה נְבוּאָתָהּ שֶׁל רִבְקָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״לָמָּה אֶשְׁכַּל גַּם שְׁנֵיכֶם יוֹם אֶחָד״. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּמִיתָתָן לֹא בְּיוֹם אֶחָד הֲוַאי — קְבוּרָתָן מִיהָא בְּיוֹם אֶחָד הֲוַאי.

וְאִי לָא [אִי]עֲסַק בֵּיהּ יוֹסֵף, אֶחָיו לָא הֲווֹ מִעַסְּקִי בֵּיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׂאוּ אוֹתוֹ בָנָיו אַרְצָה כְּנַעַן״? אָמְרוּ: הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ, כְּבוֹדוֹ בִּמְלָכִים יוֹתֵר מִבְּהֶדְיוֹטוֹת.

מִי לָנוּ גָּדוֹל מִיּוֹסֵף כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בֹּא וּרְאֵה כַּמָּה חֲבִיבוֹת מִצְוֹת עַל מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, שֶׁכׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל כּוּלָּן נִתְעַסְּקוּ בַּבִּיזָּה, וְהוּא נִתְעַסֵּק בְּמִצְוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חֲכַם לֵב יִקַּח מִצְוֹת וְגוֹ׳״.

וּמִנַּיִן הָיָה יוֹדֵעַ מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ הֵיכָן יוֹסֵף קָבוּר? אָמְרוּ: סֶרַח בַּת אָשֵׁר נִשְׁתַּיְּירָה מֵאוֹתוֹ הַדּוֹר. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה אֶצְלָהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: כְּלוּם אַתְּ יוֹדַעַת הֵיכָן יוֹסֵף קָבוּר? אָמְרָה לוֹ: אָרוֹן שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת עָשׂוּ לוֹ מִצְרִים וּקְבָעוּהוּ בְּנִילוּס הַנָּהָר, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּתְבָּרְכוּ מֵימָיו. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה וְעָמַד עַל שְׂפַת נִילוּס, אָמַר לוֹ: יוֹסֵף יוֹסֵף! הִגִּיעַ הָעֵת שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּע הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁאֲנִי גּוֹאֵל אֶתְכֶם, וְהִגִּיעָה הַשְּׁבוּעָה שֶׁהִשְׁבַּעְתָּ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. אִם אַתָּה מַרְאֶה עַצְמְךָ מוּטָב, אִם לָאו — הֲרֵי אָנוּ מְנוּקִּין מִשְּׁבוּעָתֶךָ. מִיָּד צָף אֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף.

וְאַל תִּתְמַהּ הֵיאַךְ בַּרְזֶל צָף, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּתִיב: ״וַיְהִי הָאֶחָד מַפִּיל הַקּוֹרָה וְאֶת הַבַּרְזֶל נָפַל אֶל הַמָּיִם וְגוֹ׳ אֲהָהּ אֲדוֹנִי וְהוּא שָׁאוּל. וַיֹּאמֶר אִישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים אָנָה נָפָל וַיַּרְאֵהוּ אֶת הַמָּקוֹם וַיִּקְצׇב עֵץ וַיַּשְׁלֶךְ שָׁמָּה וַיָּצֶף הַבַּרְזֶל״. וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה אֱלִישָׁע תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל אֵלִיָּהוּ, וְאֵלִיָּהוּ תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה — צָף בַּרְזֶל מִפָּנָיו, מִפְּנֵי מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.

רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: בְּקַבַּרְנִיט שֶׁל מְלָכִים הָיָה קָבוּר. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה וְעָמַד עַל קַבַּרְנִיט שֶׁל מְלָכִים, אָמַר: יוֹסֵף, הִגִּיעַ עֵת שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּע הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁאֲנִי גּוֹאֵל אֶתְכֶם, וְהִגִּיעָה שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁהִשְׁבַּעְתָּ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. אִם אַתָּה מַרְאֶה עַצְמְךָ — מוּטָב, וְאִם לָאו — הֲרֵי אָנוּ מְנוּקִּין מִשְּׁבוּעָתֶךָ. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִזְדַּעְזַע אֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף, נְטָלוֹ מֹשֶׁה, וֶהֱבִיאוֹ אֶצְלוֹ.

וְכׇל אוֹתָן שָׁנִים שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר, הָיוּ שְׁנֵי אֲרוֹנוֹת הַלָּלוּ, אֶחָד שֶׁל מֵת וְאֶחָד שֶׁל שְׁכִינָה, מְהַלְּכִין זֶה עִם זֶה, וְהָיוּ עוֹבְרִין וְשָׁבִין אוֹמְרִים: מָה טִיבָן שֶׁל שְׁנֵי אֲרוֹנוֹת הַלָּלוּ? אָמְרוּ: אֶחָד שֶׁל מֵת וְאֶחָד שֶׁל שְׁכִינָה. וְכִי מָה דַּרְכּוֹ שֶׁל מֵת לְהַלֵּךְ עִם שְׁכִינָה? אָמְרוּ:
llm_translation: Agam, as it is written: "Kaneh and Suf Kamelu"

"And the daughter of Pharaoh came down to the well, says Rabbi Yohanan on behalf of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: He teaches that she descended to the well because of the impurities of her father's house, and thus he says: 'If He has cleansed the daughters of Zion and will appear in His glory, then the Lord, the Lord, will be king over all the earth; on that day it shall be said: "This is our God; we have waited for Him, that He may save us, this is the Lord; we have waited for Him, we shall rejoice and be glad.'"'"
And it says, "And her maidservants going and going", said Rabbi Yohanan: This journey is not except for the sake of death, and thus he says: "Behold, I am going to die".

And behold, he saw the pit in the midst of the river. When he looked and saw that they were seeking to enthrall him like Moses, they said to her: Our mistress, according to the custom of the world, a king of flesh and blood decrees a decree, if all the world is not observing it — his sons and his household are observing it, and you are passing over the decree of your father? And Gabriel came and struck him on the ground.

"And she sent her maid and took her." Rabbis Yehudah and Nachman, one says: Her hand, and one says: Her maidservant. Whoever says Her hand - it is written "Amatoh". And whoever says Her maidservant - it is not written "Yadah". (
And one who says "her servant", he said, "Gabriel and Habtan are on the ground! He should give her a new one, lest her way not be according to the king's decree for her."

And whoever says "her hand", let him write "her hand"! This one is teaching like a man who teaches men. For it was said by the Master: And you will find in her mother's womb, and you will find in the eyes of wicked people, as it is written: "The eyes of wicked people are shattered". And Reish Lakish said: Do not read "shattered", but rather "have been torn apart". (
"And she opened and beheld the child." "Behold!" from before him! Rabbi Yosei said in the name of Rabbi Chanina: "That which he saw, Shekhinah was with him."

And behold, a youth is weeping. They call him "yelad" and they also call him "na'ar". The Tanna said: He is a yelad and his voice is like that of a na'ar, as it were the words of Rabbi Yehudah. Rabbi Nchemiah said to him: If so, do it for our teacher Moses, may he rest in peace. But rather, he teaches that his mother did for him a covering of youthfulness in the house, and she said: "Perhaps I will not be able to cover him."
"And she took hold of him and said, 'Who are the children of the Hebrews this?' Did he know? Said Rabbi Yosei before Rabbi Chanina: He saw him being taken."
"This". Said Rabbi Yohanan: Teaches that if one prophesied that he would not learn from it — this falls, and there is no other that falls.

And behold, what Rabbi El'eazar said: What is written? "And if they say to you, 'Seek out the answers from those who are old and knowledgeable, those who are wise and understanding'": They seek and do not know what they seek; they understand and do not know what they understand.

Behold, that which redeems Israel in the waters, he is bound, stood and decreed: "All the son who is bound to the yoke will be thrown." When they said to Moses, they said: Do not look, for that sign is, we have decided to decree it. And they are not knowing that on account of the strife he is bound.

And behold, what Rabbi Chama bar Rabbi Chanina said: What is written, "They are those who strive with each other, whose multitude is like the sand of the sea"? - They saw the Egyptian chariots and were misled. And behold, what Moses said: "Six hundred thousand footmen and so on", he said to Israel: For my sake you were redeemed all of you. (

Rabbi Chanina bar Pappah said: Today is the twentieth of Nisan, they said. The angels of the presence said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Our Master of the universe, who is destined to recite a song on the sea on this day — will he recite it on this day?

Rabbi Acha bar Chanina said: Today, six days passed since the giving of the Torah at Sinai. The angels of the Presence said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Our Master of the Universe, who is destined to receive the Torah from Mount Sinai on this very day — will he not receive it on this very day? (

In any case, with regard to one who says in the sixth of Sivan, "The third hour is the time." Said Rabbah: In seven days the dead person dies, and in seven days the living person is born. And from seven days until the sixteenth of Nisan, the third hour is the time. But for one who says in twenty and one of Nisan, what is the significance of this?
That year was replete with controversy: the first one's wheel and the last one's wheel, and the middle one is complete.
And her sister said to Pharaoh's daughter, "Go and call for me a wet-nurse from the Hebrew women." And what is the reason that she says "from the Hebrew women"?

Teaches that one who returns him to Moses regarding all the Mitzvot, and does not wean, says: "Shall he who is destined to speak with the Shechinah utter a filthy speech? And behold it is written: 'Who teaches knowledge and...'". To whom teaches knowledge and understands a report - "To the sons of mighty men and old men of the assembly".

"He said to her, 'Daughter of Pharaoh, go and...'". Rabbi El'eazar said: He teaches that she went with haste like a young girl. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: "The young girl" - that she had concealed her words.

She said to her, "Daughter of Pharaoh, take this child." Rabbi Hamuna son of Rabbi Chanina said: It is boasting and she does not know what it is boasting about, "Take this" - this one. "And I will give you your wages." Rabbi Hamuna son of Rabbi Chanina said: It is not given to the righteous who return their losses, but rather we give them their due.

"And Miriam the prophetess, sister of Aaron, took." Sister of Aaron and not sister of Moses? Said Rav Amram said Rav, and I would say to her, said Rav Nachman said Rav: "Teaches that she prophesied when she was sister of Aaron,"

And she says: "My daughter, it will happen that she will give birth to a son who will redeem Israel." And when Moses was born, all the house was filled with light. Her husband stood and blessed her on her head, saying to her: "Daughter, may your prophecy be fulfilled." And when they placed him in the light, her husband stood and blessed her on her head, saying to her: "Daughter, where is your prophecy?" And behold it is written: "And his sister stood at a distance to know what would become of him" - to know what will happen at the end of her prophecy.

Yosef has merit and so on. What is the matter that it is written: "And Yosef arose to bury his father, and all the servants of Par'oh went up with him and so on"? And further: "All the house of Yosef and his brothers and the house of his father"? And what is the matter that it is written: "And Yosef rose from Egypt, he and his brothers"? And further: "And all the souls that were with him to bury his father"?
Said Rabbi Yohanan: From the beginning until they did not see the glory of Israel - they did not behave with glory, and at the end when they saw the glory of Israel - they behaved with glory.

It is written: "And they came unto the oak of Zarephath", and why is it called the oak of Zarephath? Rabbi Abahu said: It teaches that they wrapped him in wreaths for the aron (ark) of Jacob, just as this oak has a vineyard, which the sons of Esau, the sons of Ishmael, and the sons of Keturah entered.

Talmudic text: Teama: Kolam lamilchah ba'u, keivan shera'u kitoro shel Yosef tali b'arono shel Yaakov, natlu kolam kitorayhem utla'am ba'arono shel Yaakov. Teama: Shloshim v'shisha k'tarim nitlu ba'arono shel Yaakov. English translation: Teama: All of them came to war, when they saw the coat of Joseph hanging in the pillar of Jacob, they took all their coats and hung them in the pillar of Jacob. Teama: Thirty-six coats were hung in the pillar of Jacob.
"And they lamented there a great and mighty lamentation". Tanna: "Even mules and even donkeys".

(From where do we learn that?) When they reached the depth of the well, Esau came and said to them: "This is the city of the four - it is a bond", and Rabbi Yitzchak said: The city of four refers to four pairs: Adam and Chava, Abraham and Sarah, Isaac and Rivka, Jacob and Leah. He buried Leah in his tomb, and this one (Leah) is my own.

They said to him: You have sinned. He said to them: I will be in the merit of my father's good deeds, who is it that has sinned? They said to him: None, as it is written: "In my grave which I have dug for myself" Isaiah 22:16. And Rabbi Yohanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotsadak: There is no "merit" except for the language of sale, therefore in the markets of the sea they call it "merit".

He said to them: Give me a document! They said to him: The document is in the land of Egypt. And who will nullify? Nullify, I will nullify, because it is written: "Nullify, a gazelle that gives forth sweet words." Rabbi Abahu said: Do not say "sweet words," but rather "words of the book".

Rabbi Dan was sitting in Tamnus, and his friend Yaqirah was sitting with him. He said to them: What is this? And they said to him: This one is delaying until my nephew from the land of Egypt has arrived. He said to them: Until my nephew from the land of Egypt has arrived, will my father-in-law be buried in his burial garments? Weigh the scales of his coffin, and let it fall upon the neck of Jacob, open it for him and his brother. And behold, it is written: "The righteous shall rejoice when he sees vengeance done to the wicked; he shall wash his hands in the blood of the wicked."

At that time, the prophecy of Rebekah was fulfilled, as it is written: "Why should I deprive even one of you a day?" And even though they died on the same day, it was not on the same day that their burial was performed.

And if not if Joseph was occupied with him, his brothers were not occupied with him? And it is written: "And they took him and cast him into a pit in the land of Canaan"? They said: Let him be, for his honor is greater than that of kings.

Who is great to us, like Joseph? The rabbis taught: Come and see how many commandments are dear to Moses our teacher, for all of Israel were occupied with indulgence, and he was occupied with commandments, as it is said: "A wise heart will take commandments."

And from where did Moses our teacher know where Joseph was buried? They said: "The coffin of Asher was hidden away for a hundred years. Moses went to her, and said to her: 'Do you know where Joseph is buried?' She said to him: 'The Egyptians made an ark for him and placed it in the Nile River, so that his days would be blessed.' Moses went and stood on the bank of the Nile, and said to him: 'Joseph, Joseph! The time has come when the Holy One, Blessed be He, swore that I would redeem you, and the oath that you swore with Israel has arrived. If you see fit in your eyes, if not - we are absolving ourselves from your oath.' And immediately the coffin of Joseph arose."

And do not wonder about the iron that sank, since it is written: "And one of the men fell from a height and the iron sank into the water and so on." And behold, my Master said to me: "Where did it sink and I saw the place and planted an olive tree there and the iron sank beneath it." And are not matters simple and straightforward? What is Elijah's student, who is Moses' student - the iron sinks from his presence, from Moses our teacher's presence - on one side and on the other.

Rabbi Nathan says: In the sepulcher of kings it was buried. Moses went and stood on the sepulcher of kings, said: Joseph, the time has arrived when the Holy One, blessed be He, swore that I would redeem you, and an oath was sworn by Israel. If you see your face - good, and if not - behold we are releasing from your oath. At that moment the horn of Joseph was shattered, Moses took it away from him, and brought it to him.

And all those years that Israel were in the wilderness, there were two cedars of Lebanon, one of death and one of Shechinah, walking together, and they would pass by and return saying: What is the nature of these two cedars of Lebanon? They said: One of death and one of Shechinah. And why does the path of death walk with Shechinah? They said: (

sentences.text: אֲגַם, כְּדִכְתִיב: ״קָנֶה וָסוּף קָמֵלוּ״.
sentences.human_translation: a marsh, as it is written: “The reeds and willows [ suf ] shall wither”
sentences.llm_translation: Agam, as it is written: "Kaneh and Suf Kamelu"

sentences.text: ״וַתֵּרֶד בַּת פַּרְעֹה לִרְחוֹץ עַל הַיְאֹר״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁיָּרְדָה לִרְחוֹץ מִגִּלּוּלֵי [בֵּית] אָבִיהָ, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אִם רָחַץ ה׳ אֵת צוֹאַת בְּנוֹת צִיּוֹן וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: “And the daughter of Pharaoh came down to bathe [ lirḥotz ] in the river” Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: teaches that she came down to cleanse from her father’s idols, And similarly it states: “When the Lord shall have washed [ raḥatz ] away the filth of the daughters of Zion,
sentences.llm_translation: "And the daughter of Pharaoh came down to the well, says Rabbi Yohanan on behalf of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: He teaches that she descended to the well because of the impurities of her father's house, and thus he says: 'If He has cleansed the daughters of Zion and will appear in His glory, then the Lord, the Lord, will be king over all the earth; on that day it shall be said: "This is our God; we have waited for Him, that He may save us, this is the Lord; we have waited for Him, we shall rejoice and be glad.'"'"

sentences.text: ״וְנַעֲרֹתֶיהָ הוֹלְכוֹת וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין הֲלִיכָה זוֹ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן מִיתָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״הִנֵּה אָנֹכִי הוֹלֵךְ לָמוּת״.
sentences.human_translation: “And her maidens walked [ holekhot ] Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This walking nothing other terminology of death, and similarly it states: “Behold, I am going [ holekh ] to die”
sentences.llm_translation: And it says, "And her maidservants going and going", said Rabbi Yohanan: This journey is not except for the sake of death, and thus he says: "Behold, I am going to die".

sentences.text: ״וַתֵּרֶא אֶת הַתֵּיבָה בְּתוֹךְ הַסּוּף״, כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזוֹ דְּקָא בָעוּ לְאַצּוֹלֵי לְמֹשֶׁה, אָמְרוּ לָהּ: גְּבִירְתֵּנוּ, מִנְהָגוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם מֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וָדָם גּוֹזֵר גְּזֵירָה, אִם כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ אֵין מְקַיְּימִין אוֹתָהּ — בָּנָיו וּבְנֵי בֵיתוֹ מְקַיְּימִין אוֹתָהּ, וְאַתְּ עוֹבֶרֶת עַל גְּזֵירַת אָבִיךְ? בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וַחֲבָטָן בַּקַּרְקַע.
sentences.human_translation: “And she saw the ark among the willows” Once saw that was intending to save Moses, they said to her: Our mistress, the custom of the world a king of flesh and blood decrees a decree, if all the world does not fulfill it, his children and members of his household fulfill it, and you are violating the decree of your father. Gabriel came and beat them to the ground
sentences.llm_translation: And behold, he saw the pit in the midst of the river. When he looked and saw that they were seeking to enthrall him like Moses, they said to her: Our mistress, according to the custom of the world, a king of flesh and blood decrees a decree, if all the world is not observing it — his sons and his household are observing it, and you are passing over the decree of your father? And Gabriel came and struck him on the ground.

sentences.text: ״וַתִּשְׁלַח אֶת אֲמָתָהּ וַתִּקָּחֶהָ״. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, חַד אָמַר: יָדָהּ, וְחַד אָמַר: שִׁפְחָתָהּ. מַאן דְּאָמַר יָדָהּ — דִּכְתִיב ״אַמָּתָהּ״. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר שִׁפְחָתָהּ — מִדְּלָא כְּתִיב ״יָדָהּ״.
sentences.human_translation: “And she sent amatah to take it” Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Neḥemya One says her arm, and one says her maidservant. The one who says her arm as it is written “ amatah ,” And the one who says her maidservant because it does not write Her hand [ yadah ].
sentences.llm_translation: "And she sent her maid and took her." Rabbis Yehudah and Nachman, one says: Her hand, and one says: Her maidservant. Whoever says Her hand - it is written "Amatoh". And whoever says Her maidservant - it is not written "Yadah". (

sentences.text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר שִׁפְחָתָהּ, הָא אָמְרַתְּ בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וַחֲבָטָן בַּקַּרְקַע! דְּשַׁיַּיר לַהּ חֲדָא, דְּלָאו אוֹרְחַהּ דְּבַת מַלְכָּא לְמֵיקַם לְחוֹדַהּ.
sentences.human_translation: And according to the one who says her maidservant, didn’t you say Gabriel came and beat them to the ground that left her one as it is not proper that a princess should stand alone.
sentences.llm_translation: And one who says "her servant", he said, "Gabriel and Habtan are on the ground! He should give her a new one, lest her way not be according to the king's decree for her."

sentences.text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר יָדָהּ, לִיכְתּוֹב ״יָדָהּ״! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאִישְׁתַּרְבַּב אִישְׁתַּרְבּוֹבֵי. דְּאָמַר מָר: וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בְּאַמָּתָהּ שֶׁל בַּת פַּרְעֹה, וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בְּשִׁינֵּי רְשָׁעִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״שִׁנֵּי רְשָׁעִים שִׁבַּרְתָּ״, וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״שִׁבַּרְתָּ״, אֶלָּא ״שֶׁרִיבַּבְתָּה״.
sentences.human_translation: And according to the one who says her hand, let write Her hand [ yadah ]. This teaches us that her arm extended [ ishtarbav ] As the Master said And similarly you find with regard to the hand of Pharaoh’s daughter and similarly you find with regard to the teeth of evildoers, as it is written: “You have broken [ shibbarta ] the teeth of the wicked” and Reish Lakish said: Do not read shibbarta , rather sheribbavta ,
sentences.llm_translation: And whoever says "her hand", let him write "her hand"! This one is teaching like a man who teaches men. For it was said by the Master: And you will find in her mother's womb, and you will find in the eyes of wicked people, as it is written: "The eyes of wicked people are shattered". And Reish Lakish said: Do not read "shattered", but rather "have been torn apart". (

sentences.text: ״וַתִּפְתַּח וַתִּרְאֵהוּ אֶת הַיֶּלֶד״. ״וַתֵּרֶא״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שֶׁרָאֲתָה שְׁכִינָה עִמּוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: “And she opened it and saw it [ vatirehu ], even the child” it should have And she saw. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: she saw the Divine Presence with him.
sentences.llm_translation: "And she opened and beheld the child." "Behold!" from before him! Rabbi Yosei said in the name of Rabbi Chanina: "That which he saw, Shekhinah was with him."

sentences.text: ״וְהִנֵּה נַעַר בֹּכֶה״. קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״יֶלֶד״, וְקָרֵי לֵיהּ ״נַעַר״. תָּנָא: הוּא יֶלֶד וְקוֹלוֹ כְּנַעַר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה: אִם כֵּן, עֲשִׂיתוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ בַּעַל מוּם. אֶלָּא, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעָשְׂתָה לוֹ אִמּוֹ חוּפַּת נְעוּרִים בַּתֵּיבָה, אָמְרָה: שֶׁמָּא לֹא אֶזְכֶּה לְחוּפָּתוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: and behold a lad [ na’ar ] that wept” calls him “a child [ yeled ],” and calls him “a lad [ na’ar ].” teaches: He is a child but his voice as a lad; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Neḥemya said to him: If so, you made Moses our teacher blemished, Rather, teaches that his mother made a canopy of youth, for him in the ark, she said: Perhaps I will not merit to his canopy.
sentences.llm_translation: And behold, a youth is weeping. They call him "yelad" and they also call him "na'ar". The Tanna said: He is a yelad and his voice is like that of a na'ar, as it were the words of Rabbi Yehudah. Rabbi Nchemiah said to him: If so, do it for our teacher Moses, may he rest in peace. But rather, he teaches that his mother did for him a covering of youthfulness in the house, and she said: "Perhaps I will not be able to cover him."

sentences.text: ״וַתַּחְמֹל עָלָיו וַתֹּאמֶר מִיַּלְדֵי הָעִבְרִים זֶה״. מְנָא יָדְעָה? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שֶׁרָאֲתָה אוֹתוֹ מָהוּל.
sentences.human_translation: “And she had compassion on him, and said: This [ zeh ] is one of the Hebrews’ children” From where did she know Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: As she saw he was circumcised.
sentences.llm_translation: "And she took hold of him and said, 'Who are the children of the Hebrews this?' Did he know? Said Rabbi Yosei before Rabbi Chanina: He saw him being taken."

sentences.text: ״זֶה״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁנִּתְנַבְּאָה שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתָּהּ — זֶה נוֹפֵל, וְאֵין אַחֵר נוֹפֵל.
sentences.human_translation: “This [ zeh ] Rabbi Yoḥanan says: teaches that she prophesied unknowingly, This falls, but no other fall
sentences.llm_translation: "This". Said Rabbi Yohanan: Teaches that if one prophesied that he would not learn from it — this falls, and there is no other that falls.

sentences.text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכִי יֹאמְרוּ אֲלֵיכֶם דִּרְשׁוּ אֶל הָאֹבוֹת וְאֶל הַיִּדְּעֹנִים הַמְצַפְצְפִים וְהַמַּהְגִּים״: צוֹפִין וְאֵינָם יוֹדְעִין מָה צוֹפִין, מְהַגִּים וְאֵינָן יוֹדְעִים מָה מְהַגִּים.
sentences.human_translation: And this is what Rabbi Elazar said: What is which is written: “And when they shall say to you: Seek unto the necromancers and the diviners, that chirp [ metzaftzefim ] and that mutter [ mahggim ]” They see [ tzofin ], but they do not know what they are seeing; they enunciate [ mahggim ], but they do not know what they are enunciating.
sentences.llm_translation: And behold, what Rabbi El'eazar said: What is written? "And if they say to you, 'Seek out the answers from those who are old and knowledgeable, those who are wise and understanding'": They seek and do not know what they seek; they understand and do not know what they understand.

sentences.text: רָאוּ שֶׁמּוֹשִׁיעָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמַּיִם הוּא לוֹקֶה, עָמְדוּ וְגָזְרוּ: ״כׇּל הַבֵּן הַיִּלּוֹד הַיְאֹרָה תַּשְׁלִיכֻהוּ״. כֵּיוָן דְּשַׁדְיוּהּ לְמֹשֶׁה, אָמְרוּ: תּוּ לָא חָזֵינַן כִּי הָהוּא סִימָנָא, בַּטִּלוּ לִגְזֵירְתַּיְיהוּ. וְהֵם אֵינָן יוֹדְעִין שֶׁעַל מֵי מְרִיבָה הוּא לוֹקֶה.
sentences.human_translation: saw that the savior of the Jewish people would be stricken by water. they arose and decreed: “Every son that is born you shall cast into the river” Once cast Moses said: We no longer see like that sign they canceled their decree. But they did not know that would be stricken on account of the waters of Meribah.
sentences.llm_translation: Behold, that which redeems Israel in the waters, he is bound, stood and decreed: "All the son who is bound to the yoke will be thrown." When they said to Moses, they said: Do not look, for that sign is, we have decided to decree it. And they are not knowing that on account of the strife he is bound.

sentences.text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״הֵמָּה מֵי מְרִיבָה אֲשֶׁר רָבוּ״ — הֵמָּה שֶׁרָאוּ אִיצְטַגְנִינֵי פַּרְעֹה וְטָעוּ. וְהַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר מֹשֶׁה: ״שֵׁשׁ מֵאוֹת אֶלֶף רַגְלִי וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר לָהֶן מֹשֶׁה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: בִּשְׁבִילִי נִצַּלְתֶּם כּוּלְּכֶם.
sentences.human_translation: And this is what Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: What is which is written: “These [ hemma ] are the waters of Meribah, where strove these are that the astrologers of Pharaoh saw and erred. And this is what Moses said: are six hundred thousand men on foot [ ragli ]; Moses said to the Jewish people: On account of me, all of you were saved,
sentences.llm_translation: And behold, what Rabbi Chama bar Rabbi Chanina said: What is written, "They are those who strive with each other, whose multitude is like the sand of the sea"? - They saw the Egyptian chariots and were misled. And behold, what Moses said: "Six hundred thousand footmen and so on", he said to Israel: For my sake you were redeemed all of you. (

sentences.text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא אָמַר: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם עֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן הָיָה, אָמְרוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מִי שֶׁעָתִיד לוֹמַר שִׁירָה עַל הַיָּם בְּיוֹם זֶה — יִלְקֶה בְּיוֹם זֶה?
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa says: That day was the twenty-first of Nisan. The ministering angels said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, one who in the future will say Song at the Sea on this day be stricken on this day?
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina bar Pappah said: Today is the twentieth of Nisan, they said. The angels of the presence said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Our Master of the universe, who is destined to recite a song on the sea on this day — will he recite it on this day?

sentences.text: רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם שִׁשָּׁה בְּסִיוָן הָיָה, אָמְרוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מִי שֶׁעָתִיד לְקַבֵּל תּוֹרָה מֵהַר סִינַי בְּיוֹם זֶה — יִלְקֶה בְּיוֹם זֶה?
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina says: That day was the sixth of Sivan. The ministering angels said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, one who in the future will receive Torah on Mount Sinai on this day be stricken on this day?
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Acha bar Chanina said: Today, six days passed since the giving of the Torah at Sinai. The angels of the Presence said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Our Master of the Universe, who is destined to receive the Torah from Mount Sinai on this very day — will he not receive it on this very day? (

sentences.text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּשִׁשָּׁה בְּסִיוָן, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ תְּלָתָא יַרְחֵי. דְּאָמַר מָר: בְּשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר מֵת, וּבְשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר נוֹלָד מֹשֶׁה, וּמִשִּׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר וְעַד שִׁשָּׁה בְּסִיוָן תְּלָתָא יַרְחֵי. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
sentences.human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says on the sixth of Sivan, you find three months as the Master said died on the seventh of Adar, and Moses was born on the seventh of Adar. And from the seventh of Adar until the sixth of Sivan three months, But according to the one who says on the twenty-first of Nisan, how can you find
sentences.llm_translation: In any case, with regard to one who says in the sixth of Sivan, "The third hour is the time." Said Rabbah: In seven days the dead person dies, and in seven days the living person is born. And from seven days until the sixteenth of Nisan, the third hour is the time. But for one who says in twenty and one of Nisan, what is the significance of this?

sentences.text: אוֹתָהּ שָׁנָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת הָיְתָה: רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן, וְרוּבּוֹ שֶׁל אַחֲרוֹן, וְאֶמְצָעִי שָׁלֵם.
sentences.human_translation: That year was a leap year most of the first and most of the last and the entire middle one.
sentences.llm_translation: That year was replete with controversy: the first one's wheel and the last one's wheel, and the middle one is complete.

sentences.text: ״וַתֹּאמֶר אֲחוֹתוֹ אֶל בַּת פַּרְעֹה הַאֵלֵךְ וְקָרָאתִי לָךְ אִשָּׁה מֵינֶקֶת מִן הָעִבְרִיּוֹת״. וּמַאי שְׁנָא מֵעִבְרִיּוֹת?
sentences.human_translation: “Then said his sister to Pharaoh’s daughter: Shall I go and call you a nurse of the Hebrew women, And what is different of the Hebrew women?
sentences.llm_translation: And her sister said to Pharaoh's daughter, "Go and call for me a wet-nurse from the Hebrew women." And what is the reason that she says "from the Hebrew women"?

sentences.text: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהֶחְזִירוּהוּ לְמֹשֶׁה עַל כׇּל הַמִּצְרִיּוֹת כּוּלָּן, וְלֹא יָנַק, אָמַר: פֶּה שֶׁעָתִיד לְדַבֵּר עִם הַשְּׁכִינָה יִינַק דָּבָר טָמֵא? וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶת מִי יוֹרֶה דֵעָה וְגוֹ׳״. לְמִי יוֹרֶה דֵּעָה וּלְמִי יָבִין שְׁמוּעָה — ״לִגְמוּלֵי מֵחָלָב וּלְעַתִּיקֵי מִשָּׁדַיִם״.
sentences.human_translation: teaches that they took Moses around to all the Egyptian and he did not nurse he said: a mouth that in the future speak with the Divine Presence nurse something impure? And this is as it is written: “Whom shall one teach knowledge? To whom shall teach knowledge and to whom shall make to understand the message “Them that are weaned from the milk, them that are drawn from the breasts”
sentences.llm_translation: Teaches that one who returns him to Moses regarding all the Mitzvot, and does not wean, says: "Shall he who is destined to speak with the Shechinah utter a filthy speech? And behold it is written: 'Who teaches knowledge and...'". To whom teaches knowledge and understands a report - "To the sons of mighty men and old men of the assembly".

sentences.text: ״וַתֹּאמֶר לָהּ בַּת פַּרְעֹה לֵכִי וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָלְכָה בִּזְרִיזוּת כְּעַלְמָה. רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: ״הָעַלְמָה״ — שֶׁהֶעֱלִימָה אֶת דְּבָרֶיהָ.
sentences.human_translation: “And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her: Go. Rabbi Elazar says: teaches that she went quickly like a maiden, Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says: ha’alma for she hid her words
sentences.llm_translation: "He said to her, 'Daughter of Pharaoh, go and...'". Rabbi El'eazar said: He teaches that she went with haste like a young girl. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: "The young girl" - that she had concealed her words.

sentences.text: ״וַתֹּאמֶר לָהּ בַּת פַּרְעֹה הֵילִיכִי אֶת הַיֶּלֶד הַזֶּה״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִתְנַבְּאָה וְאֵינָהּ יוֹדַעַת מָה מִתְנַבְּאָה, ״הֵילִיכִי״ — הָא שֶׁלִּיכִי. ״וַאֲנִי אֶתֵּן אֶת שְׂכָרֵךְ״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לֹא דַּיָּין לַצַּדִּיקִים שֶׁמַּחְזִירִין לָהֶן אֲבֵידָתָן, אֶלָּא שֶׁנּוֹתְנִין לָהֶן שְׂכָרָן.
sentences.human_translation: “And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her: Take this [ heilikhi ] child away, Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: is prophesying and she does not know what she is prophesying, heilikhi This is yours [ ha shellikhi ], “And I will give you your wages.” Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: with regard to righteous people, not only that that their lost items are returned to them, but also that they get their wages,
sentences.llm_translation: She said to her, "Daughter of Pharaoh, take this child." Rabbi Hamuna son of Rabbi Chanina said: It is boasting and she does not know what it is boasting about, "Take this" - this one. "And I will give you your wages." Rabbi Hamuna son of Rabbi Chanina said: It is not given to the righteous who return their losses, but rather we give them their due.

sentences.text: ״וַתִּקַּח מִרְיָם הַנְּבִיאָה אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן וְגוֹ׳״. אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן וְלֹא אֲחוֹת מֹשֶׁה? אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַב: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיְתָה מִתְנַבְּאָה כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן,
sentences.human_translation: “And Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took “the sister of Aaron,” and not the sister of Moses? Rav Amram says Rav says, and some say Rav Naḥman says Rav says: teaches that prophesied when she was the sister of Aaron,
sentences.llm_translation: "And Miriam the prophetess, sister of Aaron, took." Sister of Aaron and not sister of Moses? Said Rav Amram said Rav, and I would say to her, said Rav Nachman said Rav: "Teaches that she prophesied when she was sister of Aaron,"

sentences.text: וְאוֹמֶרֶת: עֲתִידָה אִמִּי שֶׁתֵּלֵד בֵּן שֶׁמּוֹשִׁיעַ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁנּוֹלַד מֹשֶׁה נִתְמַלֵּא כָּל הַבַּיִת כּוּלּוֹ אוֹר. עָמַד אָבִיהָ וּנְשָׁקָהּ עַל רֹאשָׁהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: בִּתִּי, נִתְקַיְּימָה נְבוּאָתִיךְ. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁהִטִּילוּהוּ לַיְאוֹר, עָמַד אָבִיהָ וּטְפָחָהּ עַל רֹאשָׁהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: בִּתִּי הֵיכָן נְבוּאָתִיךְ? וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתֵּתַצַּב אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵרָחוֹק לְדֵעָה מַה יֵּעָשֶׂה לוֹ״ — לֵידַע מָה יְהֵא בְּסוֹף נְבוּאָתָהּ.
sentences.human_translation: And would say: In the future, my mother will give birth to a son who will save the Jewish people. And once Moses was born, the entire house was filled with light. Her father arose and kissed her on her head. He said to her: My daughter, your prophecy has been fulfilled. And once they put him into the river, her father arose and hit her on her head. He said to her: My daughter, where is your prophecy? And this is as it is written: “And his sister stood afar off, to know what would be done to him” to know what will be the ultimate of her prophecy.
sentences.llm_translation: And she says: "My daughter, it will happen that she will give birth to a son who will redeem Israel." And when Moses was born, all the house was filled with light. Her husband stood and blessed her on her head, saying to her: "Daughter, may your prophecy be fulfilled." And when they placed him in the light, her husband stood and blessed her on her head, saying to her: "Daughter, where is your prophecy?" And behold it is written: "And his sister stood at a distance to know what would become of him" - to know what will happen at the end of her prophecy.

sentences.text: יוֹסֵף זָכָה וְכוּ׳. מַאי שְׁנָא מֵעִיקָּרָא דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַל יוֹסֵף לִקְבּוֹר אֶת אָבִיו וַיַּעֲלוּ אִתּוֹ כׇּל עַבְדֵי פַּרְעֹה וְגוֹ׳״, וַהֲדַר: ״וְכֹל בֵּית יוֹסֵף וְאֶחָיו וּבֵית אָבִיו״, וּמַאי שְׁנָא לְבַסּוֹף דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּשׇׁב יוֹסֵף מִצְרַיְמָה הוּא וְאֶחָיו״, וַהֲדַר: ״וְכׇל הָעוֹלִים אִתּוֹ לִקְבּוֹר אֶת אָבִיו״?
sentences.human_translation: Joseph merited What is different initially that it is written: “And Joseph went up to bury his father; and with him went up all the servants of Pharaoh, and afterward “And all the house of Joseph, and his brethren, and his father’s house; And what is different at the end that it is written: “And Joseph returned into Egypt, he, and his brethren,” and afterward “And all that went up with him to bury his father,
sentences.llm_translation: Yosef has merit and so on. What is the matter that it is written: "And Yosef arose to bury his father, and all the servants of Par'oh went up with him and so on"? And further: "All the house of Yosef and his brothers and the house of his father"? And what is the matter that it is written: "And Yosef rose from Egypt, he and his brothers"? And further: "And all the souls that were with him to bury his father"?

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בַּתְּחִילָּה עַד שֶׁלֹּא רָאוּ בִּכְבוֹדָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל — לֹא נָהֲגוּ בָּהֶן כָּבוֹד, וּלְבַסּוֹף שֶׁרָאוּ בִּכְבוֹדָן — נָהֲגוּ בָּהֶן כָּבוֹד.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Initially, before saw the honor of the Jewish people, they did not treat them honor, And in the end, when they saw their honor, they treated honor.
sentences.llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yohanan: From the beginning until they did not see the glory of Israel - they did not behave with glory, and at the end when they saw the glory of Israel - they behaved with glory.

sentences.text: דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּבֹאוּ עַד גּוֹרֶן הָאָטָד״, וְכִי גוֹרֶן יֵשׁ לוֹ לָאָטָד? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִקִּיפוּהוּ כְּתָרִים לַאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב כְּגוֹרֶן זֶה שֶׁמַּקִּיפִים לוֹ אָטָד, שֶׁבָּאוּ בְּנֵי עֵשָׂו וּבְנֵי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וּבְנֵי קְטוּרָה.
sentences.human_translation: As it is written: “And they came to the threshing floor of Atad, And does a boxthorn have a threshing floor? Rabbi Abbahu says: teaches that they surrounded the casket of Jacob with crowns, like this threshing floor that is surrounded with boxthorns, because the children of Esau and the children of Ishmael and the children of Keturah came
sentences.llm_translation: It is written: "And they came unto the oak of Zarephath", and why is it called the oak of Zarephath? Rabbi Abahu said: It teaches that they wrapped him in wreaths for the aron (ark) of Jacob, just as this oak has a vineyard, which the sons of Esau, the sons of Ishmael, and the sons of Keturah entered.

sentences.text: תָּנָא: כּוּלָּם לַמִּלְחָמָה בָּאוּ, כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאוּ כִּתְרוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף תָּלוּי בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב, נָטְלוּ כּוּלָּן כִּתְרֵיהֶן וּתְלָאוּם בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב. תָּנָא: שְׁלֹשִׁים וְשִׁשָּׁה כְּתָרִים נִתְלוּ בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב.
sentences.human_translation: taught: they all came to war once they saw the crown of Joseph, hanging on the casket of Jacob, they all took their crowns and hung them on the casket of Jacob. taught: Thirty-six crowns were hung on the casket of Jacob.
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: Teama: Kolam lamilchah ba'u, keivan shera'u kitoro shel Yosef tali b'arono shel Yaakov, natlu kolam kitorayhem utla'am ba'arono shel Yaakov. Teama: Shloshim v'shisha k'tarim nitlu ba'arono shel Yaakov. English translation: Teama: All of them came to war, when they saw the coat of Joseph hanging in the pillar of Jacob, they took all their coats and hung them in the pillar of Jacob. Teama: Thirty-six coats were hung in the pillar of Jacob.

sentences.text: ״וַיִּסְפְּדוּ שָׁם מִסְפֵּד גָּדוֹל וְכָבֵד מְאֹד״. תָּנָא: אֲפִילּוּ סוּסִים וַאֲפִילּוּ חֲמוֹרִים.
sentences.human_translation: “And there they wailed with a very great and sore wailing” taught: Even horses and even donkeys
sentences.llm_translation: "And they lamented there a great and mighty lamentation". Tanna: "Even mules and even donkeys".

sentences.text: (מֵאֵילּוּ מֵאֵילּוּ) כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעוּ לִמְעָרַת הַמַּכְפֵּלָה, אֲתָא עֵשָׂו קָא מְעַכֵּב, אָמַר לָהֶן: ״מַמְרֵא קִרְיַת הָאַרְבַּע הִיא חֶבְרוֹן״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: קִרְיַת אַרְבַּע — אַרְבַּע זוּגוֹת הָיוּ: אָדָם וְחַוָּה, אַבְרָהָם וְשָׂרָה, יִצְחָק וְרִבְקָה, יַעֲקֹב וְלֵאָה. אִיהוּ קַבְרַהּ לְלֵאָה בְּדִידֵיהּ, וְהַאי דְּפָיֵישׁ — דִּידִי הוּא.
sentences.human_translation: Once they reached the Cave of Machpelah, Esau came and was preventing them He said to them: Mamre, to Kiryat Arba, the same is Hebron, And Rabbi Yitzḥak says: Kiryat Arba were four couples Adam and Eve, Abraham and Sarah, Isaac and Rebecca, Jacob and Leah. buried Leah in his and the that is remaining is mine.
sentences.llm_translation: (From where do we learn that?) When they reached the depth of the well, Esau came and said to them: "This is the city of the four - it is a bond", and Rabbi Yitzchak said: The city of four refers to four pairs: Adam and Chava, Abraham and Sarah, Isaac and Rivka, Jacob and Leah. He buried Leah in his tomb, and this one (Leah) is my own.

sentences.text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: זַבֵּינְתֵּהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: נְהִי דְּזַבֵּינִי בְּכֵירוּתָא, פְּשִׁיטוּתָא מִי זַבֵּינִי? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּקִבְרִי אֲשֶׁר כָּרִיתִי לִי״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק: אֵין ״כִּירָה״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן מְכִירָה, שֶׁכֵּן בִּכְרַכֵּי הַיָּם קוֹרִין לִמְכִירָה ״כִּירָה״.
sentences.human_translation: said to You sold to said to them: Though I sold the birthright, did I sell an ordinary said to him: Yes, as it is written in my grave that I have dug [ kariti ] for me And Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: kira is nothing other a term of a sale [ mekhira ] because in the cities overseas they call a sale kira .
sentences.llm_translation: They said to him: You have sinned. He said to them: I will be in the merit of my father's good deeds, who is it that has sinned? They said to him: None, as it is written: "In my grave which I have dug for myself" Isaiah 22:16. And Rabbi Yohanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotsadak: There is no "merit" except for the language of sale, therefore in the markets of the sea they call it "merit".

sentences.text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַבוּ לִי אִיגַּרְתָּא! אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִיגַּרְתָּא בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם הִיא. וּמַאן נֵיזִיל — נֵיזִיל נַפְתָּלִי דְּקַלִּיל כִּי אַיָּילְתָּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״נַפְתָּלִי אַיָּלָה שְׁלוּחָה הַנּוֹתֵן אִמְרֵי שָׁפֶר״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״אִמְרֵי שָׁפֶר״, אֶלָּא ״אִמְרֵי סֵפֶר״.
sentences.human_translation: said to them: Bring the bill to me, They said to him: The bill is in the land of Egypt. And who will go Naphtali will go, for he is as fast as a doe, as it is written: “Naphtali is a doe let loose, he gives goodly words” Rabbi Abbahu says: Do not read goodly words [ imrei shafer ]”; rather, imrei sefer ,
sentences.llm_translation: He said to them: Give me a document! They said to him: The document is in the land of Egypt. And who will nullify? Nullify, I will nullify, because it is written: "Nullify, a gazelle that gives forth sweet words." Rabbi Abahu said: Do not say "sweet words," but rather "words of the book".

sentences.text: חוּשִׁים בְּרֵיהּ דְּדָן תַּמָּן הֲוָה, וְיַקִּירָן לֵיהּ אוּדְנֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאי הַאי? וְאָמְרוּ לֵיהּ: קָא מְעַכֵּב הַאי עַד דְּאָתֵי נַפְתָּלִי מֵאַרְעָא דְּמִצְרַיִם. אֲמַר לְהוּ: וְעַד דְּאָתֵי נַפְתָּלִי מֵאַרְעָא דְּמִצְרַיִם, יְהֵא אֲבִי אַבָּא מוּטָל בְּבִזָּיוֹן? שְׁקַל קוּלְפָא מַחְיֵיהּ אַרֵישֵׁיהּ, נָתְרָן עֵינֵיהּ וּנְפַלוּ אַכַּרְעָא דְיַעֲקֹב, פַּתְחִינְהוּ יַעֲקֹב לְעֵינֵיהּ וְאַחֵיךְ. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״יִשְׂמַח צַדִּיק כִּי חָזָה נָקָם פְּעָמָיו יִרְחַץ בְּדַם הָרָשָׁע״.
sentences.human_translation: Hushim, the son of Dan, was there and his ears were heavy, He said to them: What this And they said to him: This one, is preventing until Naphtali comes from the land of Egypt He said to them: And until Naphtali comes from the land of Egypt will father’s father lie in degradation? He took a club [ kulepa ] and hit on the head, eyes fell out and they fell on the legs of Jacob. Jacob opened his eyes and smiled. And this is that which is written: “The righteous shall rejoice when he sees the vengeance; he shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked”
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Dan was sitting in Tamnus, and his friend Yaqirah was sitting with him. He said to them: What is this? And they said to him: This one is delaying until my nephew from the land of Egypt has arrived. He said to them: Until my nephew from the land of Egypt has arrived, will my father-in-law be buried in his burial garments? Weigh the scales of his coffin, and let it fall upon the neck of Jacob, open it for him and his brother. And behold, it is written: "The righteous shall rejoice when he sees vengeance done to the wicked; he shall wash his hands in the blood of the wicked."

sentences.text: בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִתְקַיְּימָה נְבוּאָתָהּ שֶׁל רִבְקָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״לָמָּה אֶשְׁכַּל גַּם שְׁנֵיכֶם יוֹם אֶחָד״. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּמִיתָתָן לֹא בְּיוֹם אֶחָד הֲוַאי — קְבוּרָתָן מִיהָא בְּיוֹם אֶחָד הֲוַאי.
sentences.human_translation: At that moment the prophecy of Rebecca was fulfilled, as it is written “Why should I be bereaved of you both in one day?” And although their deaths were not on the same day, in any event their burials were on the same day,
sentences.llm_translation: At that time, the prophecy of Rebekah was fulfilled, as it is written: "Why should I deprive even one of you a day?" And even though they died on the same day, it was not on the same day that their burial was performed.

sentences.text: וְאִי לָא [אִי]עֲסַק בֵּיהּ יוֹסֵף, אֶחָיו לָא הֲווֹ מִעַסְּקִי בֵּיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׂאוּ אוֹתוֹ בָנָיו אַרְצָה כְּנַעַן״? אָמְרוּ: הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ, כְּבוֹדוֹ בִּמְלָכִים יוֹתֵר מִבְּהֶדְיוֹטוֹת.
sentences.human_translation: And if Joseph would not have dealt with would his brothers not have dealt with it? But isn’t it written: “For his sons carried him into the land of Canaan, They said: Allow more honor by royalty than by common [ hedyotot ].
sentences.llm_translation: And if not if Joseph was occupied with him, his brothers were not occupied with him? And it is written: "And they took him and cast him into a pit in the land of Canaan"? They said: Let him be, for his honor is greater than that of kings.

sentences.text: מִי לָנוּ גָּדוֹל מִיּוֹסֵף כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בֹּא וּרְאֵה כַּמָּה חֲבִיבוֹת מִצְוֹת עַל מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, שֶׁכׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל כּוּלָּן נִתְעַסְּקוּ בַּבִּיזָּה, וְהוּא נִתְעַסֵּק בְּמִצְוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חֲכַם לֵב יִקַּח מִצְוֹת וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: Who, to us, a greater than Joseph, The Sages taught Come and see how beloved mitzvot are to Moses our teacher. As, all the Jewish people were involved in the plunder and he was involved in mitzvot, as it is stated: “The wise in heart will take mitzvot”
sentences.llm_translation: Who is great to us, like Joseph? The rabbis taught: Come and see how many commandments are dear to Moses our teacher, for all of Israel were occupied with indulgence, and he was occupied with commandments, as it is said: "A wise heart will take commandments."

sentences.text: וּמִנַּיִן הָיָה יוֹדֵעַ מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ הֵיכָן יוֹסֵף קָבוּר? אָמְרוּ: סֶרַח בַּת אָשֵׁר נִשְׁתַּיְּירָה מֵאוֹתוֹ הַדּוֹר. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה אֶצְלָהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: כְּלוּם אַתְּ יוֹדַעַת הֵיכָן יוֹסֵף קָבוּר? אָמְרָה לוֹ: אָרוֹן שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת עָשׂוּ לוֹ מִצְרִים וּקְבָעוּהוּ בְּנִילוּס הַנָּהָר, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּתְבָּרְכוּ מֵימָיו. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה וְעָמַד עַל שְׂפַת נִילוּס, אָמַר לוֹ: יוֹסֵף יוֹסֵף! הִגִּיעַ הָעֵת שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּע הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁאֲנִי גּוֹאֵל אֶתְכֶם, וְהִגִּיעָה הַשְּׁבוּעָה שֶׁהִשְׁבַּעְתָּ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. אִם אַתָּה מַרְאֶה עַצְמְךָ מוּטָב, אִם לָאו — הֲרֵי אָנוּ מְנוּקִּין מִשְּׁבוּעָתֶךָ. מִיָּד צָף אֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף.
sentences.human_translation: And from where did Moses our teacher know where Joseph was buried? said: Serah, the daughter of Asher, remained from that generation Moses went to her said to her: Do you know anything where Joseph is buried? She said to him: The Egyptians fashioned a metal casket for him and set it in the Nile [ Nilus ] River so that its water would be blessed. Moses went and stood on the bank of the Nile. said to Joseph, Joseph, the time has arrived which the Holy One, Blessed be He, took an oath that I, will redeem you. And the oath that you administered to the Jewish people has arrived. If you show yourself, good, if not, we are clear from your oath. Immediately, the casket of Joseph floated
sentences.llm_translation: And from where did Moses our teacher know where Joseph was buried? They said: "The coffin of Asher was hidden away for a hundred years. Moses went to her, and said to her: 'Do you know where Joseph is buried?' She said to him: 'The Egyptians made an ark for him and placed it in the Nile River, so that his days would be blessed.' Moses went and stood on the bank of the Nile, and said to him: 'Joseph, Joseph! The time has come when the Holy One, Blessed be He, swore that I would redeem you, and the oath that you swore with Israel has arrived. If you see fit in your eyes, if not - we are absolving ourselves from your oath.' And immediately the coffin of Joseph arose."

sentences.text: וְאַל תִּתְמַהּ הֵיאַךְ בַּרְזֶל צָף, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּתִיב: ״וַיְהִי הָאֶחָד מַפִּיל הַקּוֹרָה וְאֶת הַבַּרְזֶל נָפַל אֶל הַמָּיִם וְגוֹ׳ אֲהָהּ אֲדוֹנִי וְהוּא שָׁאוּל. וַיֹּאמֶר אִישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים אָנָה נָפָל וַיַּרְאֵהוּ אֶת הַמָּקוֹם וַיִּקְצׇב עֵץ וַיַּשְׁלֶךְ שָׁמָּה וַיָּצֶף הַבַּרְזֶל״. וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה אֱלִישָׁע תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל אֵלִיָּהוּ, וְאֵלִיָּהוּ תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה — צָף בַּרְזֶל מִפָּנָיו, מִפְּנֵי מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
sentences.human_translation: And do not wonder how iron float, as it is written “But as one was felling a beam, the ax head fell into the water; Alas, my master! For it was borrowed. And the man of God said: Where did it fall? And he showed him the place. And he cut down a stick, and cast it in there, and the iron floated up” And are matters not a fortiori : And just as Elisha, student of Elijah, and Elijah student of Moses, iron float before him, all the more so before Moses our teacher
sentences.llm_translation: And do not wonder about the iron that sank, since it is written: "And one of the men fell from a height and the iron sank into the water and so on." And behold, my Master said to me: "Where did it sink and I saw the place and planted an olive tree there and the iron sank beneath it." And are not matters simple and straightforward? What is Elijah's student, who is Moses' student - the iron sinks from his presence, from Moses our teacher's presence - on one side and on the other.

sentences.text: רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: בְּקַבַּרְנִיט שֶׁל מְלָכִים הָיָה קָבוּר. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה וְעָמַד עַל קַבַּרְנִיט שֶׁל מְלָכִים, אָמַר: יוֹסֵף, הִגִּיעַ עֵת שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּע הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁאֲנִי גּוֹאֵל אֶתְכֶם, וְהִגִּיעָה שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁהִשְׁבַּעְתָּ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. אִם אַתָּה מַרְאֶה עַצְמְךָ — מוּטָב, וְאִם לָאו — הֲרֵי אָנוּ מְנוּקִּין מִשְּׁבוּעָתֶךָ. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִזְדַּעְזַע אֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף, נְטָלוֹ מֹשֶׁה, וֶהֱבִיאוֹ אֶצְלוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Natan says: was buried in the crypt [ kabbarnit ] of kings. Moses went and stood by the crypt of kings said: Joseph, the time has arrived which the Holy One, Blessed be He, took an oath that: I will redeem you. And the oath that you administered to the Jewish people has arrived. If you show yourself, good, but if not, we are clear from your oath. At that moment, the casket of Joseph shook Moses took it and brought it to himself.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Nathan says: In the sepulcher of kings it was buried. Moses went and stood on the sepulcher of kings, said: Joseph, the time has arrived when the Holy One, blessed be He, swore that I would redeem you, and an oath was sworn by Israel. If you see your face - good, and if not - behold we are releasing from your oath. At that moment the horn of Joseph was shattered, Moses took it away from him, and brought it to him.

sentences.text: וְכׇל אוֹתָן שָׁנִים שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר, הָיוּ שְׁנֵי אֲרוֹנוֹת הַלָּלוּ, אֶחָד שֶׁל מֵת וְאֶחָד שֶׁל שְׁכִינָה, מְהַלְּכִין זֶה עִם זֶה, וְהָיוּ עוֹבְרִין וְשָׁבִין אוֹמְרִים: מָה טִיבָן שֶׁל שְׁנֵי אֲרוֹנוֹת הַלָּלוּ? אָמְרוּ: אֶחָד שֶׁל מֵת וְאֶחָד שֶׁל שְׁכִינָה. וְכִי מָה דַּרְכּוֹ שֶׁל מֵת לְהַלֵּךְ עִם שְׁכִינָה? אָמְרוּ:
sentences.human_translation: And all those years that the Jewish people were in the wilderness, these two arks, one of a dead man, and one of the Divine Presence, were traveling together, and passersby would say: What is the nature of these two arks? They said One of a dead person and one of the Divine Presence. And what the manner of a dead person to travel with the Divine Presence? They said
sentences.llm_translation: And all those years that Israel were in the wilderness, there were two cedars of Lebanon, one of death and one of Shechinah, walking together, and they would pass by and return saying: What is the nature of these two cedars of Lebanon? They said: One of death and one of Shechinah. And why does the path of death walk with Shechinah? They said: (

text: אֶלָּא ״וַיַּקְרִיא״. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִקְרִיא אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ לִשְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּפֶה כׇּל עוֹבֵר וָשָׁב. כֵּיצַד? לְאַחַר שֶׁאָכְלוּ וְשָׁתוּ, עָמְדוּ לְבָרְכוֹ. אָמַר לָהֶם: וְכִי מִשֶּׁלִּי אֲכַלְתֶּם? מִשֶּׁל אֱלֹהֵי עוֹלָם אֲכַלְתֶּם! הוֹדוּ וְשַׁבְּחוּ וּבָרְכוּ לְמִי שֶׁאָמַר וְהָיָה הָעוֹלָם.
״וַיִּרְאֶהָ יְהוּדָה וַיַּחְשְׁבֶהָ לְזוֹנָה כִּי כִסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ״. מִשּׁוּם דְּכִסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ, חַשְּׁבַהּ לְזוֹנָה?!

אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שֶׁכִּסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: כׇּל כַּלָּה שֶׁהִיא צְנוּעָה בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ — זוֹכָה וְיוֹצְאִין מִמֶּנָּה מְלָכִים וּנְבִיאִים. מְנָלַן — מִתָּמָר. נְבִיאִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״חֲזוֹן יְשַׁעְיָהוּ בֶן אָמוֹץ״. מְלָכִים — מִדָּוִד. וְאָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: דָּבָר זֶה מָסוֹרֶת בְּיָדֵינוּ מֵאֲבוֹתֵינוּ: אָמוֹץ וַאֲמַצְיָה — אַחִים הֲווֹ.
״הִיא מוּצֵאת״. ״הִיא מִיתּוֹצֵאת״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ סִימָנֶיהָ בָּא סַמָּאֵל וְרִיחֲקָן, בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וְקֵירְבָן.

הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״לִמְנַצֵּחַ עַל יוֹנַת אֵלֶם רְחוֹקִים לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנִּתְרַחֲקוּ סִימָנֶיהָ נַעֲשֵׂית כְּיוֹנָה אִילֶּמֶת. ״לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם״: שֶׁיָּצָא מִמֶּנָּה דָּוִד, שֶׁהָיָה מָךְ וְתָם לַכֹּל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מִכְתָּם״ — שֶׁהָיְתָה מַכָּתוֹ תַּמָּה, שֶׁנּוֹלַד כְּשֶׁהוּא מָהוּל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מִכְתָּם״ — כְּשֵׁם שֶׁבְּקַטְנוּתוֹ הִקְטִין עַצְמוֹ אֵצֶל מִי שֶׁגָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה, כָּךְ בִּגְדוּלָּתוֹ.

״וְהִיא שָׁלְחָה אֶל חָמִיהָ לֵאמֹר לְאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר אֵלֶּה לּוֹ אָנֹכִי הָרָה״. וְתֵימָא לֵיהּ מֵימָר! אָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא, וְאָמְרִי לָהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: נוֹחַ לוֹ לָאָדָם שֶׁיַּפִּיל עַצְמוֹ לְתוֹךְ כִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ, וְאַל יַלְבִּין פְּנֵי חֲבֵירוֹ בָּרַבִּים. מְנָלַן — מִתָּמָר.

״הַכֶּר נָא״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישֵּׂר לְאָבִיו — בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ. בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישֵּׂר: ״הַכֶּר נָא הַכְּתֹנֶת בִּנְךָ הִיא״. בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ: ״הַכֶּר נָא לְמִי״.
״נָא״. אֵין ״נָא״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן בַּקָּשָׁה. אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: בְּבַקָּשָׁה מִמְּךָ, הַכֵּר פְּנֵי בּוֹרַאֲךָ וְאַל תַּעֲלִים עֵינֶיךָ מִמֶּנִּי.

״וַיַּכֵּר יְהוּדָה וַיֹּאמֶר צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַב חָנִין בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא: יוֹסֵף שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בַּסֵּתֶר — זָכָה וְהוֹסִיפוּ לוֹ אוֹת אַחַת מִשְּׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״עֵדוּת בִּיהוֹסֵף שָׂמוֹ״.

אַבְשָׁלוֹם נִתְגָּאָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַבְשָׁלוֹם בִּשְׂעָרוֹ מָרַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּכְאַבְשָׁלוֹם לֹא הָיָה אִישׁ יָפֶה וְגוֹ׳. וּבְגַלְּחוֹ אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ וְהָיָה מִקֵּץ יָמִים לַיָּמִים אֲשֶׁר יְגַלֵּחַ כִּי כָבֵד עָלָיו וְגִלְּחוֹ וְשָׁקַל אֶת שְׂעַר רֹאשׁוֹ מָאתַיִם שְׁקָלִים בְּאֶבֶן הַמֶּלֶךְ״. תָּנָא: אֶבֶן שֶׁאַנְשֵׁי טְבֶרְיָא וְאַנְשֵׁי צִיפּוֹרִי שׁוֹקְלִים בָּהּ.

לְפִיכָךְ נִתְלָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקְרָא אַבְשָׁלוֹם לִפְנֵי עַבְדֵי דָוִד וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם רֹכֵב עַל הַפֶּרֶד וַיָּבֹא הַפֶּרֶד תַּחַת שׂוֹבֶךְ הָאֵלָה הַגְּדוֹלָה וַיֶּחֱזַק רֹאשׁוֹ בָאֵלָה וַיֻּתַּן בֵּין הַשָּׁמַיִם וּבֵין הָאָרֶץ וְהַפֶּרֶד אֲשֶׁר תַּחְתָּיו עָבָר״. שְׁקַל סַפְסִירָא בְּעָא לְמִיפְסְקֵיהּ. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִבְקַע שְׁאוֹל מִתַּחְתָּיו.

״וַיִּרְגַּז הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיַּעַל עַל עֲלִיַּית הַשַּׁעַר וַיֵּבְךְּ וְכֹה אָמַר בְּלֶכְתּוֹ בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם מִי יִתֵּן מוּתִי אֲנִי תַחְתֶּיךָ אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי. וְהַמֶּלֶךְ לָאַט אֶת פָּנָיו וַיִּזְעַק הַמֶּלֶךְ קוֹל גָּדוֹל בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי״. הָנֵי תְּמָנְיָא ״בְּנִי״ לְמָה? שִׁבְעָה דְּאַסְּקֵיהּ מִשִּׁבְעָה מְדוֹרֵי גֵיהִנָּם, וְאִידַּךְ, אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּקָרֵיב רֵישֵׁיהּ לְגַבֵּי גוּפֵיהּ, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּאַיְיתֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי.

״וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם לָקַח וַיַּצֶּב לוֹ בְחַיָּיו״. מַאי ״לָקַח״? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: שֶׁלָּקַח מִקָּח רַע לְעַצְמוֹ. ״אֶת מַצֶּבֶת אֲשֶׁר בְּעֵמֶק הַמֶּלֶךְ וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא: בְּעֵצָה עֲמוּקָּה שֶׁל מַלְכּוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם,
llm_translation: To what may be likened this? It is written "And He read" (Deuteronomy 26:5). Teaches that Abraham our father read the name of the Holy One, blessed be He, in every place he passed and returned. How so? After they ate and drank, they stood to bless Him. He said to them: And since it is from Me that you have eaten? You have eaten from the God of the universe! Praise, glorify, and bless whoever said and caused the world to be.
And Judah saw her and thought to make her a harlot because she had covered her face. Because she had covered her face, did he think to make her a harlot?!

Rabbi Elazar said: When she has turned her face towards her father's house. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: Any woman who is modest in her father's house - she is worthy and they send from her kings and prophets. Menalan - from Tamar. Prophets - as it is written: "The vision of Isaiah, son of Amot." Kings - from David. And Rabbi Levi said: This matter is a tradition in our hands from our fathers: Amot and Amatziah - brothers they were.
"He is sought." "He is being sought" - from where? Rabbi Elazar said: After we found the signs in it, an angel came and drew near, Gabriel came and approached.

The Gemara states: "According to what is written: 'To the end, upon the harp of ten strings, David.'", Rabbi Yohanan said: When the signs of prophecy were removed from him, he became like a dove that has flown away. "To David, according to the writing": This refers to David who went out from there, and it was as if he had died and been buried for all eternity. Another matter: "According to the writing" - this was his punishment, which was complete, since he was born in a state of being hounded. Another matter: "According to the writing" - just as in his smallness he diminished himself alongside someone greater than him to learn Torah, so too in his greatness.

"And she sent to her mother-in-law, saying to the man whose wife this is, 'I am pregnant.' And she said to him, 'Tell it!' Said Rabbi Zutra bar Tovia, and I said to him, 'Said Rabbi Chanina bar Bizna, and I said to him, 'Said Rabbi Shimon Chasida, and I said to him, 'Said Rabbi Yochanan on behalf of Rabbi Shimon ben Yohei: No one should place himself in the midst of a fiery furnace, lest he burn his face before his fellow great ones. M'nalan — from Tammar."

"He shall know." He said, Rabbi Hamuna son of Rabbi Chanina: "In 'He shall know' Deuteronomy 1:3, it is written to his father - in 'He shall know' Deuteronomy 1:5, they wrote him. In 'He shall know', it is written: 'He shall know now, the cloak of your son is this.' In 'He shall know' they wrote him: 'He shall know now, for whom?'
"Na'". There is no "na'" except for a request. He said to him: In a request from you, know the face of your Creator and do not lift up your eyes from me.

"And Judah knew and said, 'Righteousness is from me.'" 1 Now, what did Rav Chanina bar Bizna say that Rabbi Shimon Chasida said? "Joseph who consecrated the name of Heaven in secret" - he was justified and they added to him one letter from the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is written: "Testimony is from Joseph, he has made him a witness." 2

Yehudah, who sanctified the name of Heaven in a parshya, has earned and been called up for his name's sake by the Holy One, blessed be He. When Yehudah said, "Vindicate me from mine enemy," a voice went forth and said: You have saved Tamar and her two sons from the fiery furnace - your life that I am saving in your merit, three of your children from the fiery furnace. Who are these? Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah.
"Righteousness is from me." What did he know? A daughter of the voice went out and said: "From me shall go forth the bound ones." (

And he shall not cease to know. Said Shmuel Saba, a student of Rav Shmuel bar Ami, in the name of his teacher Rav Shmuel bar Ami: When he knows - he does not desist from it. As it is written here: "And he shall not cease to know", and as it is written there: "A great voice and he shall not cease". (

Abishalom was proud of his hair and so on. The rabbis taught: Abishalom was proud of his hair, as it is said: "And there was no man so renowned as Abishalom in all the land" (2 Samuel 14:25). And when he shaved his head and it became long after many days that he would shave, because it weighed heavily upon him and he shaved and weighed the weight of his head at two hundred shekels by the king's stone. A Tanna taught: The stone on which men of Teverya and men of Ziphori weigh.

Therefore, it was suspended in his hair, as it is said: "And Absalom rode on the mule, and the mule went under the thick thorn bush beneath him; and his head caught hold of the treetop, and he was left hanging between heaven and earth, while the mule that was under him walked on." (2 Samuel 18:8). Consider the words of Rav Yishmael: At that very moment, Sheol burst open from underneath.

וַיִּרְגַּז הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיַּעַל עַל עֲלִיַּית הַשַּׁעַר וַיֵּבְךְּ וְכֹה אָמַר בְּלֶכְתּוֹ בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם מִי יִתֵּן מוּתִי אֲנִי תַחְתֶּיךָ אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי. וְהַמֶּלֶךְ לָאַט אֶת פָּנָיו וַיִּזְעַק הַמֶּלֶךְ קוֹל גָּדוֹל בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי. הָנֵי תְּמָנְיָא "בְּנִי" לְמָה? שִׁבְעָה דְּאַסְּקֵיהּ מִשִּׁבְעָה מְדוֹרֵי גֵיהִנָּם, וְאִידַּךְ, אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּקָרֵיב רֵישֵׁיהּ לְגַבֵּי גוּפֵיהּ, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּאַיְיתֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי. English translation: And the king was enraged and ascended to the upper gate and wept, and he said when he came in: "My son Absalom! My son Absalom! Who will give me to die? I am beneath your feet, my son Absalom! My son Absalom! And the king covered his face and a great cry was heard from the king: "My son Absalom! My son Absalom! My son Absalom!" And these are the words of the Tanna: "Why is it written 'my son' seven times? Because seven matters were asked of him in the seven heavens, and I say: It is fitting for his head to be covered before his body, and I say: He was given to the world that is not yet."

And Abishalom took and set for himself in his lifetime. What is "took"? Said Reish Lakish: He took a bad deal for himself. "As the setting of the tabernacle which is in the valley of the king and so on", said Rabbi Chanina bar Pappi: A deep counsel of the King of the World, (

sentences.text: אֶלָּא ״וַיַּקְרִיא״. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִקְרִיא אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ לִשְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּפֶה כׇּל עוֹבֵר וָשָׁב. כֵּיצַד? לְאַחַר שֶׁאָכְלוּ וְשָׁתוּ, עָמְדוּ לְבָרְכוֹ. אָמַר לָהֶם: וְכִי מִשֶּׁלִּי אֲכַלְתֶּם? מִשֶּׁל אֱלֹהֵי עוֹלָם אֲכַלְתֶּם! הוֹדוּ וְשַׁבְּחוּ וּבָרְכוּ לְמִי שֶׁאָמַר וְהָיָה הָעוֹלָם.
sentences.human_translation: rather vayyakri , and he caused to call. teaches that Abraham our forefather caused the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, to be called in the mouth of all passersby. How so? After ate and drank, they arose to bless him. He said to them: But did you eat from mine? you ate from the God of the world. you thank and praise and bless the One Who spoke and the world was

sentences.text: ״וַיִּרְאֶהָ יְהוּדָה וַיַּחְשְׁבֶהָ לְזוֹנָה כִּי כִסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ״. מִשּׁוּם דְּכִסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ, חַשְּׁבַהּ לְזוֹנָה?!
sentences.human_translation: “When Judah saw her, he thought her to be a prostitute, for she had covered her face” Because she had covered her face he thought her to be a prostitute?
sentences.llm_translation: And Judah saw her and thought to make her a harlot because she had covered her face. Because she had covered her face, did he think to make her a harlot?!

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שֶׁכִּסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: כׇּל כַּלָּה שֶׁהִיא צְנוּעָה בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ — זוֹכָה וְיוֹצְאִין מִמֶּנָּה מְלָכִים וּנְבִיאִים. מְנָלַן — מִתָּמָר. נְבִיאִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״חֲזוֹן יְשַׁעְיָהוּ בֶן אָמוֹץ״. מְלָכִים — מִדָּוִד. וְאָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: דָּבָר זֶה מָסוֹרֶת בְּיָדֵינוּ מֵאֲבוֹתֵינוּ: אָמוֹץ וַאֲמַצְיָה — אַחִים הֲווֹ.

From where do we From Tamar. Prophets as it is written: “The vision of Isaiah, the son of Amoz” Kings from David. And Rabbi Levi says: This matter is a tradition we from our ancestors: Amoz, and Amaziah, were brothers.

sentences.text: ״הִיא מוּצֵאת״. ״הִיא מִיתּוֹצֵאת״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ סִימָנֶיהָ בָּא סַמָּאֵל וְרִיחֲקָן, בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וְקֵירְבָן.
