sentences.text: הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״לִמְנַצֵּחַ עַל יוֹנַת אֵלֶם רְחוֹקִים לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנִּתְרַחֲקוּ סִימָנֶיהָ נַעֲשֵׂית כְּיוֹנָה אִילֶּמֶת. ״לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם״: שֶׁיָּצָא מִמֶּנָּה דָּוִד, שֶׁהָיָה מָךְ וְתָם לַכֹּל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מִכְתָּם״ — שֶׁהָיְתָה מַכָּתוֹ תַּמָּה, שֶׁנּוֹלַד כְּשֶׁהוּא מָהוּל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מִכְתָּם״ — כְּשֵׁם שֶׁבְּקַטְנוּתוֹ הִקְטִין עַצְמוֹ אֵצֶל מִי שֶׁגָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה, כָּךְ בִּגְדוּלָּתוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: This is as it is written: “For the leader, upon yonat eilem reḥokim , a psalm [ mikhtam ] of David” Rabbi Yoḥanan says From the moment that her signs were distanced [ reḥokim ], she became like a mute dove [ yona illemet ]. “a psalm [ mikhtam ] of David” from whom David emerged, as he was modest [ makh ] and flawless [ tam ] with everyone. Alternatively, mikhtam that makkato , was complete [ tama ], that was born circumcised. Alternatively, mikhtam just as in his youth made himself small in front of one who was greater than him to learn Torah so too, when he became great
sentences.llm_translation: The Gemara states: "According to what is written: 'To the end, upon the harp of ten strings, David.'", Rabbi Yohanan said: When the signs of prophecy were removed from him, he became like a dove that has flown away. "To David, according to the writing": This refers to David who went out from there, and it was as if he had died and been buried for all eternity. Another matter: "According to the writing" - this was his punishment, which was complete, since he was born in a state of being hounded. Another matter: "According to the writing" - just as in his smallness he diminished himself alongside someone greater than him to learn Torah, so too in his greatness.

sentences.text: ״וְהִיא שָׁלְחָה אֶל חָמִיהָ לֵאמֹר לְאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר אֵלֶּה לּוֹ אָנֹכִי הָרָה״. וְתֵימָא לֵיהּ מֵימָר! אָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא, וְאָמְרִי לָהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: נוֹחַ לוֹ לָאָדָם שֶׁיַּפִּיל עַצְמוֹ לְתוֹךְ כִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ, וְאַל יַלְבִּין פְּנֵי חֲבֵירוֹ בָּרַבִּים. מְנָלַן — מִתָּמָר.
sentences.human_translation: “She sent to her father-in-law, saying: By the man whose these are, am I with child” And let her say to him Rav Zutra bar Tuviyya says Rav says, and some say Rav Ḥana bar Bizna says Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida says, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: It is more amenable for a person to throw himself into a fiery furnace and not humiliate another in public. From where do we From Tamar,
sentences.llm_translation: "And she sent to her mother-in-law, saying to the man whose wife this is, 'I am pregnant.' And she said to him, 'Tell it!' Said Rabbi Zutra bar Tovia, and I said to him, 'Said Rabbi Chanina bar Bizna, and I said to him, 'Said Rabbi Shimon Chasida, and I said to him, 'Said Rabbi Yochanan on behalf of Rabbi Shimon ben Yohei: No one should place himself in the midst of a fiery furnace, lest he burn his face before his fellow great ones. M'nalan — from Tammar."

sentences.text: ״הַכֶּר נָא״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישֵּׂר לְאָבִיו — בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ. בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישֵּׂר: ״הַכֶּר נָא הַכְּתֹנֶת בִּנְךָ הִיא״. בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ: ״הַכֶּר נָא לְמִי״.
sentences.human_translation: Discern, please, Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: With discern informed his father with discern they informed With discern he informed Discern now whether it is your son’s coat With discern they informed him: Discern, please, whose are
sentences.llm_translation: "He shall know." He said, Rabbi Hamuna son of Rabbi Chanina: "In 'He shall know' Deuteronomy 1:3, it is written to his father - in 'He shall know' Deuteronomy 1:5, they wrote him. In 'He shall know', it is written: 'He shall know now, the cloak of your son is this.' In 'He shall know' they wrote him: 'He shall know now, for whom?'

sentences.text: ״נָא״. אֵין ״נָא״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן בַּקָּשָׁה. אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: בְּבַקָּשָׁה מִמְּךָ, הַכֵּר פְּנֵי בּוֹרַאֲךָ וְאַל תַּעֲלִים עֵינֶיךָ מִמֶּנִּי.
sentences.human_translation: please [ na ].” na nothing other a language of request. She said to him: I request of you: Discern the image of your Creator and do not avert your eyes from me.
sentences.llm_translation: "Na'". There is no "na'" except for a request. He said to him: In a request from you, know the face of your Creator and do not lift up your eyes from me.

sentences.text: ״וַיַּכֵּר יְהוּדָה וַיֹּאמֶר צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַב חָנִין בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא: יוֹסֵף שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בַּסֵּתֶר — זָכָה וְהוֹסִיפוּ לוֹ אוֹת אַחַת מִשְּׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״עֵדוּת בִּיהוֹסֵף שָׂמוֹ״.
sentences.human_translation: “And Judah acknowledged them, and said: She is more righteous than I; This is as Rav Ḥanin bar Bizna says Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida says: Joseph, who sanctified the name of Heaven in private merited that one letter from the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, was added to his as it is written: “He appointed it in Joseph [ bihosef ] for a testimony in his name,
sentences.llm_translation: "And Judah knew and said, 'Righteousness is from me.'" 1 Now, what did Rav Chanina bar Bizna say that Rabbi Shimon Chasida said? "Joseph who consecrated the name of Heaven in secret" - he was justified and they added to him one letter from the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is written: "Testimony is from Joseph, he has made him a witness." 2

sentences.text: יְהוּדָה שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא — זָכָה וְנִקְרָא כּוּלּוֹ עַל שְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהוֹדָה וְאָמַר ״צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״, יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: אַתָּה הִצַּלְתָּ תָּמָר וּשְׁנֵי בָּנֶיהָ מִן הָאוּר — חַיֶּיךָ שֶׁאֲנִי מַצִּיל בִּזְכוּתְךָ שְׁלֹשָׁה מִבָּנֶיךָ מִן הָאוּר. מַאן נִינְהוּ — חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה.
sentences.human_translation: Judah, who sanctified the name of Heaven in public, merited that his entire is called by the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, When he confessed and said: “She is more righteous than I,” a Divine Voice went forth and said: You saved Tamar and her two children from the fire. your life, in your merit, I will save three of your children from the fire. who are they? Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah
sentences.llm_translation: Yehudah, who sanctified the name of Heaven in a parshya, has earned and been called up for his name's sake by the Holy One, blessed be He. When Yehudah said, "Vindicate me from mine enemy," a voice went forth and said: You have saved Tamar and her two sons from the fiery furnace - your life that I am saving in your merit, three of your children from the fiery furnace. Who are these? Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah.

sentences.text: ״צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. מְנָא יָדַע? יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: מִמֶּנִּי יָצְאוּ כְּבוּשִׁים.
sentences.human_translation: “She is more righteous than I [ mimmenni ].” From where did he know A Divine Voice went forth and said: From Me these hidden emerged,
sentences.llm_translation: "Righteousness is from me." What did he know? A daughter of the voice went out and said: "From me shall go forth the bound ones." (

sentences.text: ״וְלֹא יָסַף עוֹד לְדַעְתָּה״. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל סָבָא חֲמוּהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי: כֵּיוָן שֶׁיְּדָעָהּ — שׁוּב לֹא פָּסַק מִמֶּנָּה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְלֹא יָסַף עוֹד לְדַעְתָּה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״קוֹל גָּדוֹל וְלֹא יָסָף״.
sentences.human_translation: “And he knew her [ leda’atah ] again no more [ velo yasaf ],” Shmuel the Elder, father-in-law of Rav Shmuel bar Ami, says in the name of Rav Shmuel bar Ami: once he knew her he did not desist from her again, it is written here: “ Velo yasaf od leda’atah ,” and it is written there with a great voice and it went on no more [ velo yasaf ]”
sentences.llm_translation: And he shall not cease to know. Said Shmuel Saba, a student of Rav Shmuel bar Ami, in the name of his teacher Rav Shmuel bar Ami: When he knows - he does not desist from it. As it is written here: "And he shall not cease to know", and as it is written there: "A great voice and he shall not cease". (

sentences.text: אַבְשָׁלוֹם נִתְגָּאָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַבְשָׁלוֹם בִּשְׂעָרוֹ מָרַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּכְאַבְשָׁלוֹם לֹא הָיָה אִישׁ יָפֶה וְגוֹ׳. וּבְגַלְּחוֹ אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ וְהָיָה מִקֵּץ יָמִים לַיָּמִים אֲשֶׁר יְגַלֵּחַ כִּי כָבֵד עָלָיו וְגִלְּחוֹ וְשָׁקַל אֶת שְׂעַר רֹאשׁוֹ מָאתַיִם שְׁקָלִים בְּאֶבֶן הַמֶּלֶךְ״. תָּנָא: אֶבֶן שֶׁאַנְשֵׁי טְבֶרְיָא וְאַנְשֵׁי צִיפּוֹרִי שׁוֹקְלִים בָּהּ.
sentences.human_translation: Absalom was proud of his hair, The Sages taught Absalom rebelled due to his hair, as it is stated: there was none as Absalom for his beauty; And when he shaved his head, as it was at every year’s end that he shaved it; because the hair was heavy on him, therefore he shaved it, and he weighed the hair of his head at two hundred shekels, by the king’s stone” taught: A stone with which the people of Tiberias and the people of Tzippori weigh
sentences.llm_translation: Abishalom was proud of his hair and so on. The rabbis taught: Abishalom was proud of his hair, as it is said: "And there was no man so renowned as Abishalom in all the land" (2 Samuel 14:25). And when he shaved his head and it became long after many days that he would shave, because it weighed heavily upon him and he shaved and weighed the weight of his head at two hundred shekels by the king's stone. A Tanna taught: The stone on which men of Teverya and men of Ziphori weigh.

sentences.text: לְפִיכָךְ נִתְלָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקְרָא אַבְשָׁלוֹם לִפְנֵי עַבְדֵי דָוִד וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם רֹכֵב עַל הַפֶּרֶד וַיָּבֹא הַפֶּרֶד תַּחַת שׂוֹבֶךְ הָאֵלָה הַגְּדוֹלָה וַיֶּחֱזַק רֹאשׁוֹ בָאֵלָה וַיֻּתַּן בֵּין הַשָּׁמַיִם וּבֵין הָאָרֶץ וְהַפֶּרֶד אֲשֶׁר תַּחְתָּיו עָבָר״. שְׁקַל סַפְסִירָא בְּעָא לְמִיפְסְקֵיהּ. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִבְקַע שְׁאוֹל מִתַּחְתָּיו.
sentences.human_translation: therefore, he was hung by his hair, as it is stated “And Absalom chanced to meet the servants of David. And Absalom was riding upon his mule, and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great terebinth, and his head caught hold of the terebinth, and he was taken up between the heaven and the earth; and the mule that was under him went on” took a sword [ safseira ] and wanted to cut his hair The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: At that moment, the netherworld opened beneath him
sentences.llm_translation: Therefore, it was suspended in his hair, as it is said: "And Absalom rode on the mule, and the mule went under the thick thorn bush beneath him; and his head caught hold of the treetop, and he was left hanging between heaven and earth, while the mule that was under him walked on." (2 Samuel 18:8). Consider the words of Rav Yishmael: At that very moment, Sheol burst open from underneath.

sentences.text: ״וַיִּרְגַּז הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיַּעַל עַל עֲלִיַּית הַשַּׁעַר וַיֵּבְךְּ וְכֹה אָמַר בְּלֶכְתּוֹ בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם מִי יִתֵּן מוּתִי אֲנִי תַחְתֶּיךָ אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי. וְהַמֶּלֶךְ לָאַט אֶת פָּנָיו וַיִּזְעַק הַמֶּלֶךְ קוֹל גָּדוֹל בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי״. הָנֵי תְּמָנְיָא ״בְּנִי״ לְמָה? שִׁבְעָה דְּאַסְּקֵיהּ מִשִּׁבְעָה מְדוֹרֵי גֵיהִנָּם, וְאִידַּךְ, אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּקָרֵיב רֵישֵׁיהּ לְגַבֵּי גוּפֵיהּ, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּאַיְיתֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי.
sentences.human_translation: “And the king was much moved, and went up to the chamber over the gate, and wept; and as he went about he said: O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! Would I had died in your place, O Absalom, my son, my son” “And the king covered his face, and the king cried with a loud voice: O my son Absalom, O Absalom, my son, my son” Why these eight “my son” Seven which he raised him up from the seven chambers of Gehenna. And the other, some say that brought head close to body, and some say that brought to the World-to-Come.
sentences.llm_translation: וַיִּרְגַּז הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיַּעַל עַל עֲלִיַּית הַשַּׁעַר וַיֵּבְךְּ וְכֹה אָמַר בְּלֶכְתּוֹ בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם מִי יִתֵּן מוּתִי אֲנִי תַחְתֶּיךָ אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי. וְהַמֶּלֶךְ לָאַט אֶת פָּנָיו וַיִּזְעַק הַמֶּלֶךְ קוֹל גָּדוֹל בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי. הָנֵי תְּמָנְיָא "בְּנִי" לְמָה? שִׁבְעָה דְּאַסְּקֵיהּ מִשִּׁבְעָה מְדוֹרֵי גֵיהִנָּם, וְאִידַּךְ, אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּקָרֵיב רֵישֵׁיהּ לְגַבֵּי גוּפֵיהּ, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּאַיְיתֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי. English translation: And the king was enraged and ascended to the upper gate and wept, and he said when he came in: "My son Absalom! My son Absalom! Who will give me to die? I am beneath your feet, my son Absalom! My son Absalom! And the king covered his face and a great cry was heard from the king: "My son Absalom! My son Absalom! My son Absalom!" And these are the words of the Tanna: "Why is it written 'my son' seven times? Because seven matters were asked of him in the seven heavens, and I say: It is fitting for his head to be covered before his body, and I say: He was given to the world that is not yet."

sentences.text: ״וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם לָקַח וַיַּצֶּב לוֹ בְחַיָּיו״. מַאי ״לָקַח״? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: שֶׁלָּקַח מִקָּח רַע לְעַצְמוֹ. ״אֶת מַצֶּבֶת אֲשֶׁר בְּעֵמֶק הַמֶּלֶךְ וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא: בְּעֵצָה עֲמוּקָּה שֶׁל מַלְכּוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם,
sentences.human_translation: “Now Absalom in his lifetime had taken and reared up for himself What did take? Reish Lakish says: He engaged in a bad transaction for himself “The pillar, which is in the king’s valley [ be’emek hammelekh ].” Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa says: in the deep [ amukka ] counsel of the King [ melekh ] of the universe,
sentences.llm_translation: And Abishalom took and set for himself in his lifetime. What is "took"? Said Reish Lakish: He took a bad deal for himself. "As the setting of the tabernacle which is in the valley of the king and so on", said Rabbi Chanina bar Pappi: A deep counsel of the King of the World, (

text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין.
וְתַנְיָא כְּבֵיצָה.
סַבְרוּהָ אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּעִיסָּה רִאשׁוֹנָה, וְחוּלִּין הַטְּבוּלִין לְחַלָּה לָא כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ.
מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: אֵין שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין,
וּמָר סָבַר: שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין.

אָמַר רַב מָרִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אֵין שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין, וְהָכָא בְּחוּלִּין הַטְּבוּלִין לְחַלָּה קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ.

וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא חוּלִּין הַטְּבוּלִין לְחַלָּה לָא כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ, וְאֵין שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין, וְהָכָא בְּמוּתָּר לִגְרוֹם טוּמְאָה לְחוּלִּין שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
מָר סָבַר: מוּתָּר לִגְרוֹם טוּמְאָה לְחוּלִּין שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וּמָר סָבַר: אָסוּר לִגְרוֹם טוּמְאָה לְחוּלִּין שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְכוּ׳.

תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִן הַיָּם, נָתְנוּ עֵינֵיהֶם לוֹמַר שִׁירָה. וְכֵיצַד אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה — כְּגָדוֹל הַמַּקְרֶא אֶת הַלֵּל, וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו רָאשֵׁי פְרָקִים. מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״, וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״, מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה״ וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״.

רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: כְּקָטָן הַמַּקְרֶא אֶת הַלֵּל, וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו כׇּל מָה שֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר. מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״ וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״, מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה״, וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה״.
רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: כְּסוֹפֵר הַפּוֹרֵס עַל שְׁמַע בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, שֶׁהוּא פּוֹתֵחַ תְּחִילָּה וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו.
בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי — רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: ״לֵאמֹר״, אַמִּילְּתָא קַמַּיְיתָא.

וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי סָבַר: ״לֵאמֹר״ — אַכֹּל מִילְּתָא וּמִילְּתָא, וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה סָבַר: ״וַיֹּאמְרוּ״ — דַּאֲמוּר כּוּלְּהוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, ״לֵאמֹר״ — דִּפְתַח מֹשֶׁה בְּרֵישָׁא.

הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ עוּבָּרִים שֶׁבִּמְעֵי אִמָּן אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר:
״בְּמַקְהֵלוֹת בָּרְכוּ אֱלֹהִים ה׳ מִמְּקוֹר יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
וְהָא לָא חֲזוֹ? אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: כָּרֵס נַעֲשָׂה לָהֶן כְּאַסְפַּקְלַרְיָא הַמְּאִירָה וְרָאוּ.
בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן הוּרְקָנוֹס שֶׁלֹּא עָבַד אִיּוֹב כּוּ׳. וְלִיחְזֵי הַאי ״לֹא״, אִי בְּלָמֶד אָלֶף כְּתִיב — ״לֹא״ הוּא, אִי בְּלָמֶד וָיו כְּתִיב — ״לוֹ״ הוּא?
וְכׇל הֵיכָא דִּכְתִיב בְּלָמֶד אָלֶף, ״לֹא״ הוּא? אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה ״בְּכׇל צָרָתָם לֹא צָר״, דִּכְתִיב בְּלָמֶד אָלֶף, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּ״לֹא״ הוּא?
וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָכְתִיב ״וּמַלְאַךְ פָּנָיו הוֹשִׁיעָם״! אֶלָּא לָאו, מַשְׁמַע הָכִי וּמַשְׁמַע הָכִי.

תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ בְּאִיּוֹב, וְנֶאֱמַר ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ בְּאַבְרָהָם, מָה ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ הָאָמוּר בְּאַבְרָהָם — מֵאַהֲבָה, אַף ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ הָאָמוּר בְּאִיּוֹב — מֵאַהֲבָה.
וְאַבְרָהָם גּוּפֵיהּ מְנָלַן — דִּכְתִיב ״זֶרַע אַבְרָהָם אֹהֲבִי״.

מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין עוֹשֶׂה מֵאַהֲבָה לְעוֹשֶׂה מִיִּרְאָה? אִיכָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: גָּדוֹל הָעוֹשֶׂה מֵאַהֲבָה יוֹתֵר מִן הָעוֹשֶׂה מִיִּרְאָה, שֶׁזֶּה תָּלוּי לְאֶלֶף דּוֹר. וְזֶה תָּלוּי לְאַלְפַּיִם דּוֹר.

וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא חוּלִּין הַטְּבוּלִין לְחַלָּה לָא כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ, וְאֵין שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין, וְהָכָא בְּמוּתָּר לִגְרוֹם טוּמְאָה לְחוּלִּין שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
מָר סָבַר: מוּתָּר לִגְרוֹם טוּמְאָה לְחוּלִּין שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וּמָר סָבַר: אָסוּר לִגְרוֹם טוּמְאָה לְחוּלִּין שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְכוּ׳.
בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: תְּחוּמִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּמָר סָבַר: דְּרַבָּנַן.

תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִן הַיָּם, נָתְנוּ עֵינֵיהֶם לוֹמַר שִׁירָה. וְכֵיצַד אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה — כְּגָדוֹל הַמַּקְרֶא אֶת הַלֵּל, וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו רָאשֵׁי פְרָקִים. מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״, וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״, מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה״ וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״.

רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: כְּקָטָן הַמַּקְרֶא אֶת הַלֵּל, וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו כׇּל מָה שֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר. מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״ וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״, מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה״, וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה״.
רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: כְּסוֹפֵר הַפּוֹרֵס עַל שְׁמַע בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, שֶׁהוּא פּוֹתֵחַ תְּחִילָּה וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו.
בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי — רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: ״לֵאמֹר״, אַמִּילְּתָא קַמַּיְיתָא.

וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי סָבַר: ״לֵאמֹר״ — אַכֹּל מִילְּתָא וּמִילְּתָא, וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה סָבַר: ״וַיֹּאמְרוּ״ — דַּאֲמוּר כּוּלְּהוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, ״לֵאמֹר״ — דִּפְתַח מֹשֶׁה בְּרֵישָׁא.

תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִן הַיָּם נָתְנוּ עֵינֵיהֶם לוֹמַר שִׁירָה. וְכֵיצַד אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה — עוֹלָל מוּטָּל עַל בִּרְכֵּי אִמּוֹ, וְתִינוֹק יוֹנֵק מִשְּׁדֵי אִמּוֹ. כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאוּ אֶת הַשְּׁכִינָה, עוֹלָל הִגְבִּיהַּ צַוָּארוֹ, וְתִינוֹק שָׁמַט דַּד מִפִּיו, וְאָמְרוּ ״זֶה אֵלִי וְאַנְוֵהוּ״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִפִּי עוֹלְלִים וְיֹנְקִים יִסַּדְתָּ עֹז״.
הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ עוּבָּרִים שֶׁבִּמְעֵי אִמָּן אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר:
״בְּמַקְהֵלוֹת בָּרְכוּ אֱלֹהִים ה׳ מִמְּקוֹר יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
וְהָא לָא חֲזוֹ? אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: כָּרֵס נַעֲשָׂה לָהֶן כְּאַסְפַּקְלַרְיָא הַמְּאִירָה וְרָאוּ.
בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן הוּרְקָנוֹס שֶׁלֹּא עָבַד אִיּוֹב כּוּ׳. וְלִיחְזֵי הַאי ״לֹא״, אִי בְּלָמֶד אָלֶף כְּתִיב — ״לֹא״ הוּא, אִי בְּלָמֶד וָיו כְּתִיב — ״לוֹ״ הוּא?
וְכׇל הֵיכָא דִּכְתִיב בְּלָמֶד אָלֶף, ״לֹא״ הוּא? אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה ״בְּכׇל צָרָתָם לֹא צָר״, דִּכְתִיב בְּלָמֶד אָלֶף, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּ״לֹא״ הוּא?
וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָכְתִיב ״וּמַלְאַךְ פָּנָיו הוֹשִׁיעָם״! אֶלָּא לָאו, מַשְׁמַע הָכִי וּמַשְׁמַע הָכִי.

תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ בְּאִיּוֹב, וְנֶאֱמַר ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ בְּאַבְרָהָם, מָה ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ הָאָמוּר בְּאַבְרָהָם — מֵאַהֲבָה, אַף ״יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים״ הָאָמוּר בְּאִיּוֹב — מֵאַהֲבָה.
וְאַבְרָהָם גּוּפֵיהּ מְנָלַן — דִּכְתִיב ״זֶרַע אַבְרָהָם אֹהֲבִי״.

מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין עוֹשֶׂה מֵאַהֲבָה לְעוֹשֶׂה מִיִּרְאָה? אִיכָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: גָּדוֹל הָעוֹשֶׂה מֵאַהֲבָה יוֹתֵר מִן הָעוֹשֶׂה מִיִּרְאָה, שֶׁזֶּה תָּלוּי לְאֶלֶף דּוֹר. וְזֶה תָּלוּי לְאַלְפַּיִם דּוֹר.
הָכָא כְּתִיב: ״לַאֲלָפִים לְאֹהֲבַי וּלְשֹׁמְרֵי מִצְוֹתָי״, וְהָתָם כְּתִיב: ״וּלְשֹׁמְרֵי מִצְוֹתָיו לְאֶלֶף דּוֹר״.
הָתָם נָמֵי כְּתִיב ״לְאֹהֲבָיו וּלְשֹׁמְרֵי מִצְוֹתָיו לְאֶלֶף דּוֹר״!
הַאי לְדִסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ וְהַאי לְדִסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ.

הָנְהוּ תְּרֵי תַּלְמִידֵי דַּהֲווֹ יָתְבִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, חַד אָמַר לֵיהּ אַקְרְיוּן בְּחֶלְמַאי: ״מָה רַב טוּבְךָ אֲשֶׁר צָפַנְתָּ לִּירֵאֶיךָ״, וְחַד אָמַר לֵיהּ: אַקְרְיוּן בְּחֶלְמַאי ״וְיִשְׂמְחוּ כׇל חוֹסֵי בָךְ לְעוֹלָם יְרַנֵּנוּ וְיַעְלְצוּ בְךָ אֹהֲבֵי שְׁמֶךָ״. אֲמַר לְהוּ: תַּרְוַיְיכוּ רַבָּנַן צַדִּיקֵי גְּמוּרֵי אַתּוּן. מָר מֵאַהֲבָה, וּמָר מִיִּרְאָה.
הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהַמַּיִם
מִי שֶׁקִּינֵּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ וְנִסְתְּרָה, אֲפִילּוּ שָׁמַע מֵעוֹף הַפּוֹרֵחַ — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיִּשְׂאוּ וְיִתְּנוּ בָּהּ מוֹזְרוֹת בַּלְּבָנָה.
אָמַר עֵד אֶחָד ״אֲנִי רְאִיתִיהָ שֶׁנִּטְמֵאת״ — לֹא הָיְתָה שׁוֹתָה. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ עֶבֶד אֲפִילּוּ שִׁפְחָה — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנִין אַף לְפוֹסְלָהּ מִכְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
חֲמוֹתָהּ וּבַת חֲמוֹתָהּ וְצָרָתָהּ וִיבִמְתָּהּ וּבַת בַּעְלָהּ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָנוֹת. וְלֹא לְפוֹסְלָהּ מִכְּתוּבָּתָהּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁתֶּה.

שֶׁהָיָה בַּדִּין: וּמָה אִם עֵדוּת רִאשׁוֹנָה, שֶׁאֵין אוֹסַרְתָּהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם — אֵינָהּ מִתְקַיֶּימֶת בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם, עֵדוּת אַחֲרוֹנָה, שֶׁאוֹסַרְתָּהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְקַיֵּים בְּפָחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם?
תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעֵד אֵין בָּהּ״, כׇּל עֵדוּת שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ.
וְקַל וָחוֹמֶר לְעֵדוּת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה מֵעַתָּה: וּמָה אִם
llm_translation: And wise men are restraining.

And it was taught in a mishnah: וְתַנְיָא כְּבֵיצָה. Translation: And it was taught in a mishnah, "As for the one who says that the Torah is not from heaven, we do not accept his testimony. And as for the one who says that the Torah is from heaven, we do not accept him either."
Sabrohu iidi veiidi b'isah rishonah, vechulin hattevulin lachalah la kachalah damu.
What is not apparent, but can be inferred from this, that Rabbi Sava said: There is no third party involved in a dispute.
And Mar Sava said: I am doing the third one in a circle.

Rav Mari said in the name of Rav Chanana: "All is well, there is no third party that makes a third party in the midst, and this one in the midst is destined to be torn apart. Master says: 'As water, so will you be.' And Master says: 'Not as water, so will you be.'"

And you may ask, "What is the matter?" The entire world is bound by fate to be judged according to their deeds, and there is no one who can do a third thing in matters of fate. And this is in the case where it is necessary to bring defilement upon those who are destined to die in Eretz Yisrael. (
Mar Sabor: It is permitted to cause defilement for the sake of Israelites in the land of Israel, and Mar Sabor: It is forbidden to cause defilement for the sake of Israelites in the land of Israel.
On that day, Rabi Akiva and others sought.
In what way did he diverge? Rabbi Sava said: Halakhot de'Oroitha, and Rabbi Sava said: Drabanin.

It was stated by our Rabbis, in the name of Rabbi Akiva: When Israel ascended from the sea, they gave their eyes to say a song. And how did they say the song? As great as the one who proclaims the Hallel, and then they would repeat the heads of paragraphs. Moses said "I will sing to God", and then they would say "I will sing to God". Moses said "For He has exalted His horn" and then they would say "I will sing to God".

Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, says: As a cantor reads the Hallel, and then they repeat after him everything he says. Moses said, "I will sing to Hashem," and then they say, "I will sing to Hashem." Moses said, "For He has exalted His people," and then they say, "For He has exalted His people."
Rabbi Nachman says: As a scribe who spreads out the parchment on the reading desk in the synagogue, he opens it first and then reads afterwards.
Because he has not explained — Rabbi Akiva says: "To say", I have already learned.

And Rabi Eliezer, son of Rabi Yose the Galilean, says: "To say" - he eats a meal and a meal, and Rabi Nachman says: "They said" - let us say it all in great detail, "to say" - Moses began to speak in a loud voice.

Our Rabbis taught, Rabbi Yosei HaGili said: When Israel ascended from the sea, they gave their eyes to say a song. And how did they say the song? — A weaned child sat on his mother's lap, and a suckling infant was at his mother's breast. When they saw the Shechinah, the weaned child lifted up his neck, and the suckling infant let go of his mouth, and they said: "This is my God, and I will beautify Him," as it is written: "From the mouths of infants and sucklings You established praise."
Rav Meir says: From where do we learn that even unformed fetuses in the womb of their mother said a song - as it is stated: (
"B'Mikhalot Bar'chu Elohim HaShem M'miqor Yisrael" (
And what is this? Said Rabbi Tanhum: A mistake was made, as it were, in the illumination and they saw.

On that day, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Horcanus asked: Did Job not serve? And he sought to know whether this "not" lo was written with an aleph alef, or whether it was written without a vav wo. Is it written "lo" not, or is it written "lo" he?
And all that is written in the Torah, "Not" is it? But now, "In all their afflictions they did not cry out", as it is written in the Torah, therefore "Not" is it?
And if you say "yes indeed", and it is written "and His angel will save them"! But rather, the matter is this and the matter is this.

A tradition, Rabbi Meir says: It is said "Fear God" in Job, and it is said "Fear God" in Abraham. What is the meaning of "Fear God" said in Abraham - out of love? And what is the meaning of "Fear God" said in Job - out of love.
And Abraham's soul is exhausted — as it is written, "Seed of Abraham, I love."

What is the difference between one who does a mitzvah out of love and one who does it out of fear? There is this teaching, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Great is he who does a mitzvah out of love more than he who does it out of fear, for this is dependent on a thousand generations. And this is dependent on twenty thousand generations. (
This teaches: "For thousands to My lovers and keepers of My commandments", and there it teaches: "And for keepers of His commandments, a thousand generations". (
הָתָם נָמֵי כְּתִיב "לְאֹהֲבָיו וּלְשֹׁמְרֵי מִצְוֹתָיו לְאֶלֶף דּוֹר" Translation: "As it is written, 'To His loved ones and those who keep His commandments for a thousand generations'!"
Is this for him to decide and is this for him to decide?

They would say that three students of Rav were sitting before him. One said to him: "Acrimonious in a dispute": "How great is Your goodness that You have prepared for those who fear You." And one said to him: "Acrimonious in a dispute": "And let all who seek refuge in You rejoice, and may those who love Your name run to You." He said to them: "You should be like the great rabbis of old. One is from love, and one is from fear."
Hadran alach keshem shema mayim.

Whoever has a wife and she is hidden, even if he heard from the rooster that crows - he will go out and give her a writ, as it says (Deuteronomy 24:1), "Write this divorce document." - Words of Rabbi Eliezer.
Rabbi Yehoshua says: Until they lift and give it a white covering.

sentences.text: מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין עוֹשֶׂה מֵאַהֲבָה לְעוֹשֶׂה מִיִּרְאָה? אִיכָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: גָּדוֹל הָעוֹשֶׂה מֵאַהֲבָה יוֹתֵר מִן הָעוֹשֶׂה מִיִּרְאָה, שֶׁזֶּה תָּלוּי לְאֶלֶף דּוֹר. וְזֶה תָּלוּי לְאַלְפַּיִם דּוֹר.
sentences.human_translation: What is there between one who performs out of love and one who performs out of fear? There is that which is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Greater is the one who performs out of love than the one who performs out of fear, as this endure for one thousand generations, and that endure for two thousand generations.
sentences.llm_translation: What is the difference between one who does a mitzvah out of love and one who does it out of fear? There is this teaching, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Great is he who does a mitzvah out of love more than he who does it out of fear, for this is dependent on a thousand generations. And this is dependent on twenty thousand generations. (

text: שֶׁמְּבַזְבְּזִין דִּין אֲבִיהֶם לֶעָתִיד לָבוֹא. אוֹמְרִים לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מֵאַחַר שֶׁאַתָּה עָתִיד לִיפָּרַע מֵהֶן, לָמָה הִקְהֵיתָה שִׁינֵּיהֶם בָּם?

אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: אִלְמָלֵא תְּפִלָּתוֹ שֶׁל דָּוִד, הָיוּ כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל מוֹכְרֵי רְבָב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שִׁיתָה ה׳ מוֹרָה לָהֶם״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: אִלְמָלֵא תְּפִלָּתוֹ שֶׁל חֲבַקּוּק, הָיוּ שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מִתְכַּסִּים בְּטַלִּית אַחַת וְעוֹסְקִין בַּתּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״ה׳ שָׁמַעְתִּי שִׁמְעֲךָ יָרֵאתִי ה׳ פׇּעׇלְךָ בְּקֶרֶב שָׁנִים חַיֵּיהוּ״. אַל תִּקְרָא ״בְּקֶרֶב שָׁנִים״, אֶלָּא ״בְּקֵרוּב שְׁנַיִם״.

וְאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים הַמְהַלְּכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְאֵין בֵּינֵיהֶן דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה — רְאוּיִן לִישָּׂרֵף בָּאֵשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי הֵמָּה הֹלְכִים הָלוֹךְ וְדַבֵּר וְהִנֵּה רֶכֶב אֵשׁ וְגוֹ׳״, טַעְמָא דְּאִיכָּא דִּיבּוּר, הָא לֵיכָּא דִּיבּוּר — רְאוּיִן לִישָּׂרֵף.

וְאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא בַּר יְבֶרֶכְיָה: שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים הַדָּרִין בְּעִיר אַחַת וְאֵין נוֹחִין זֶה לָזֶה בַּהֲלָכָה — אֶחָד מֵת וְאֶחָד גּוֹלֶה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָנֻס שָׁמָּה רוֹצֵחַ אֲשֶׁר יִרְצַח אֶת רֵעֵהוּ בִּבְלִי דַעַת״, וְאֵין דַּעַת אֶלָּא תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נִדְמוּ עַמִּי מִבְּלִי הַדָּעַת״.

אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא: כׇּל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הָעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה מִתּוֹךְ הַדְּחָק — תְּפִלָּתוֹ נִשְׁמַעַת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי עַם בְּצִיּוֹן יֵשֵׁב בִּירוּשָׁלִָם בָּכוֹ לֹא תִבְכֶּה חָנוֹן יׇחְנְךָ לְקוֹל זַעֲקֶךָ כְּשׇׁמְעָתוֹ עָנָךְ״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״וְנָתַן ה׳ לָכֶם לֶחֶם צָר וּמַיִם לָחַץ״.

רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אוֹמֵר: מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתוֹ מִזִּיו שְׁכִינָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיוּ עֵינֶיךָ רֹאוֹת אֶת מוֹרֶיךָ״. רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: אַף אֵין הַפַּרְגּוֹד נִנְעָל בְּפָנָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא יִכָּנֵף עוֹד מוֹרֶיךָ״.

רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ אֵין וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רָבָא: בְּכׇל יוֹם וָיוֹם מְרוּבָּה קִלְלָתוֹ מִשֶּׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּבֹּקֶר תֹּאמַר מִי יִתֵּן עֶרֶב וּבָעֶרֶב תֹּאמַר מִי יִתֵּן בֹּקֶר״, הֵי בֹּקֶר? אִילֵימָא בֹּקֶר דְּלִמְחַר, מִי יָדַע מַאי הָוֵי? אֶלָּא דַּחֲלֵיף.

וְאֶלָּא, עָלְמָא אַמַּאי קָא מִקַּיַּים? אַקְּדוּשָּׁה דְסִידְרָא, וְאַ״יְּהֵא שְׁמֵיהּ רַבָּא״ דְּאַגַּדְתָּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶרֶץ עֵיפָתָה כְּמוֹ אֹפֶל צַלְמָוֶת וְלֹא סְדָרִים״, הָא יֵשׁ סְדָרִים — תּוֹפִיעַ מֵאוֹפֶל.
וְלֹא יָרַד טַל לִבְרָכָה וְנִיטַּל טַעַם פֵּירוֹת וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: טׇהֳרָה — בִּטְּלָה טַעַם וָרֵיחַ, מַעֲשֵׂר — בִּיטֵּל שׁוֹמֶן דָּגָן.

רַב הוּנָא אַשְׁכַּח תּוֹמַרְתָּא דְּחִינוּנִיתָא, שַׁקְלַהּ, כַּרְכַהּ בְּסוּדָרֵיהּ. אֲתָא רַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מוֹרְחִינָא רֵיחָא דְּחִינוּנִיתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנִי, טׇהֳרָה יֵשׁ בְּךָ. יַהֲבַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ. אַדְּהָכִי אֲתָא אַבָּא בְּרֵיהּ, שַׁקְלַהּ, יַהֲבַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנִי, שִׂמַּחְתָּ אֶת לִבִּי, וְהִקְהֵיתָה אֶת שִׁינַּי. הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רַחֲמֵי דְּאַבָּא — אַבְּנֵי, רַחֲמֵי דִּבְנֵי — אַבְּנֵי דְּהָווּ לֵיהּ.

מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי מֵאִיר בָּטְלוּ מוֹשְׁלֵי מְשָׁלִים. מִשֶּׁמֵּת בֶּן עַזַּאי בָּטְלוּ הַשַּׁקְדָנִים. מִשֶּׁמֵּת בֶּן זוֹמָא בָּטְלוּ הַדַּרְשָׁנִים. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בָּטַל כְּבוֹד הַתּוֹרָה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא בָּטְלוּ אַנְשֵׁי מַעֲשֶׂה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי יוֹסֵי קְטֹנְתָּא פָּסְקוּ חֲסִידִים. וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ ״קְטֹנְתָּא״ — שֶׁהָיָה קְטֹנְתָּא שֶׁל חֲסִידִים.

מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי בָּטַל זִיו הַחׇכְמָה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַזָּקֵן בָּטַל כְּבוֹד הַתּוֹרָה, וּמֵתָה טׇהֳרָה וּפְרִישׁוּת. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן פִּאָבִי בָּטְלָה זִיו הַכְּהוּנָּה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי בָּטְלָ[ה] עֲנָוָה וְיִרְאַת חֵטְא.

[ גְּמָ׳ ] תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: רַבִּי פִּנְחָס בֶּן יָאִיר אוֹמֵר: מִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ בּוֹשׁוּ חֲבֵרִים וּבְנֵי חוֹרִין, וְחָפוּ רֹאשָׁם, וְנִדַּלְדְּלוּ אַנְשֵׁי מַעֲשֶׂה, וְגָבְרוּ בַּעֲלֵי זְרוֹעַ וּבַעֲלֵי לָשׁוֹן, וְאֵין דּוֹרֵשׁ וְאֵין מְבַקֵּשׁ וְאֵין שׁוֹאֵל,
עַל מִי לָנוּ לְהִשָּׁעֵן עַל אָבִינוּ שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם.
רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ שָׁרוֹ חַכִּימַיָּא לְמֶהֱוֵי כְּסָפְרַיָּא, וְסָפְרַיָּא כְּחַזָּנַיָּא, וְחַזָּנַיָּא כְּעַמָּא דְאַרְעָא, וְעַמָּא דְאַרְעָא
llm_translation: שֶׁמְּבַזְבְּזִין דִּין אֲבִיהֶם לֶעָתִיד לָבוֹא. אוֹמְרִים לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מֵאַחַר שֶׁאַתָּה עָתִיד לִיפָּרַע מֵהֶן, לָמָה הִקְהֵיתָה שִׁינֵּיהֶם בָּם? English translation: They will busy themselves with the judgment of their ancestors for the future. They say beforehand: Master of the universe, after you are destined to redeem them from them, why did you ordain them in them?

Rabbi Il'ea bar Yeverkya said: The prayer of David, which is unspoken, would have been sufficient for all Israel to buy and sell, as it is said: "Teach me, O Lord, the way of Your statutes" (Psalm 119:33). And Rabbi Il'ea bar Yeverkya said: The prayer of Habakkuk, which is unspoken, would have been sufficient for two students of wise men to wrap themselves in a single cloak and occupy themselves with Torah, as it is said: "I heard, O Lord, Your voice; I will fear Your name" (Habakkuk 3:2). Do not read "in the midst of years" but rather "in the midst of two years".

And Rabbi Il'ea bar Yeverchiya said: Two students of wisdom who walk on the way and between them there are no words of Torah - it is fitting to burn them in fire, as it is written: "And they went, going and speaking; and behold a chariot of fire and..." (2 Kings 2:11), for just as that burning was due to the divine will, this too is due to the divine will. It is fitting to burn them. (

And Rabbi Il'ea bar Yeberechyah said: Two students of the wise ones were esteemed in one city, and there was no one who could correct this one for that one in halakha - one died and one was exiled. For it is said: "The wicked man does violence to the righteous one in his own heart" (Psalm 17:13), and there is no wisdom except Torah, as it is said: "My people are destroyed from lack of knowledge" (Hosea 4:6).

Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Chiya, said: All who are wise and busy with the Torah from within their heart — their prayer is heard. As it is written: "For a people dwelling in Zion, in Jerusalem, He will weep, and His heart will be moved for them; He will not rebuke nor scold, for His people He does not despise." And as it continues to write: "And God will give you the bread of adversity and make all your streams of water into a flood."

Rabbi Avahu says: They sustain him from the Shechinah, as it is said: "And your eyes shall see the king of kings". Rabbi Achia bar Chanina says: Even the Pargod is not locked in his presence, as it is said: "And he will not be vexed anymore by your words".

Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: From the day that the Temple was destroyed, there is no and so on. Rabba said: Every day and every day they are reviling his memory from the mouth of his neighbor, as it is said: "In the morning you will say 'Who will give me evening' and in the evening you will say 'Who will give me morning'", what is morning? It is morning of tomorrow, who knows what it will be? Only if he changes.
And lo, the Master said: "What is this world? Is it not like a garment of the dead, and there are no orders?" And behold, there are orders — emerging from the void.
And he did not descend to bless and taste the fruit. Talmudic tradition, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Tahorah — without flavor or aroma, Ma'aser — complete with oil of olives. (

Rav Huna forgot Tomara de-Chinunita, a shekel, and the kercha in its order. He came to Ravah, his son, and said to him: "The fragrance of Chinunita." He said to him: "My son, there is something in you." He said to him: "Give it to me." He said to him: "My son, you have gladdened my heart, and you have lengthened my days." As it is written: "Mercy of the father" - the mercies of the children - the mercies that are desired for them.

Rav Acha bar Yaakov posed a question before Rav Yaakov bar Berach. For he said to him: "Let us go up and see." He said to him: "Not in your lifetime." And now that we have said it, people say: "Rabbi Rabbi, my master is not yet here."
Matai 1: In the Perek of Aspasai, we learned that the Sages decreed regarding the wreaths of brides and regarding the iruses. (
In the context of Titus, they decreed regarding wreaths, and one should not teach a man his son Greek.
In the last decree, they decreed that the marriage should not go out in Aphrodisium within the city, and our Rabbis permitted it to go out in Aphrodisium within the city.

From the words of Rabbi Meir, it was said that the interpreters of parables were silenced. From the words of Ben Azai, it was said that the sages were silenced. From the words of Rabbi Akiva, it was said that the honor of the Torah was nullified. From the words of Rabbi Hanina ben Dosa, it was said that men of deed were silenced. From the words of Rabbi Yosi Ketona, it was said that pious ones were silenced. And why is he called "Ketona" - because he was a Ketona, which is the Ketona of pious ones. (

From the death of Rabbi Yochanan ben Zakai, the wisdom ceased. From the death of Rabbi Gamliel the Elder, the honor of the Torah ceased, and purity and separation ceased. From the death of Rabbi Yishmael ben Pazi, the wisdom of the kingdom ceased. From the death of Rabbi insert name, humility and fear of sin ceased.

Gemara Our Rabbis taught: Rabbi Pinchas ben Yair says: When the Temple was destroyed, they would gather friends and sons of priests, and cover their heads, and engage in manual labor, and strengthen themselves with men of action, and with owners of strength and tongues, and there is no one seeking, no one asking, no one entreating,
On whom shall we rely, on our Father in Heaven? (

Rabbi Eliezer HaGadol says: From the day that the Temple was destroyed, I have been reckoning the years like a scribe, and the scribe like a witness, and the witness like the land itself, and the land itself like the Torah.

sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: is satiated with the glory of the Divine Presence, as it is stated “And your eyes shall behold your Teacher.” Rabbi Aḥa, son of Ḥanina, said: Even the partition pargod is not locked before him, as it is stated: “And your Teacher shall not hide Himself anymore”
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu says: They sustain him from the Shechinah, as it is said: "And your eyes shall see the king of kings". Rabbi Achia bar Chanina says: Even the Pargod is not locked in his presence, as it is said: "And he will not be vexed anymore by your words".

sentences.text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ אֵין וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רָבָא: בְּכׇל יוֹם וָיוֹם מְרוּבָּה קִלְלָתוֹ מִשֶּׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּבֹּקֶר תֹּאמַר מִי יִתֵּן עֶרֶב וּבָעֶרֶב תֹּאמַר מִי יִתֵּן בֹּקֶר״, הֵי בֹּקֶר? אִילֵימָא בֹּקֶר דְּלִמְחַר, מִי יָדַע מַאי הָוֵי? אֶלָּא דַּחֲלֵיף.
sentences.human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: From the day that the Temple was destroyed, there is no Rava says: Each and every day is more cursed than the previous one, as it is stated “In the morning you will say, would that it were evening, and in the evening you will say, would that it were morning” which morning If we say the following morning, does he know what will be Rather, that has passed;
sentences.llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: From the day that the Temple was destroyed, there is no and so on. Rabba said: Every day and every day they are reviling his memory from the mouth of his neighbor, as it is said: "In the morning you will say 'Who will give me evening' and in the evening you will say 'Who will give me morning'", what is morning? It is morning of tomorrow, who knows what it will be? Only if he changes.

sentences.text: וְאֶלָּא, עָלְמָא אַמַּאי קָא מִקַּיַּים? אַקְּדוּשָּׁה דְסִידְרָא, וְאַ״יְּהֵא שְׁמֵיהּ רַבָּא״ דְּאַגַּדְתָּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶרֶץ עֵיפָתָה כְּמוֹ אֹפֶל צַלְמָוֶת וְלֹא סְדָרִים״, הָא יֵשׁ סְדָרִים — תּוֹפִיעַ מֵאוֹפֶל.
sentences.human_translation: But why does the world exist? By the sanctification that order and Let His great name of aggada . As it is stated: “A land of thick darkness, as darkness itself; a land of the shadow of death, without any order” Therefore, there are orders shall appear from the darkness.
sentences.llm_translation: And lo, the Master said: "What is this world? Is it not like a garment of the dead, and there are no orders?" And behold, there are orders — emerging from the void.

sentences.text: וְלֹא יָרַד טַל לִבְרָכָה וְנִיטַּל טַעַם פֵּירוֹת וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: טׇהֳרָה — בִּטְּלָה טַעַם וָרֵיחַ, מַעֲשֵׂר — בִּיטֵּל שׁוֹמֶן דָּגָן.
sentences.human_translation: dew has not descended for a blessing, and the taste has been removed from fruit. It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: purity has removed the taste and the aroma; tithes have removed the fat of grain.
sentences.llm_translation: And he did not descend to bless and taste the fruit. Talmudic tradition, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Tahorah — without flavor or aroma, Ma'aser — complete with oil of olives. (

sentences.text: רַב הוּנָא אַשְׁכַּח תּוֹמַרְתָּא דְּחִינוּנִיתָא, שַׁקְלַהּ, כַּרְכַהּ בְּסוּדָרֵיהּ. אֲתָא רַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מוֹרְחִינָא רֵיחָא דְּחִינוּנִיתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנִי, טׇהֳרָה יֵשׁ בְּךָ. יַהֲבַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ. אַדְּהָכִי אֲתָא אַבָּא בְּרֵיהּ, שַׁקְלַהּ, יַהֲבַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנִי, שִׂמַּחְתָּ אֶת לִבִּי, וְהִקְהֵיתָה אֶת שִׁינַּי. הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רַחֲמֵי דְּאַבָּא — אַבְּנֵי, רַחֲמֵי דִּבְנֵי — אַבְּנֵי דְּהָווּ לֵיהּ.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Huna found a fragrant date. He took it and wrapped it in his shawl. Rabba, his son, came said to him: I smell the aroma of a fragrant said to him: My son, there is purity in you, He gave it to him. Meanwhile, Abba, son, arrived. took gave it to said to My son, you have made my heart rejoice and you have blunted my teeth, This that people say: The love of a father is for the sons; the love of the sons is for their own sons,
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Huna forgot Tomara de-Chinunita, a shekel, and the kercha in its order. He came to Ravah, his son, and said to him: "The fragrance of Chinunita." He said to him: "My son, there is something in you." He said to him: "Give it to me." He said to him: "My son, you have gladdened my heart, and you have lengthened my days." As it is written: "Mercy of the father" - the mercies of the children - the mercies that are desired for them.

sentences.text: רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אִיטַּפַּל בֵּיהּ בְּרַב יַעֲקֹב בַּר בְּרַתֵּיה. כִּי גְדַל אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַשְׁקְיַין מַיָּא. אָמַר לוֹ: לָאו בְּרָיךְ אֲנָא. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רַבִּי רַבִּי, בַּר בְּרַתָּךְ אֲנָא.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov took care of Rav Ya’akov, the son of his daughter, When grew up, said to him: Give me water to drink. He said to him: I am not your son, And this that people say: Raise, raise I am the son of your daughter,
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov posed a question before Rav Yaakov bar Berach. For he said to him: "Let us go up and see." He said to him: "Not in your lifetime." And now that we have said it, people say: "Rabbi Rabbi, my master is not yet here."

sentences.text: מַתְנִי׳ בְּפוּלְמוּס שֶׁל אַסְפַּסְיָינוּס גָּזְרוּ עַל עַטְרוֹת חֲתָנִים וְעַל הָאִירוּס.
sentences.human_translation: In the war [ pulemus ] of Vespasian decreed upon the crowns of bridegrooms, and upon the drums,
sentences.llm_translation: Matai 1: In the Perek of Aspasai, we learned that the Sages decreed regarding the wreaths of brides and regarding the iruses. (

sentences.text: בְּפוּלְמוּס שֶׁל טִיטוּס גָּזְרוּ עַל עַטְרוֹת כַּלּוֹת, וְשֶׁלֹּא יְלַמֵּד אָדָם אֶת בְּנוֹ יְווֹנִית.
sentences.human_translation: In the war of Titus they decreed upon the crowns of brides, and that a person should not teach his son Greek.
sentences.llm_translation: In the context of Titus, they decreed regarding wreaths, and one should not teach a man his son Greek.

sentences.text: בְּפוּלְמוּס הָאַחֲרוֹן גָּזְרוּ שֶׁלֹּא תֵּצֵא הַכַּלָּה בְּאַפִּרְיוֹן בְּתוֹךְ הָעִיר, וְרַבּוֹתֵינוּ הִתִּירוּ שֶׁתֵּצֵא הַכַּלָּה בְּאַפִּרְיוֹן בְּתוֹךְ הָעִיר.
sentences.human_translation: In the last war, they decreed that a bride may not go out in a palanquin inside the city, but our Sages permitted a bride to go out in a palanquin inside the city,
sentences.llm_translation: In the last decree, they decreed that the marriage should not go out in Aphrodisium within the city, and our Rabbis permitted it to go out in Aphrodisium within the city.

sentences.text: מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי מֵאִיר בָּטְלוּ מוֹשְׁלֵי מְשָׁלִים. מִשֶּׁמֵּת בֶּן עַזַּאי בָּטְלוּ הַשַּׁקְדָנִים. מִשֶּׁמֵּת בֶּן זוֹמָא בָּטְלוּ הַדַּרְשָׁנִים. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בָּטַל כְּבוֹד הַתּוֹרָה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא בָּטְלוּ אַנְשֵׁי מַעֲשֶׂה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי יוֹסֵי קְטֹנְתָּא פָּסְקוּ חֲסִידִים. וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ ״קְטֹנְתָּא״ — שֶׁהָיָה קְטֹנְתָּא שֶׁל חֲסִידִים.
sentences.human_translation: From when Rabbi Meir died, those who relate parables ceased; from when ben Azzai died, the diligent ceased; from when ben Zoma died, the exegetists ceased; from when Rabbi Akiva died, the honor of the Torah ceased; from when Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa died, the men of action ceased; from when Rabbi Yosei the Small died, the pious were no more. And why was he called the Small? Because he was the smallest of the pious,
sentences.llm_translation: From the words of Rabbi Meir, it was said that the interpreters of parables were silenced. From the words of Ben Azai, it was said that the sages were silenced. From the words of Rabbi Akiva, it was said that the honor of the Torah was nullified. From the words of Rabbi Hanina ben Dosa, it was said that men of deed were silenced. From the words of Rabbi Yosi Ketona, it was said that pious ones were silenced. And why is he called "Ketona" - because he was a Ketona, which is the Ketona of pious ones. (

sentences.text: מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי בָּטַל זִיו הַחׇכְמָה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַזָּקֵן בָּטַל כְּבוֹד הַתּוֹרָה, וּמֵתָה טׇהֳרָה וּפְרִישׁוּת. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן פִּאָבִי בָּטְלָה זִיו הַכְּהוּנָּה. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבִּי בָּטְלָ[ה] עֲנָוָה וְיִרְאַת חֵטְא.
sentences.human_translation: From when Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai died, the glory of wisdom ceased; from when Rabban Gamliel the Elder died, the honor of the Torah ceased, and purity and asceticism died. From when Rabbi Yishmael ben Pavi died, the glory of the priesthood ceased; from when Rabbi died, humility and fear of sin ceased.
sentences.llm_translation: From the death of Rabbi Yochanan ben Zakai, the wisdom ceased. From the death of Rabbi Gamliel the Elder, the honor of the Torah ceased, and purity and separation ceased. From the death of Rabbi Yishmael ben Pazi, the wisdom of the kingdom ceased. From the death of Rabbi insert name, humility and fear of sin ceased.

sentences.text: [ גְּמָ׳ ] תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: רַבִּי פִּנְחָס בֶּן יָאִיר אוֹמֵר: מִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ בּוֹשׁוּ חֲבֵרִים וּבְנֵי חוֹרִין, וְחָפוּ רֹאשָׁם, וְנִדַּלְדְּלוּ אַנְשֵׁי מַעֲשֶׂה, וְגָבְרוּ בַּעֲלֵי זְרוֹעַ וּבַעֲלֵי לָשׁוֹן, וְאֵין דּוֹרֵשׁ וְאֵין מְבַקֵּשׁ וְאֵין שׁוֹאֵל,
sentences.human_translation: The Sages taught: Rabbi Pineḥas ben Ya’ir says: From when the Temple was destroyed, the ḥaverim and free men were ashamed, and their heads were covered and men of action dwindled, and violent and smooth-talking men gained the upper hand, and none seek, and none ask, and none inquire
sentences.llm_translation: Gemara Our Rabbis taught: Rabbi Pinchas ben Yair says: When the Temple was destroyed, they would gather friends and sons of priests, and cover their heads, and engage in manual labor, and strengthen themselves with men of action, and with owners of strength and tongues, and there is no one seeking, no one asking, no one entreating,

sentences.text: עַל מִי לָנוּ לְהִשָּׁעֵן עַל אָבִינוּ שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם.
sentences.human_translation: Upon whom for us to rely? upon our Father in Heaven.
sentences.llm_translation: On whom shall we rely, on our Father in Heaven? (

sentences.text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ שָׁרוֹ חַכִּימַיָּא לְמֶהֱוֵי כְּסָפְרַיָּא, וְסָפְרַיָּא כְּחַזָּנַיָּא, וְחַזָּנַיָּא כְּעַמָּא דְאַרְעָא, וְעַמָּא דְאַרְעָא
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: From the day the Temple was destroyed, Scholars have begun to become like scribes and scribes have become like beadles, and beadles have become like ignoramuses, and ignoramuses
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer HaGadol says: From the day that the Temple was destroyed, I have been reckoning the years like a scribe, and the scribe like a witness, and the witness like the land itself, and the land itself like the Torah.
